Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Xpistiva
Reviews.Content: We choose H10 Marina Hotel for a romantic 4 days city break in Barcelona at the end of March (an excellent period to visit this town, the weather is superb). From the T2 Barcelona terminal you can travel easy and cheap to Placa Espagna and take a Metro from there to Bogatell ( 3 stops) - from this station, the Hotel is 2 streets away, a 5 min walk. Also, the Barcelona City Tour Bus has a stop very close to the hotel so, if you intend to buy tickets for city sightseeing, better choose this company). Our room, although a simple double one, was very friendly, clean, the matresses were comfortable, the bathroom clean and nice. We didn't try the hotel SPA or the outside pool area ( it looks very good on the top of the hotel but in March you can't use it). The breakfast was rich, with all kind of food, fruits, sweets and you can choose to take it at the lounge area which is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Thin on many levels”
Reviews.Author: drlpc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to Pompeu Fabra University as well as the beach, and the breakfast buffet is expansive and quite good. But the hallway carpets are threadbare in places, the room curtains are thin so one gets light pollution all night long, the windows are thin so you hear traffic noise no matter how high up you are in the hotel, and the thin walls allow you to share in whatever joy or misery your next-door neighbors might be experiencing. It seems to be popular with families, and so the computers in the Business Center tend to be occupied by adolescents glued to their Facebook pages from late afternoon onwards. But hotel staff are friendly and fairly efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, let down by no aircon!”
Reviews.Author: BeeB0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approximately 20 mins from the airport and should cost approx 30 Euros in a taxi. The hotel itself is very nice, with a good bar area and excellent breakfast. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and willing to help with restaurant bookings, directions etc. we were offered a glass of cava on arrival which was also a nice touch. The rooms are thoroughly cleaned daily (I came back one day to find the maid in the bath really scrubbing it clean) the only disappointment is that the aircon did not work and the rooms were extremely hot at night, we did hear several people complaining at reception and were told it wasn't turned on until mid April, which is poor when a hotel is advertised as having aircon. The rooftop pool is nice, but shaded in the afternoons and the water is very cold, the hotel has a gym, but it is very small with 3 machines and some weights, you could not fit more than 3 people in there at one time. There is also an option of using the Spa for 16 Euros per session, but I did not use this so cannot comment. The hotel is a 10 - 15min walk from the Marina’s bars and restaurants and approx 5 min walk to Bogatell metro station or 20 minute walk to Marina metro station. At the stations be sure to buy a T10 ticket for 9.25 Euros which gets you 10 separate trips and can be used between a group of people. Generally a nice clean hotel, but let down on my stay by the unavailability of air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great family suites”
Reviews.Author: Clare C
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room, panoramic views, and massive LCD TV, Jacuzzi bath and Nespresso coffee maker.Good spot, just a few minutes walk from Port Olympic or metro. Also only 10 minutes walk to the zoo. Excellent breakfast, unbelievable amount of choice, good coffee and orange juice, not the usual watery stuff you sometimes get in hotels. Even had a section for diabetics/diet.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abigail_11
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a mini break in Barcelona and we had the best time! The hotel was lovely and in a good location, a 10 minute walk from the marina with its restaurants and bars. But the hotel was what made my husband and my stay, we upgraded to a junior suite on arrival and it's was great, a huge balcony where you can sit and enjoy the sun. An enormous bed, well stocked minibar. I could go on, but the helpful staff, great facilities and beautiful hotel made our first mini break without the kids a luxurious treat! With special thanks to the lovely Alberto the bar man.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 51-John
Reviews.Content: Arrived for three nights at the H10, with mixed feelings after reading various different reviews, most of the feedback was accurate but I did not find any problems with the hotel. Check in was straightforward and yes - they did ask you to pay up front for everything, but usually they take an imprint of your hotel so nothing really changes. Unfortunately I was late arriving 23:30 (french air traffic control again....) and did not get offered a glass of champagne. Room on the 8th floor looking inwards, so no real view, room was adequate, nice bath room, tv channels were limited and I did not try the wifi, I get enough of that at work, room service and mini bar prices as expected, after a day or two if you were on business your choices would be limited; but come on you are in Barcelona so you should not be thinking about staying in or even eating the hotel - get out and enjoy. Breakfast was not included I tried first morning and yes very impressive, I wish I had more time to give it justice, so recommendation if you want a quick bite don't spend 15 euros, but if you have an hour for a liesurely breakfast treat yourself, you deserve it. In summary, yes I'd go back, no real complaints - enjoyed the stay, but I was on business so not paying

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 * hotel for visiting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AlexGent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for 4 nights. The hotel is situated near port Olympic and the beach, about 10 min walk. The Metro station Bogatell is a 5 min walk. Ideal retreat after a day in crowdy Barcelona. Rooms are in a contemporary style, breakfast is enormous with about 150 varities of food. Staff friendly and helpfull. Insonorisation could be a problem for some people. Price is more then ok, would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: fumezlafafa
Reviews.Content: Everyone of the staff in this hotel will bend over backwards to help you. Hotel location is in a quiet area of the city which is great at night time as you can enjoy your city break even more. Beds are a bit hard but had worse. English TV stations non existant in our room during our stay "surprise surprise". Breakfast on the other hand amazing value for money. Thank You for a great stay and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location..”
Reviews.Author: Pen3709
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay here and chose it from the Trip Advisor comments. The location is perfect for the Metro & Marina being just 5-10 mins walk from the Hotel. The room was lovely but the bed was rock hard and the walls are 'thin'. We could hear the neighbours moving around, showering etc. Breakfast selection is perfect. Something for everyone and no waiting around! We didn't sample the dinner menu but heard it was very good quality. Sadly, the weather during our stay was 'rubbish' so we didn't get to use the pool on the 8th floor but it looks lovely and there is ample seating and a bar. Big downside is that during the bad weather, we decided to use the indoor pool but at a cost of €16 per head!!!decided against it. Really think that is a rip off especially as we only wanted to have a quick swim! All in all, a decent hotel but has a few weak points.

Reviews.Title: “Good but some weak points”
Reviews.Author: Jinwook C
Reviews.Content: In short it must be a good hotel, but I have to tell about shortcomings. First you should be careful about the sound from the next room. First night I barely slept because of guys' talk continuing until 4AM in the morning. Room is not enough well sound protected indeed. Second beds are hard to enjoy sleep. Some make noise when you move. Third network is very week. However, one amazing thing is its breakfast. I never seen such a various and plentiful of food buffet in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IDO69
Reviews.Content: very good, well maintened, cleen, good brackfest, cloas to the marina, casino, metro and tourist bus

Reviews.Title: “Excellence, at low price...”
Reviews.Author: klaus680
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at this hotel for some days...everything is just perfect...excellent service, friendly hotel personnel, always trying to help their customers. The hotel is not far from the city center, you can easily walk (15-20 minutes) or by metro. It's a very modern hotel, well equipped with everything you may need, rooms are large and very confortable. Try the internal restaurant: food is just awesome! We will stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of February 2012 - clean and modern hotel with well equipped bathroom & good shower. Location was fine - 5 mins from metro but 10 mins to beach, 30 mins leisurely walk through beautiful park to city centre old town. Didn't eat at hotel but bar prices reasonable with great selection of wine. Found small cafe bar nearby for breakfast as didn't fancy full works! Service friendly - will definitely return to this hotel in future.

Reviews.Title: “A business trip - but a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Benno5
Reviews.Content: Even for a business trip of 3 nights this was an easy 10-15 minute walk to the beach and Arts Hotel area. The room was suprisingly large with huge double and plenty of room. I was on the 10th floor at the rear and also got a great view of the top of the Sagrida Familia - bonus as I didn't have time to visit it :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great for the beach - and the city”
Reviews.Author: Geoff D
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room on the 6th floor for 4 nights in March 2012. Nice and quiet at night, clean room with all the usual services. Very welcoming and friendly staff. Fantastic buffet breakfast to set us up for the day. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk to the marina with its many restaurants, casino and beaches either side. 10 minutes to the park (and zoo) and a further 20 to Las Ramblas. Roof-top pool on 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic food, good location and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-Jayne W
Reviews.Content: HOTEL: Clean rooms, not massive but not too small as some reviews have suggested! Mini bar (prices are a bit much as can be expected from a mini bar!) Bathroom comes equiped with hair dryer, boxed tissues, toothbrush, shower cap, moisturiser, shower gel, shampoo, razor, shoe shiner (random, I know!), comb and two soaps (and a soap dish!!) Safe is free - a real bonus as I don't know anybody who doesn't put their passports and things in them during their stay!! Beds are massive, two singles pushed together I think - but most places do that now - and it didn't cause a problem at all. I emailed the week prior to my stay to request a higher level end room as these tend to be a bit bigger and quiter - the only downside was the air con didn't work, however the heating did! Also, there was no balcony - bare this in mind if you're someone who likes to share a bottle of wine on the balcony and watch the world go by! The rooftop pool would be lovely in summer - too cold in March despite temperatures of 20/21 degrees! The pool was FREEZING (I had to dip my toes in!) but if you're there for a weekend break I doubt you'll hvae time for the pool anyway! The bar was nice, bar man was lovely, Cava was quite cheap to buy -12 euros a botttle )but 14 in the rest =/ ) and about 3.50 a glass, larger was quite expensive though around 5 euros for local larger!! Food in the rest was beautiful!!! And staff wonderful - very attentive!!! Beautiful water feature downstairs in the wine cellar/dining hall with a grand piano - nice touch!! Can't comment on the Spa facillities as I didn't use them! The only bad thing about this hotel was air con not working and our room wasn't cleaned! We left the room at 8am hanging the 'please clean the room' sign and returned at 6pm after about 10 mins house keeping staff knocked on the door and asked if we wanted anything! It's not that big of a hotel, working in one myself for many years, and travelling a lot - I know it should have been done by this time! HOWEVER, I was only there two nights so I am unsure whether or not this was just a one off! LOCATION: The location is IDEAL, as long as you don't mind a short walk! It is not in the centre of the main square of Catalunya but is central to all the attractions collectivelly! 10 mins from the beach, 10 mins from the zoo (well worth a visit - 17 euros), 10 mins from the (beautiful) park, about 15/20 mins to the Arc, 20/30 mins to La Rambles and Playa Catalunya, The cathedral is about 30 mins but if you're up for the walk it is litterally straight up one road - you will see on the map given to you at reception! if you really don't like the walk - there is a 'Barcelona sightseeing' bus (the red open top ones you see in every city!) that stops every 15 mins 2 mins from the hotel, (24 euros for one day, 31 for two) there is a big list at the bus stop of the attractions that you can see, we didn't use this and felt like we seen loads but may use it next time to make sure we see everything!! There are also two metro stations a short walk away! Bogatell is about 3 mins away and the Marina station about 7/8! These have connections to everywhere! You can get a single anywhere in Barcelona for 2 euros!! Which brings me to my next point: Getting around: Taxi's, well, from the airport there is no saying how much it will cost you, from other reviews I was expecting around 28/29 euros - but no, we were quoted around 35-40! The meter when as we were arriving said 25 and magically the next is said 37!! The driver then pretended not to speak ANY English (even pointed at the meter 'trying' to say the numbers) even though he had NO difficulty understanding and answering us when we asked how much it would be - I'm assuming it was because we were young! The only reason we got a taxi was because it was 8pm! There is a train from terminal 2 at the airport that can get you to Bogatell station for TWO euros! 37 euros to get there 4 for us both to get back! There are two changes mind! One at Sants, then the L1 line to Catalunya (the first stop!) and then Catalunya to either Marina or Bogatell. OR From sants to the Arc (about a 10 min walk form the hotel) if you're like me and this all sounds a bit too much for when you first arive, save all that until the journey home when you are familiar with the surroundings - it's easier than it sounds - you get a train map! But I would seriously get the train to Sants and get a taxi from there - SO much cheaper!! Sants and Catalunya both have excelent English speaking staff that are really helpful! Taxi's and the metro can get you anywhere but I'd recommend the walk - was lovely (and hopefully burned off a few calories from all that wonderful food!!) Overall a fantastic stay, would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Els H
Reviews.Content: + rooms were very clean and big enough + friendly staff + the breakfast was super!! Tasty, fresh, tremendous choice possible - hotel was not centrally located but the metro was a walk of 300m away

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: DeuxCarr
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was in an ideal situation with the beach a short walk away and metro stations an even shorter walk away. The staff were really helpful though we did have one gripe in that they tried to insist on us paying the bill in full on arrival, even though they had taken our credit card details. That's a first for us! Yes the spa and indoor pool cost extra (I think it's €15) but we didn't come to Barcelona for that so it didn't affect us. There is a rooftop pool with lovely views of the city but unheated so didn't dip my toes in with it being the end of February. The breakfast is amazing with food on nearly 3 sides of the room so absolutely loads of choice for everyone. For us it was included in the room rate and I don't honestly know if we would have paid €15 each for it as there are plenty of places outside that you could choose to eat and watch the world go by. The room was fine; quite small but with windows that open so that was a nice change. We wandered down to Barceloneta each night to eat which was lovely and a lot less touristy than the Marina/La Rambla areas. Then after dinner we went and had drinks in one of the many bars open late at the Marina so there really is something for everyone. Therefore we didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but had a couple of drinks at the bar and the barman is great. Friendly, good at his job and makes you feel welcome. The taxi from the airport was €28 yet the trip back (on a Sunday) was €35 despite less traffic. Having read other reports on transport, we would definintely opt for the metro/bus combination next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brazililli
Reviews.Content: Loved the room. Stayed on 8th floor, I believe...tiny view of the ocean but mostly rooftops. loved the location because you are super close to ocean and running trails and you are also close to city, la Rambla, metro, parks, Arc de Triumf and more...Nice grocery store across the street, off of Avinguda Bagatell. The internet kept going out but a nice boy came to the room to fix it. Room service was pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: rhoda f
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner where in Spain for only a weekend but we were made to feel so welcome. Staff extremely friendly and helpful with directions etc... The rooms were clean and beds made for the duration of the trip. Hotel was not in a central location but there was a metro close by.

Reviews.Title: “A groupon special, next time would book it all myself!”
Reviews.Author: Darren H
Reviews.Content: ** Read this bit if you are thinking of visiting Barcelona via a Groupon offer ** First off, this hotel was provided through a Groupon deal, which on the face of it looked really good, £169 per person for 2 nights in a 4* hotel in Barcelona with flights included and a 2 course meal and soft drink in the hard rock cafe. When you start to dig deeper though its a bit of a con, for one we had to fly from a London Airport and we live in Bristol so that made things more expensive, then when I looked into it we could have flown from Bristol for marginally more than the cost from Gatwick (where we decided to fly from) and the company that offered the deal were very crafy in only offering you late flights on the day of departure and early flights on the day of return. They were 'kind enough' to offer you other potential flights to allow you to spend more time in Barcelona but this was at an additional surcharge of £40 or more - very crafty! The next thing was the price of the hotel, on the documentation from the holiday provider (clear skies holidays I believe) they found us the rooms through getabed.co.uk which quoted the room prices at rates which seemed pretty high to me - upon going to the H10 marina website myself and typing in the dates we were staying the room rate was considerably cheaper than the rate that had supposedly been paid through getabed. Also the groupon deal did not include breakfast at the hotel this was an extra 15E per day. This was not a major issue as we quite like to sleep in and eat breakfast at our leisure but something to bear in mind if you like to have breakfast included. The hard rock cafe meal was decent, although only includes a soft drink and you can only pick from a set menu of about 5 main courses and an ice cream pudding. We spent 40E on alcoholic drinks in there alone so they definitely made their money back off us. On doing my sums, I worked it out that I could have booked the same holiday to fly from Bristol for at least 100Euros cheaper and still had the meal in hard rock cafe choosing from the full menu rather than the gold one they give you to pick from. So to cut a long story short, before you book a holiday on groupon, look into the flight costs and booking up the hotel yourself as you will more than likely find that you can book everything much cheaper than quoted on groupon. But anyway... I will now give a quick review of the hotel since thats what I'm supposed to be reviewing! ** Read here for Hotel Review ** This hotel is in a brilliant location, in fact one of the best locations you could choose in my opinion. Its about a 10 minute walk from the beach which is really pleasant and well maintained. Maybe it would not be as nice in summer with loads of people on it but in February we saw about 15 people as far as the eye could see and being English a temperature of above 12C is practically beach weather anyway! Dont get me wrong it was cold but when we left England it was -3C so the extra 15 degrees makes a huge difference. If you were in direct sunlight you could be quite warm in just jeans, a tshirt and a sweater. Local amenities wise the hotel was fairly close to 2 supermarkets which were OK but the best place to get food and booze is Mercandona. Some of the staff in the hotel can tell you where it is (although one receptionist had never even heard of Mercandona) Its just a little bit further from the two closest supermarkets by the Marina metro station but they do much nicer food and have a better selection of cheap alcohol which despite the price is really pleasant to drink - I brought back 7 bottles of really good cava for £10! For getting around in Barcelona I would recommend the Metro, there are 2 stations close to the hotel, Bogatell (the closest) which goes along the yellow line to most of the places in the centre and then there is the Marina station which is a little bit further but has more lines going much further around the city. A single journey to anywhere costs 2E, and for the time it takes its well worth that. Taxis in Barcelona are everywhere, easily recognisable by the yellow and black colour scheme and they all run on meters but if you want to save yourself a lot of money use the metro when you can its loads cheaper. Our taxi from the airport to the hotel cost 29E. One of the friendly staff at the hotel adivsed us that for the journey back to the airport we should get the metro from Marina to Castella Pl (I think thats the name of it) and get the easily recognisable blue and white Aerobus which only costs 5.50E. We did exactly this and it worked out at just about half the price of the taxi (2E for metro + 5.50E for bus) x 2 = 15E. The bus journey took about 25 minutes. One thing I should mention is that the Aerobus goes to both terminals at the airport and without checking we got dropped off at terminal 1 when we needed to be at terminal 2. There is a free shuttle bus which runs regularly which got us to terminal 2 just in the nick of time. Keep this in mind if you are thinking of getting the Aerobus! One last thing, if you fly with Easyjet from terminal 2, they are right at the end of the airport in gate C, you literally have to walk ages to get there and the signs in the airport do not make it at all obvious where you have to go. Hope someone finds this useful as we nearly missed our flight trying to find gate C. Its almost like the airport has based Easyjet right out in the sticks, make sure you give yourself a good 30 minutes extra to find the gate and check in desk - you'll need it! As I mentioned earlier the hotel charges separately for breakfast (which may not appeal to some) but personally I think 15E a day is really steep anyway and we were quite happy to venture out and find something to eat ourselves for cheaper. As we never tried any of the food at the hotel I cant comment on what its like, but the restaurant did seem quite posh looking so you would expect the food to not be cheap and horrible. The staff in the hotel were a mixed bunch, most of them were very helpful and friendly but one or two others did a very good job of making you feel like you were interrupting them from something really important. On the whole though the team on reception were helpful and spoke english well enough to save you from trying to communicate in broken spanish. The rooms are quite smart and clean (or at least ours was), the air con did take a while to warm up the room but at least it did work. The room had a safe which was free, and a big flatscreen TV which offered mostly spanish and catalan TV stations. Word of warning there is no 'on' button on the TV, after looking for about 20 minutes I finally figured out that the on button is actually a switch on the wall by the bathroom! The bathroom was clean and practical, nice marble type floors with a bath/shower combo, toilet, bday and free toiletries including a shower cap, razor, toothbrush and paste and the usual shower gel, shampoo and soap. Only thing that did hack me off about the room was that there is no tea or coffee making facilities, being English I like the chance to make tea at all times and I had been saving a pot noodle since I got off the plane and lo and behold there was no kettle in the room! On the plus side it did have a mini bar fridge which was good for storing the cava we bought at the local supermarket so that we had a nice cold alcoholic drink to start our evenings with! No idea what any of the stuff in the mini bar cost but unless you like to waste money just buy any drinks and snacks in the local supermarkets - it has to be loads cheaper! The beds in the room are very hard - not a problem for me as I prefer that to some super soft squidgy matress but might not be for everyone. Our double bed was actually two singles pushed together which most hotels seem to do these days - it was ok but beware of rolling onto the ridge between both beds which is not very comfortable to spend the night on. All in all though I slept really well every night - the pillows provided are really comfortable goose feather or something like that and for me the pillow is generally more important than the matress but thats my preference. Finally I should mention the swimming pools, there is a roof pool which as far as I could tell is free but is NOT heated. The view from the roof is really impressive and definitely worth a look, I would expect that in the summer the roof pool would be amazing, but in February the pool was absolutely freezing and there was no way any sane person would want to swim in it! The downstairs leisure/relaxation centre was another story, we knew we had to pay separately for it and initially I thought 15E was really expensive just to go swimming, but it was actually really nice down there. The combination of small swimming pool, warm tub and warm shower pool was really nice (note I call them warm - they were far from hot!). The steam room and sauna were very toasty though and the whole facility was warm with padded sun loungers around the main room. Both me and my partner lay down on one of the loungers for just a few minutes and both of us fell asleep... definitely relaxing down there! So in summary although the price tag seems a bit steep I'd recommend going to the leisure facility in the hotel at least one day. Its well worth it if you spend at least a couple of hours down there. Overall really liked this hotel and would definitely stay there again, only thing I would do different is to book it myself and not bother with any groupon holidays, its definitely cheaper to do it yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with panoramic windows”
Reviews.Author: vkovr
Reviews.Content: We got beautiful room with panoramic windows. Nespresso coffee mashine in the room. The hotel resembles for married couples. Quiet place. Not far from a city beach and park. Minuses – expensive price. A very bad noise isolation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1steffieweffie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a good deal, the hotel looked fantastic, staff were very helpful. W stayed in a standard room and it was clean and spacious, only problem being, was that the beds were incredibly hard and not comfy at all. Didn't eat in the hotel so cant comment, we looked into using the spa and was shocked to find we had to pay 16 euros a visit! Never stayed in a hotel anywhere where you had to pay, we paid anyway and it was an amazing spa but just a shame about the price. It probably would be a lot better if you got charged 16 euro for your entire stay instead of per visit to the spa, or even better that it was free!! That is the only fault i could find, the area wasn't the most spectacular area but transport was close by and frequent, close to the marina and a few little shops/bars. The Bar inside the hotel was fantastically priced considering how much most hotels charge, great service too!! Overall, would without a doubt stay here again and recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the beach”
Reviews.Author: GSavage21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and it was perfect for a weekend break. It is close to the Olympic marina and about a 10 min bus ride or 30 min walk into the centre of Barcelona. It would be a great base for a holiday in higher season as literally 10 mins to the sea. Buffet breakfast was good if included in the price. Rooms lovely very clean and big comfy beds

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems”
Reviews.Author: burrito_of_london
Reviews.Content: I paid 300€ but I had many issues. First, internet was not working in my room. I had to deal for one hour with the IT manager who thought my laptop was the problem. They gave me a new room. Second, I could the neighbor talking in my new room. I could understand his conversation... Impossible to work. I complained again, and the reception said all the rooms were like that (??!). Does it mean that when you pay 300€ you should expect to learn about the life of your neighbor? My third room was ok...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: angelafataha
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at a Junior Suite very spacious and also we got a Jacuzzi. Firstly we booked a Standard Room the standard Room was so small and not our cup of tea. If you book this hotel book the Junior Suite with Buffet Breakfast you get the privilege room for free with Junior Suites. You get to have your own mini bar and have as much drinks as you like for free throughout the whole day there is also a TV and PS3 in the Privilege room. Your stay will not be so great if you stay in a standard room. The Buffet Breakfast was great so much selection so much too choose. Location of hotel is not the greatest 5 min walk to Bogtell Station is closest station and Marina station maybe 10 minutes walk. Easiest way to travel and cheapest would be to buy the tourist travel card 3 days or more from tourist office in airport only. There is not much of anything near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, a little rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Akketje
Reviews.Content: Great location for business in marina area. Excellent value for your money. Close to metro bogatell. Some rooms have a nice terrace. Terrible wifi connection in the room, but it's for free. Clean room with safe and minibar, but the bed is not comfy-too hard! Did not try the spa. Breakfast buffet is elaborate but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better.”
Reviews.Author: aljooniite
Reviews.Content: Started at the reception. Not too much friendly staff. In the end somehow managed to deal with the situation... The rooms were kinda small and very dusty. Every morning we woke up covered in dust. Strange! When we came before dinner we ordered meel, wich came out cold...! First night we went to the restaurant for dinner and again disapointment - the food is cold! So the next coming days we decided to spend less time in the hotel. For 4* the service could be better!

Reviews.Title: “well located, but very average and some rude staff”
Reviews.Author: chornayakoshka
Reviews.Content: reception mostly miserable and do the minimum required - although all speak excellent english rooms - like a UK travel lodge but overheated and only way to cool them down is by opening windows and putting up with street noise. Unless you like your bedroom to be min 23C... beds - very hard but was managed to sleep okish due to lots of sight seeing food - buffet breakfast caters for all tastes and you can eat several courses if you want to put off lunch til later. Although there is a strange sign stating that you will be charged extra for any food removed from dining room - first time seen a sign like that... Dinner - we ate one evening in restaurant and food was surprisingly good, with local dishes freshly prepared, there is a set 3 course dinnner for 27 Euro or choose from a la carte or a 55Euro taster menu, we also had snack from bar which was also good. Bar staff friendliest - made a nice change from receptionists. Location - excellent slightly out of centre with metro and buses stopping very close by if you can't face the walk into the centre. Bus from few hundred yards from hotel (no 10) takes you direct to Sagrada Familia, or you can walk the approx 11 blocks. Nearest metro takes you directly to the centre and the old port. Overall OK, although as was there to celebrate a special birthday had hoped for something a bit more atmospheric, this was really anodine and the staff did little to improve on this. But for a clean modern well located base then it did meet our needs.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: cadra
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending New Year at the H10 and were very disappointed with the hotels location and the attitude of the staff. We booked a double room and requested a high floor, on arriving we were given a twin room on the second floor. When we complained the front desk staff were very unhelpful and we were told the hotel was fully booked and there were no other rooms available. Although the room was clean it was quite small but the continuous noise from other rooms and from people in the area in front of the hotel became very annoying. The hotel is in the middle of a very run down housing area which appears to attract some very unsavoury people. Transport was difficult and taxi's arranged by the hotel were much more expensive than those to could find yourself. We ordered food the bar for lunch and when it arrived it was badly presented and almost thrown at us. I know that this is a bust time of year but the attitude of the staff was very poor. Barcelona itself was magical apart from the high levels of street crime which was clearly evident. This was our second trip to the City and the increase in opportunist crime in the last 12 months was evident. All in all this is not a hotel that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Some people’s expectations are too high”
Reviews.Author: garyglondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great little jem. It's true that you don't step straight out on to Las Ramblas, but it is within walking distance as is Port Olympic and Sagrada Familia. It's not a hotel for the traveller who like to live it up in 5 star opulance with a 2 star budget but it has a moden feel with very attentitive staff for a great price. We arrived at 11am on New Years Eve and were in our room within 5 minutes, map in had, internet code and a welcome letter detailing all the opening times (much better than being told then forgetting) Our room was 307, big enough for 2 with everything that you would expect. One slight point with the television is that a better selection of channels is available if you press Channel Menu rather than scrolling through them - i'm not sure if it has been set up properly. The immediate area isn't gleaming Barcelona, instead it has pleanty of authentic places around to have a quick bite and drink, supermarkets, pharmacies etc. Port Olympic is just over a 5 minute walk (easy to find - just head for the big white tower in front of the hotel) where you'll find some more trendy places to hang out. We got a good deal on the hotel, booked together with flights. Delighted with the result. However if you want more style over substance with the hotel and area then there are many other hotels who'll take 5 times more euros from you - I doubt you'll find it that much better though!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a good 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: astons
Reviews.Content: litle out of the main part of town but quite walkable. Reasonably near the marina which is lovely. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation with a spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: solanki_uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in peaceful area away from city centre but very easy to get to anywhere. A walking disance to port olympic and casino. Very close to Nightclubs if you are a party animal. We went clubbing daily and drinks are very reasonable. Being vegetarians the Hotel catered for us as we had opted for bed and breakfast but the breakfast had a wide variety to both veg and non veg and definately had a filling breakfast daily with fresh food. The bar at reception is best place to chill in the evenign for hot drinks and alcohol. The pool is on 8th floor with a beautiful view of barcelona but since it was cold we didnt use that area. The Spa is amazing and should definately give a go for 16euro for wellness access a day and massage was very relaxing. The hotel is very close to Marina Metro train station which takes you straight into city centre pl.catayluna by 3rd stop. Barcelona card is the most helpful tool and will save you alot of money and can be used on trains and buss and trams. The Zoo is very close to hotel about 10mins walk and the local bus stop is right behind the hotel. If stuck always aks the friendly receptionist and they are very helpful and everyone speaks english which made it very easy for us. The are a number of indian cuisines esp one near urgtell station called namaste and wide selection of chinese and italian, mexican cuisine near port olympic. Going aroudn barcelona is not difficult at all and ensure you have a map so incase if you do miss your way you can always track you self or otherwise catch a cab and show your hotel card. The airport is very close to hotel and does not cost much about 30eur or you can take a bus or train to pl.catayluna and then change for metro red line to marina and walk to hotel (max journey time 30mins). Ensure you visit las ramblas for touristic shopping but beware of pick pockets. Cable ride was also amazing as well as go-cars and sightseeing by cruise. Ocerall the H10 Hotel was very neat and had very helful staff and offered a very high speed free wifi internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: I booked this via Hotwire when I was searching for 4 star hotels in Barcelona. the price was reasonable (65 e / night) but it turned out that the hotel is far from being a 4 star hotel! More like 2 or 3 star hotel. The worst thing was that the walls were extremely thin and even normal speech and TV sounds were very easily heard through the walls. Also there was only one glass in the window which let some noise through from the street. Someone mentioned here about the homeless people - and yes - they were still there yelling and making noise even in the middle of the night! So if you want to go to sleep early or have a difficult time falling in sleep with noises, this is not the place for you. The spa was ok, but was closed in one night when it was supposed to be open because "it was a special day". The pool was smaller than you would imagine from the images. The restaurant was also usually empty. Pretty expensive and slow service. The wifi was very poor in our room but it was free. the metro station was nearby and there was a gas station right in front of the hotel from where we bought beer and snacks. We couldn't find any supermarket nearby and the closest pizza restaraunt was around the corner and there was a pharmaceut across the street. The location is a little off but manageable. The airconditioning was not enabled because of the winter time and sometimes the room was hot but it was easily overcome by opening the window (and listening noises :) ) We didn't get any welcoming drinks when we arrived. This is a ok hotel but definitely not a four star hotel! I wouldn't recommend this hotel because of the thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at edge of dodgy looking area”
Reviews.Author: Remarx
Reviews.Content: Arrived in early afternoon via nearby Bogatell metro station and was taken aback at the deserted streets, vacant offices, and graffiti daubed walls. However area fronting the hotel was a better area. Apart from Metro found the No.14 bus convenient to and from La Rambla. Hotel rooms are clean, new and well equipped. Only complaint being that at check-in was kept waiting over an hour when told room would be ready in 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travellers requiring to be connected”
Reviews.Author: Andy W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a joke if you are on a business trip. Very slow WiFi in the rooms - if you manage yo get a connection at all, that is. Asking for a cable at the reception (there is a network jack in the room), I was given a telephone cable instead of a network cable and asking for the correct one receptionist answered that was the only one he could find. He also told me that I would have to go to the lobby if I wanted to have a decent connection as everywhere in the hotel rooms it was the same... Moving my stuff into the lobby area didn't really help much as the connection was indeed better - but the constant connection interruptions and generally extremely slow network made a quick work task last for about 4 hours, till 3am... Currently sitting in a Starbucks at the Marina and just did the same task in half an hour... Staff (talked to two receptionists) very rude, business facilities (also the business centre which offers desktop computers which obviously use the same network and therefore are pointless) a joke. Beds are very uncomfortable as well, at least that's my opinion after one night's sleep. My back hurts massively. Hadn't a client booked it for me, I would have left this night and checked in to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine H
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a residential area, this may not suit all but we found it nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. The Bogtell Metro is about 5 minutes walk, here you can take a train to the city centre. We purchased a 10 trip ticked which we used over 4 days, this was excellent value. The Marina is about a 10 minute walk where you will find plenty of places to eat and the walk back is a nice way to walk of a meal. We read up on the reviews on this site and asked our travel agent to email the Hotel with the request of a quite room with sea view, on the 6th or 7th (not the 8th) Floor. We received a room in the far corner on the 10th Floor. You could just see the Sea to the far left with a lovely view over Barcelona to the Cathedral to the far right. Room was nice, conformable, clean and compact. Please note there are No tea or coffee facilities in the room. The buffet breakfast was very good with many choices. Hot drinks are by machine, you get a cup of hot water for tea, they do Twinning’s tea, we took our own tea bags so choice is yours. Check out was at midday but as we had a late flight the Hotel did have a safe place to store our cases so we didn’t have to carry them about this was very useful. On arrival at the airport we took a taxi which cost 27 Euros which was quite reasonable. So on leaving the Hotel we asked them to arrange a taxi for us this cost was 41 Euros !!! There was already 4 Euros on the meter when we go into it !! Umm advise anyone else to get own taxi from up the road. All in all enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: milmol_7
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona, and with all the hotels on offer, we couldnt really have chosen better than the H10 Marina. Once we had our bearings, the hotel was a 5 minute walk to the Metro station. Having said that, after a couple of days we realised it was equally feasible to walk around anyway. Its 10 minutes walk to the beach/marina for restaurants etc in one direction, its about 20 minutes in another direction to the old town, (through the fantastic Parc Ciutadella) and one day we walked back from the Sagrada Familia which took about 40 minutes steady walk. Everywhere is well lit and the walks back from the old town and Marina at night both felt safe and comfortable. The room was really nicely done out, very modern and looked very recently refurbished. There was a safe, hairdryer, tv with english channels!, lots of toiletries, minibar if you wanted it. Huge bed was really comfortable for a great nights sleep to recover from the day! Reception staff were excellent, very pleasant and able to answer all questions about metro, distances, maps, internet usage etc. Our rate included breakfast which was quite amazing in terms of the choice and quality of everything on offer. It's buffet style and literally every cuisine is catered for. We didn't use the restaurant or bar though. If we return to Barcelona we will definitely be checking for the best rates at this hotel as it was ideal for us in every way. It even had a spa/fitness and pool facilities which again we didn't use this time but looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Alice D
Reviews.Content: Junior suite very nice, big big bed and confortable. Near the subway Bogatell, 5 minutes by foot. Quiet area. Very good stay, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “pool!!”
Reviews.Content: spent ages checking out lots of hotels in barcelona for our first weekend break there. we wanted a pool/outside area to relax after sightseeing, h10 marina was one of the few with this advantage. we had a great weekend, didnt mind be a little out of the centre as it was nice to come back and sit by the pool. rooms, food, drink, service all perfect. would definitely recommend this hotel for someone who likes to sightsee and relax!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings.”
Reviews.Author: Ulysse_Oscar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 8 days at the beginning of november. The location is quite excellent in a rather decent residential area. It is away from the bustling center of the city and close to the marina and playas. There are buses close-by and a subway station 3 blocks away. Restaurants and convenience stores are also near-by. The room is large, well-decorated and clean enough. The usual amenities are present, but the wi-fi signal is weak in the room. The a/c system was off because of the season (!). So we had to leave the window slightly open to get fresh air. Which in turn let the outside sound in. We soon discovered that the lot next to the hotel was a slum occupied by two migrants who sleep there under makeshift shelters made of cardboard and plastic (see picture). While one can see migrants in every country and Barcelona has probably less of a problem than Paris in that aspect. It seems strange that a nice hotel would tolerate this arrangement as we even saw rats crawling around under the rain. The abandonned lot is walled around, so it is impossible to see what's inside from the boardwalk. It is very saddening to see humans living that way in a not so poor country. One night, one of these guys got really mad, for some reasons, and he kept shouting on top of his lungs allnight. He would stop for 5 minutes then start again, There was no sleep that night. We complained next morning. The next night was quiet. I suggest a room away as possible of the street. Spanish, especially young males, have a tendency to be loud on their way back from their drinking points. But there are also good points to this hotel and I must think that the situation I had described is destined to be temporary. Sure, hope so. I would still recommand this hotel because of his location and his convenience. They have a breakfast buffet which is worthwhile. It is clean enough, although we had to ask twice to clean the room and change the towels. Every problem was resolved by a rather polite personal. Barcelona is an unforgettable city, very modern and clean, with and antique heart. Food is excellent almost everywhere. Inhabitants are quite friendly, especially if you try a few words in the language. Transportation is easy. Museums, architecture, parks. Plenty to do. Absolutely to be seen, Ulysse et Oscar

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: KnoxE
Reviews.Content: We visited H10 Marina for our second visit as we had enjoyed this hotel last year however we were very dissappointed this time. We were advised when we checked in that the air conditioning had been changed for winter so would not blow cold air. The bedrooms were far too hot resulting in restless nights sleep. When we complained to the reception we were told there was nothing they could do. We tried opening the window but as our room was on 2nd floor at the front of the hotel we found it very noisy with pedestrians and taxis. On our second day we went out and were out most of the day. We returned at 4 pm to find our room had not been cleaned. Our friens were in the room 2 doors away and their room had been cleaned. I called reception and was told that housekeeping work until 5 pm. I said that as we had been out all day we wanted to rest so was advised to let reception know when we went out again I advised that we would not be going out til 8 pm and they said they would arrange for the room to be cleaned then. We went to bed but were woken by the cleaner knocking on the door at 4.30 pm We told her to go away as we were resting. When we went out that evening I told them just to replace the towels as they did not seem to be able to follow instructions. We will never return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good breakfast, location might not suit some”
Reviews.Author: luci5
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the H10 Marina Barcelona about 9pm and there was a crowd at reception. We were checked in 5 mins later and allocated a room on the 5th floor. It was a lovely, modern, spacious room with twin beds. 32” flat screen TV with BBC World, Sky Sports 1, Channel 4, Euro News, CNN. Fridge / mini bar with room for our own stuff, free safe, double wardrobe and 2 small drawers. There was free wifi with a password from reception. The bathroom was very nice with a shower over the bath, a sink, toilet and bidet. Loads of nice toiletries including a shaving kit, a dental kit, sewing kit, shower cap and comb as well as the usual stuff. The public areas were very nice and definitely 4*. There was a roof top pool on the 8th floor and also a Wellness Centre / spa at 16 euros. The bed was quite firm, which I prefer, but wouldn’t suit everyone. The hotel is in a quiet area and there is a metro about 10 mins walk away The restaurant was very busy, but we didn’t have long to wait for a table. The breakfast was excellent with 120 items in the buffet The donuts were gorgeous, it was proper orange juice, the coffee was good as was bacon and scrambled eggs. Went to a small Italian restaurant / bar behind the hotel and we were the only people there. The owner didn’t speak English, but we managed to order some food and drinks. The drinks must have been very expensive as the bill was quite high and the food looked quite cheap on the menu. The hotel was a 10 minute walk from the marina where there were loads of restaurants and bars and a nice promenade which seemed to go on for miles.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: JimmySUMO
Reviews.Content: I switched the lights off in my room and was surprised that it was still light, the reason was the shaft of light which was shining under my door. This gap was also great at projecting noise in to my room, whether that was from the service trollies which were wheeled back and forth in front of my door early in the morning or voices from rooms down the hall. The rooms are small, with just enough room to walk around the double bed, but a surprisingly spacious bathroom. I came to Barcelona to organise a conference and we'll not be recommending this hotel to delegates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Again”
Reviews.Author: jane190734
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel again for the second year running and once again could not find fault at all. Due to an overbooking/or full hotel we were upgraded free of charge to a Junior Suite without any fuss; this was done by the hotel without our prior knowledge of any potential problem. The room was excellent with superb views and was cleaned every day immaculately. The breakfast choices were again excellent. The location to the port olimpic and beach area is perfect and is 20/25 minutes walk to the busier Rambla area; I do not know why some people complain about the location as the map is quite clear where the hotel is. We are regular visitors to Barca and will definitely be staying hear when we next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: mark e
Reviews.Content: Me and my Wife stayed from the 18th - 21st October 2011 a midweek break, from the moment we arrived we had a speedy check in all of 3 minutes, totally professional reception staff, especially Betty who after dealing with a very awkward customer, then took a deep breath, smiled and welcomed us to the Hotel. I asked via e-mail in advance for a room on the 6th or 7th floor as i took advice from fellow travellers on trip advisor, i got exactly what i asked for from our room on the 7th floor we could see the sea and the marina tower blocks. Just dont expect to see the Marina it isnt that close, about a 10 minute stroll and you get there. The Hotel is very clean in all areas and all the staff were very pleasent and willing to help if needed, especially the morning our safe wouldnt open, i went down to reception and told them of my predicament and they promised to have someone upto our room in 5 minutes, low and behold 5 minutes later a bloke turned up to rectify the safe problem. Breakfast was very good every morning, more than enough to choose from, and to fill you up before a day trekking across Barcelona. The Bar was always well stocked and the barmen could not do enough for you every drink was dellivered to your table with a bowl of complimentary snacks, beer about 3 euro and cocktails were 7 euro each, but very well presented. All in all a very good hotel not to bad on location as Bogatell tube station is just around the corner and this will get you straight into the heart of Barcelona, or walk down to the seafront and walk into Barcelona about 30 minutes. Currently the train and tube are not serving the Airport but there is an AeroBus which departs from downstairs in arrivals and will take you to the Placa De Cataluyna which is its turn round point for 5.30 Euro each excellent service.......Great City for a great break.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: AnikaE
Reviews.Content: We visited the H10 Marina for the second time after we had a lovely stay in Barcelona 2 years ago. The first time we booked a simple room and were upgraded to a lovely suite with view over Barcelona and the sea. Furthermore the quality of the Dionissos bar stood out. The great rooms and the good food was one of the main reasons we returned. The room we had this time was very nice as well, amazingly clean and spacious. Again we had a very pleasant stay, however it seemed the hotel was cutting back a little on facilities. The Dionissos bar was closed and the food we had in the bar (pasta salad) was below standard, especially for Spain (no flavor, bland). Furthermore the pool closed at 18:00 in the evening, which is in my opinion a little to early.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL ,STAFF VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: Brian c
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the H10 marina Tues,Wed night and found everything about the hotel very good,not a great deal to do around the local area but there are a few bars and restaurants,good location for the metro as Bogatell station is just round the corner 5 mins walk ,there is a pleasant walk through the park to the Cathedral area and Las Rambla,we were made very welcome by the staff on reception and were given a well received glass of cava on arrival ,.our room was excellent,massive bed ,great shower and a well stocked minibar,did not eat there but the restaurant looked 1st class,would go there again no problem .

Reviews.Title: “great view, great room, great service”
Reviews.Author: nickiebondie
Reviews.Content: This hotel in not in the very centre of Barcelona, but it's close to the sea. It took us 15 minutes on foot to get to the centre. We had a high floor, and a room with a view to the sea side. Great view at night (when the two towers are lit!) and also you can see airplanes landing and taking off our of the window, funny. Breakfast was very tasty and a wide selection of food, and it was in a huge spacious restaurant, so it wasn's at all overcrowded. Also there is a piano bar (I think they call it a wine or cigar bar or somethig, but there was a piano there). Great selection of wines.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lynnie30
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable beds. Dont expect a view. Very Good Buffet Breakfast. Tiny pool on roof. Needs a subway to get to Las Ramblas etc but not far away and cheap. If walking takes about half hour via seafront scenic route but eveings can be spent in Local Marina which is ok for a drink/meal etc. Avoid the Mexican Restaurant on the Marina La Casa Mexicana absoultely awful but The Creperie Bretonne is very good and a bit different.

Reviews.Title: “unpolite staff!!”
Reviews.Author: john j
Reviews.Content: We Have never been treated so badly in our lives. They treated us with contempt and humiliation. the hotel is very good, great breakfast, clean, good facilities, wonderful views, but the receptionists are not informed about the attractions of the city and do absolutely nothing to be kind, they're coarse, stupid and unhelpful. want to be treated poorly? look for the hotel's reception and their team. receptionists unprepared, including the boss. we heard "sweet words" of the receptionists, they do not like people from underdeveloped countries, including those with money and education. point for facilities and many negative points to the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Boatload of tourists in lobby everyday”
Reviews.Author: screwtopprof
Reviews.Content: The hotel is standard. My room was a decent size and wifi was included in the room rate but you had to keep asking for a new activation code and they would not give it to you over the phone. This meant having to push through the lobby full of tourists all on group tours. Any desk service took 10 minutes because of the long lines. Hotel is looking weary in the hallways, but the rooms are comfortable. Location is good only if you like walking 10-15 to each destination. I would say a comfortable stay but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel to visit the city center”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_Pieter
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but a long trip to go to the city center. Expensive for what it is. Bathroom not very clean

Reviews.Title: “noisy, bad food & rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Walter D
Reviews.Content: Around 2PM you can expect delivery trucks to come and then for quite some time going back and forth of noisy carts. The food is expensive and tasts aweful. Worst of all the treatment of the staff. If you are into being treated like dirt ask for Laura at the front desk to help you. Finally, it is in a really boring part of town

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but good value for this price”
Reviews.Author: cyrils31
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed staying at H10 Marina. The staff was friendly, rooms are clean, visitors were also fine and met the level of the hotel. Good location - just 10 minutes walk from the sea shore. Good facilities and staff. Thing we did not like was: The paintings are scary. Above the bed (OMG). I am sure this painting is from some known artist but why why why not to choose something less aggressive and more neutral, ie flowers or buildings or seashore... we did not complain to the administration because we were too lazy to move off but thats for the note of the hotel. i am sure though they have reasons to put those scary masterpieces on the walls... that's it. as for the rest, the hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazzo62
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Barcelona, and stayed at the H10 Marina. We could not fault this hotel at all, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The food was lovely, there was plenty to choose from at Breakfast and the evening meals were just as good. After reading some of the reviews before we left I was a bit worried about the Hotel but I was pleasantly surprised. It just goes to show maybe you should not believe everything you read ! The pool area was on the 8th floor and had great views, the beach is a 10 minute walk away. We brought a two day tour bus ticket which had 3 different coloured routes which we could jump on and off when we were in the city,which we found very useful because we also got to see a lot of the sights that we would not have had time to see and the bus stop was again 10 mins away from the hotel. When we arrived to check in we was asked whether we would like single or a double bed in our room. The room was very clean, we had no problem with wifi it worked fine. All in all we were very happy with this Hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fab breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jennynigel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights for a mid week break and the hotel was excellent . It is well placed for all the sightseeing but also only a ten minute walk to the beach and marina,could not really find fault with the hotel at all. I have to mention the fab breakfast which was in our b&b deal but if it had'nt been was well worth the the 15 euros, the choice was unlimited. Could do with a shower room for people leaving late as some were changing in the toilets and lobby but would certainly stay here again when in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “for a 4 stars hotel too many minuses”
Reviews.Author: Maria N
Reviews.Content: on the whole it is a good hotel, but with some minuses.we arrived late in the evening, at about 22 o clock. Pluses 1- good location. 2 min to metro station Bogatell and 7 minutes to Marina (that goes to the center), 15 minutes walk to the beach, supermarkets near the hotel, a nice district. 2- on the whole the standart of rooms is ok. 3- clean 4- not smoking hotel 5 - we slept with the opened window. although it could be loud cos of motos. Minuses 1- The first unpleasant surprise was that we got a room with one big bed, instead of a twin room. when i told at the reception, that we have specially written by booking that we want a twin room, they told us that they didnt get this information. So I have to sleep with my friend in 1 bed under one cover... not the most pleasant experience. Next day we got another room, but it was smaller. so we stayed in this room for 2 weeks. 2- The next unpleasant thing was that the safe was making problems: sometimes it functioned properly, sometimes not. 3 times we went to the reception, 2 times a person came to fix it, but in some time it had problems again. 3- Internet connection was slow, very slow... In order to have internet u need to get a name and password at the reception. At first I got it for 1 week, and had to take it again. 4- There are 3 lifts at the hotel, but sometimes, especially in the morning u had to wait long to the lift. 5- Breakfast was ok. What I didnt like was the fact that if you come to the breakfast not at 9, but at 9.30 there was no jamon left. I wouldnt book breakfast again, better to eat in one of the cafes. On the hotel our stay at the hotel was good. But it is more a 3 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VirgilCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for several times a year for several years both on business and for pleasure. The location is perfect, near the Marina, with some good restaurants tucked between the tourist rubbish. There are also lovely beach walks. The zoo and downtown are easy walks, and it is close to the metro. The rooms are modern, clean, inviting. the staff all speak english and are very hospitable. Their bar is usually lively. It is my hotel of choice for the price in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not so great neighbourhood but upgrade to priviledge”
Reviews.Author: eina
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night after our cruise. We were at reception at 8am praying to get our room as we were wrecked. The receptionist offered us an upgrade to a junior suite for 59euro because I got the rate on hotwire for 90 we went for it wow its worth it! We had the minibar for free, the room was huge and we had access to the priviledge lounge which had a free internet and a free bar and snacks + spa access.As we had done all the sightseeng pre-cruise this hotel suited us as we were just relaxing for the day. The breakfast buffet was also incl with the upgrade this was very good you name it they had it. Its about 10-15min walk to the port where there are some commerical type restaurants not that great but fine for casual dining or drinks. The beach is there also which is really nice. This location might suit some people but I just felt it was on the edge of things and the surrounding streets were run down and soul-less. If you get this hotel for a bargain its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, staff were very friendly, receptionist offered us a glass of sparkling wine on arrival. Rooms were clean and nicely furnished, we had a standard room and it was of good size with flat screen TV, spacious and comfortable bed. stayed bed & breakfast, vast choice of nice food at breakfast buffet. Ate in one night and had the taster menu, which was 5 courses with 5 wines for 55 Euro each, this was excellent. Only down side was that it was 16 Euro a day to use indoor swiming pool, roof top pool was egood if a little cool.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Soren W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 nights stay and had no problems with the hotel location. We like to walk a bit, so we walked to the marina, the rambla and sagrada familia - but if you don't like walking the metro is very close and it is easy to get around. There is a very nice italian restaurant close to the hotel - "il corsaro nero"... worth a visit. WIFI signal could be improved throughout the hotel and some sun umbrella's at the pool area would be nice. It is a shame that you have to pay extra to visit the spa and reception staff could have been a bit more helpfull (for instance they would not assist with booking online tickets for the sagrada familia) but we are used to take care of ourselves so did not suffer over this. Fitness room was very small but it is nice that you have the option. But that is about it... no problems with the beds like others have written. . All in all a very good hotel and good value for the price. Our warmest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “An honest Review from a travel rep!”
Reviews.Author: crazydude2130
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a ideal location for the beach and the Olypicio Marina. However the area surrounding these area's is very rundown which really let's it down.... The hotel itself is beautiful and the service is second to none. We were welcome on reception with a room upgrade to a junior suite. We were so pleased and were offered help with any problems are queries. The room was very spacious with a large king size bed and a large HDTV with a selection of many channels. There is a mini bar fridge int he room but the prices are very high. The outdoor pool area is quite small although we didn't really use this throughout our stay. The hotel is complete with a lobby bar. Yet again quite expensive but great service. Breakfast were on the bottom floor int he main restaurant area and you need to wait to be seated. However there was always someone there to take you to a table and we were never stood waiting! The choice was fantastic with over 125 products catering for all nationalities. Everything is fresh and replenished frequently. Fantastic food!! On an evening the restaurant turns into a fine dinishing restaurant serving a la carte meals. We ate out down the marina most evenings as they have a vast amount of restaurants. The Marina has mainly sea food restaurants, although there an itialians (Gino's with VERY BAD SERVICE!) and there was a mexicans serving steaks etc which was fantastic called CASA MEXICANA. I would thoroughly recommend and the prices at this restaurant are decent. Restaurants are rather expensive if im honest and so are drinks! Surrounding the area there are a few supermarkets which are quite cheap for coke, water and holiday bits and bobs eg, snacks. The beach which is literally right next to the Marina ia a lovely beach. Sunbeds to hire. The only downside are the people that go up and down asking you if you want a massage or buy a drink or fresh coconut! Beach is clean and tidy though with a life guard present! The Tour bus also stops at the marina. I would recommend this to see the sites. we were only there for 3 days and found this sufficient to see Barcelona!! All in all the city is OK. And i mean just OK. Lot's of graffitti. A lot of area's have been let to run down since the olypmics! A good weekend break though and amazing hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: 09_Brian_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the H10 Marina Barcelona for a week. We were very pleased with both the hotel and the staff there. One of the best features of the hotel is the sumptuous breakfast that they provide every morning. The hotel is located in a nice quiet area, but is only a ten minute walk away from the beach and the 'old part' of the city. Our room was very spacious and clean. We would definitely stay at the H10 Marina Barcelona if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: chrisgarcia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights back in May 2011. Although not in the centre, we actually quite liked this and would walk each morning along the promenade to the centre. We didn't use the tube once, and walked everywhere. It may be too far out for some though The rooms were very nice. A good size and very modern. Our aircon didn't work very well, but the weather wasn't really hot enough anyway, so wasn't a problem. We really liked the breakfast and there was a very large selection on offer All in all we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit this great city, but that don't want to pay higher prices for being in the centre

Reviews.Title: “NIce rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Miracle22
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms (book at least 1 month ahead for better prices). Perfect location in Olympic Village. Only too bad parking is only allowed there for 2 hours now. So you have to use the hotel garage. The breakfast (buffet) is amazing! Everything you can imagine they have.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: crackerman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend here. Hotel is very clean and comfortable. Rooms are bright and adequately cooled by the AC. Bathroom is smart and a good size. Rooftop pool is lovely if a bit cramped..but the beach is a 5-10 minute walk :) The only downside as far as I see is that it's €16 to use the indoor pool and spa facilities, which is a bit steep if you just fancy a swim to exercise. Service was superb - all staff were happy to help!

Reviews.Title: “10 min walk to the beach but not close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: lmontele
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the H10 Marina hotel in August 2011. The location of this hotel was a few blocks from the beachfront. Not too far, although not that near either. It's about a 20 minute car ride from downtown, but the subway line (Bogatel) is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. (My opinion not in the greatest location.) The rooms were clean and mondern. (Bed is really hard) Lobby and bar area very nice as well. Free Wifi Outdoor pool is nice but only stays open until 6pm. Breakfast was really good, plenty to choose from and always replenished. Staff was friendly and helpful. ATTENTION TO TRAVELLERS: Keep all valuables in safe deposit box. Left my necklace on the night stand and went missing after the room was cleaned. VERY DISAPPOINTING.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious food, friendly staff and short walk from beach”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I stayed a whole 7 nights here and loved it! Barcelona has so much to offer, so anywhere you stay would not hinder the great trip you'd have. This hotel is a short walk from popular sandy beach and port, where you'll find charming seafood restaurants. Staff are friendly and not too serious which really made us feel at ease. Fantastic food! Variety of local and national menu options, all deicious, we ate at the restaurant in the hotel 3 nights and every morning - cannot fault the service or quality at all. Pool on roof was cold at this time of year, but was nice to sit up there in the sun by the bar and read and enjoy the views! Close to metro station, and from there it is 1 change on the underground train to catalunya, the busy centre station. Reception can tell you about the best ways to see the sights and get around the city. There is a spa area, but we didn't get time to use it. If we return, we will next time! Only criticism was fairly hard matress.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: Fevs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position for a short break in Barcelona. When we arrived we thought we had made a huge mistake as the hotel was in a very quiet non descript area. However once we started to explore a little further it was fantastic. Just a few minutes walk to the metro system into the city centre and about 10 Mins walk to the fabulous clean beaches. Breakfast was a huge buffet, our only gripe here was the coffee machines which you had to queue for and were of dubious taste! All in all we had a lovely stay. Just a negative though, we had a late flight and they wanted to charge us 5 Euros each just to have a shower before we went home!! A little steep!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best!”
Reviews.Author: claregreenacres
Reviews.Content: Having booked the H10 marina for my birthday I was expecting at the very least somewhere basic but clean, we got a great deal and this should have given me some clues! When we arrived I only had my debit card and when the man on reception asked for a credit card as deposit and I only had a debit card he made a big deal saying that he would allow me to use this as a favour. Our room was ok, the mirror in the bathroom was cracked round the edges but everywhere in the room seemed clean. The hallways however were a different matter, dirty old grubby carpets and the lifts were incredibly slow and kept breaking down. The staff were not very polite although the breakast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Baillies
Reviews.Content: Excellent Customer Service. We were on our Honeymoon and were touring Spain. The staff at H10 were the only hotel who mentioned it and contgratulated us at check in. They even upgraded our room. The Brekfast was amazing. Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rosalia80
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last fabruary for some days, our stay was very pleasant, and staff was helpful to all departments, reception, restaurants (breakfast and dinner) and housekeeping. See you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly place.”
Reviews.Author: NZsandras
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and after a cruise. The staff were extremely helpful and helped us with no speak Spanish. Great spot to walk to beach from.Lovely food at restuarant with extras before meal a normal thing.Good value breakfast also. Only thing was walls were a little thin.Embarrising to hear from next room in middle of afternoon...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Modern hotel in excellent location away from hussle and bussle”
Reviews.Author: Parker1483
Reviews.Content: Well, just returned from a stay in H10 Marina Barcelona and have to say we were very glad to have stayed here. It is a very modern hotel, free wifi, flat screen tv's etc, and the main attraction has to be the roof top pool, which in 34 degree temperatures is perfect to cool down in. The rooms are very spacious and have everything you need, hairdryer, fridge, tv, and the beds whilst firm were comfy and we both slept very well. Only small problem we had was in room 128 with the air conditioning not being cold enough. Initially we thought it might have been us doing it wrong but after a very very hot night with my boyfriend hardly getting any sleep, we asked reception to take a look at it whilst we were out the next day. We got back to the room and still not cool, so rang reception and sure enough they sent maintenance to fix it. A guy came and told us yes it was fixed, but after 10 mins still no cold air coming out so we rang reception again and asked to be moved rooms which was no problem. Room 103 was fine, and lovely and cool and no more problems with the air con. Breakfast was really good, a lovely variety of hot and cold food to choose from. Eggs, bacon, beans, melon, pineapple, pastries, cereals, and a selection of teas, fruit juices and coffee. YUM! We didnt eat at the restaurant for any other meals so cannot comment. The bars both in reception and upstairs by the pool were quite reasonably priced and the staff were very attentive. We found a cheap cafe around the corner on carrer de marina on the way to the marina where we had a couple of meals for lunch, pizza and spagetti bolognaise both very good, and between 5 and 7 euros each, very good value for money. If you are looking for a beautiful meal in authentic settings please go to a retaurant overlooking the beach called Escriba (google it and you would see it has been voted in the top 10 restuarants in Barcelona). You have to pre book as it gets very busy but the food was amazing. It wasn't cheap at over 100 euros (but that included 3 courses and a bottle of wine) but if you like seafood it is a must, the prawns were gorgeous, my mouth is literally watering at the thought of it. On our last day because our flight wasn't until 9pm we opted to pay to use the indoor spa. It cost 16 euros but meant we could use the indoor pool, steam room, sauna, jacuzzi, and hot and cold plunge pools. Very nice and good value for money considering it costs 5 euros if you want to get a shower after you have checked out. In summary we liked this hotel because it was modern, clean, has the roof top pool and was in a good location about a 10 minute walk to the beach and marina. It is near Bogatell Metro stop which is handy to get to las Rambles and La Sagrada Familia and near the bus stop for the hop on hop off tours as well. Go here and you will not be disappointed. Happy Holidays

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Scully1998
