Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at both H10 Itaca and Marina the day prior and the day after our cruise. Both hotels were nice and clean. As mentioned by others, the beds are very firm, but I like firm beds so I slept nicely. The room at the Marina was a little larger than the Itaca but we didn't spend much time in the room so it wasn't a big deal. The showers in both hotels are weird. The "door" to the shower is a glass partition that goes down 1/2 the length of the bathtub. The partition in the Marina bathroom was missing a rubber piece underneath and water went everywhere on the bathroom floor. The tub was also narrow and slippery so all this combined frightened me since I am pregnant and was afraid of slipping. Also, we did hear the neighbors above us in the middle of the night and did not appreciate being woken up. The hotel employees in both hotels were accommodating and the breakfast was wonderful. It was also nice to have access to computers in the business centers. One tip to American travelers... when you get into your room, you have to place one of your room-cards in the little holder by the door to activate lights and air conditioning. They failed to mention that to us and we felt like idiots when we complained that we didn't have air.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: smb2011
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good hotel. Would stay there again for sure. It is not on the marina however. Name misleads a bit but its not too far by cab. The breakfast was a huge spread. The front desk personel were very very helpful. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “For next time we come to Barcelona, we will definately choose the same hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arthitect
Reviews.Content: Well, firstly we found the Hotel much better than its pictures. It was a very clean hotel and neigbourhood. The hotel is very close to Marina for going out at nights also very close to the metro station called Bogatell. With the metro you could reach to every part of the city in a very cheap way. the hotel is also very close to the Airport aroun 20-25 minutes. We stayed there for 10 days. Everyone said it was too long but we love it. The staff of the hotel were very helpful and speak English perfectly.The rooms were moderate in size but very confortable. We had a king size bed. Its a very exciting place to be!

Reviews.Title: “strange hybrid of posh holiday / cheap business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frenchy72_11
Reviews.Content: squiky bed, twin tinny beds in most rooms, paper thin walls, very limited facilities in the room catering: fairly poor good location: 10 minute walk to the harbour and the bars/clubs nothing to do with Barcelona though....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed, but terrible customer service :-(”
Reviews.Author: Jocomoso
Reviews.Content: Loved the area the hotel was in, the room was large and spacious, clean, good-sized bathroom & comfy bed(s) - but toiletry products were not great for a 4 star. What really let it down was the unfriendly, uncooperative staff both at reception and in the restaurant (evening meal only - the day staff were very nice & helpful). We booked a double room to find it was a twin - when we queried this the unfriendly receptionist said "we have no maids to change it this evening we will make the twin into a double tomorrow" - no negotiation!! We booked a meal in the restaurant to be told very curtly on arriving there, "we are full!", the maitre d'didn't bother checking with us if we had a prior booking first! Finally at breakfast (which was described as "awesome", errr not quite) we were disappointed to find vending-style machines for coffee rather than having it served to the table by waiters, of which there we enough to go round. We will not be going back.... but if you can put up with the rudeness it's in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel with good communications”
Reviews.Author: Mindtrust
Reviews.Content: H10 Marina is a great clean hotel, it also has good communications to many differnt places with metro (Bogatell or Marina) or try to check out the different buslines close by to go to Sagrada familia, and other places just walk out to the right and go to the marina street and you will see them or walk straight down to the beach and you will see other options there also. There is also a small shopping mall closeby if you walk down towards the beach. There is a good cafe close by if you didn't choose to have breakfast at the hotel, just exit the hotel and walk down to the left intersection and you will see it in the corner. The internet is free, but isn't too good in the rooms, but works perfectly in the lobby, just ask for username and password in the reception! The beds were like many said earlier a little bit hard, but i had no problem with it. I sleept like a rock after beeing out for 12-13 hours everyday.

Reviews.Title: “A short walk to the beach. Beautiful and quiet neighborhood. Not the center of town.”
Reviews.Author: paulolopez96
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was a few blocks from the beachfront. Not too far, although not that near either. The Marina was a beautiful place to go to, especially since we had five kids (6-12 yrs old) along with us. We even swam in the beach on two succeeding afternoons. If you are an older couple, then you would probably be better off selecting a hotel closer to the downtown area. It was about three or four blocks to be able to get to a "hop-on/hop-off" bus stop. But because the weather in Barcelona was very good (cool temp with sunny skies), we decided to walk to the downtown area. We passed through a beautiful public park, the university area, etc... It was such a great walk. The hotel was very clean, and looked new and modern compared to most other hotels in Europe. The breakfast buffet was good, consisting of fruits, eggs, cheese selections, cereals, yoghurt, and other continental standards. There was a roof deck pool, but since the area was a little small, some sun bathers got splashed by water when the kids started jumping into the water. Also, there was no water heater for the pool. Coming from a tropical country, it was quite "shocking" to jump into that cold water. Maybe it's because the location is just a little off the center of action that they try a little harder to please the guests. I would definitely stay here again, if I were bringing kids.

Reviews.Title: “This is a lovely hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: JPusateri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight before going on a cruise. We had 3 rooms one of which was a triple. The view from 2 rooms was not great but the triple room had a gorgeous view of the city. This hotel is walking distance from the public beaches, and marina. There are many nice restaurants in the area. The hotel has a beautiful roof top pool with a nice relaxing area to reat in. The staff here are extremely courteous and helpful. Best breakfast we had on our trip and it came with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel for location and amazing breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkJoanna Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time on a 4 day break. The metro station is only 5 minutes walk away as are the beaches and restaurants. You feel as if you are living among the locals rather than in an airless street in the centre of the city. Lovely, airy rooms with nice decor, pool on the roof with excellent views and a breakfast buffet which has become a legend in our family - is there anything they do not have on offer??

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & if you can walk more than 15 mins good location.”
Reviews.Author: StevelCumbriaUK
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Barcelona on 6 previous occasion & had stayed central, this time looked to be near the Marina. The H10 is about a 15 min walk down the Carrer de la Marina to the Marina & about a 30 mins walk through the park to the centre of Barcelona. The hotel is clean, the breakfasts awesome, the roof top pool good (the pool bar is never open) & overall I would stop there again.

Reviews.Title: “If your looking to relax in Barca, this could be the one......”
Reviews.Author: GandTRuralSussex
Reviews.Content: If you know Barca, it is based on the opposite side of the park/zoo from the city, Cathedral area/ Barri Gotica. Because of this it is quiet but with really easy travel links into the city/Placa de Cataluyna/Barcelonetta/The Marina - by public bus, metro, taxi or a 10/15 steady stroll. Beware that the Marina aspect of it's name is the main boulevard/area & does not mean it's on the sea front. It has a good value restaurant. The roof pool is a great place for a drink/read/relax. It was our 3rd time in Barca & we wanted a quiet, relaxing time - our choice was good.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, but high standards”
Reviews.Author: mckvakk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit hard to find if you arrive by other means than taxi and don't have access to a map or GPS. It's well hidden from the metro. The staff was very friendly, and spoke relatively good english. The room was clean and had a very large window and even an ocean view when the weather was clear. (When i say ocean view, i mean of course a glimpse of water and maybe a boat far away between some buildings). There is not much insulation, so you will probably be hearing noices from the hallway. At least in daytime. The bathroom had a combined tub and shower, which i hate. But the room itself was roomy and the shower good, although it felt a little cramped in the tub because of a glass door to prevent spilling on the floor. It also included the most amenities i've ever seen in a hotel bathroom. Including a shaving kit and a toothbrush. There is a TV in the room, but as much fun it is to watch simpsons and futurama in spanish, it get's boring after a while. Luckily there was a few british channels as well. Including two or three from the bbc and one from channel 4. Now we get to the important part. The bed! Well, it's big, with large pillows, and very soft. i slept very good that night. But there is two things that's not so good here. When i arrived the room was a little hot, so i put on the AC and went out. When i got back there was a massive rain shower and i was wet and cold, this combined with the AC being on full blast made it even colder, i tried to change it to heating, but it stayed on cold until i checked out the following day. With it being so cold you would think it would be nice to crawl under the bed sheets and get warm there. Well, the sheets were very thin so they didn't provide any heat at all. I'm sure thats very nice when its 30c outside, but not when the room is freezing. I have a cold now because of this. One other thing: when i got back during the rain storm i noticed water dripping from the roof of the elevator. This is very bad and could be a possible fire hazard. Except for the location and broken AC i had a good stay at this hotel, and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Modern lobby, rooms not so much”
Reviews.Author: chef082
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotwire for a few days after a cruise. The hotel was comfortable but used. The lobby is medium-grand but he rooms are much older and cheaper. Location is not right downtown but 2 blocks from Bogatell metro and the underground services were easy to use. Problems: • The fan in my room was loud • Beds were 2 singles and were low quality • The Internet in the hotel is free but the wifi signal in the room was very poor • Room door does not automatically close • Restaurant opens at 20h (I know I'm in Spain but people do fly in and out at different times.. Object of your restaurant should be to make money anyways). • You can easily hear your neighbors (floors are wood) • Security guard present but useless (one night, very late, a soccer fan was screaming in the street with a bull horn, upon complaining they said they knew but did noting further such as calling the police)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: joshchicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything it promised to be. Our room was very modern and very clean. The window opened, which was great because I liked the ocean breeze that blew in. It's not right next to the Sea, but we had a room looking out towards it and could even see the W Hotel from our window. All of the front desk staff were helpful and spoke English with no trouble. The rooftop was not active because the entire 3 days we were there it rained, so I can't comment on the rooftop pool/bar area, but can tell that it would be great on warmer days. My partner and I are big walkers, so the location of the hotel wasn't a big issue for us. We walked everywhere from the hotel and it was an easy 20 minutes at a brisk pace from the wonderful beachfront hotels, restaurants and bars on the Mediterranean. We walked from the W Hotel bar lazily back to the hotel along the wonderful boardwalk that no guide book even bothers to mention. GREAT value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and spacious”
Reviews.Author: shellito
Reviews.Content: The agents at the desk spoke English were always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: charlie1980 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was very nice, however they dont tell you that to use the facilities (swimming pool) is an additional 16 euros a day and as for car parking that comes at a cost of 22 euros a day! now this is all well and good but having stayed in other H10 hotels in Marbella there are no hidden costs, needless to say we will not be staying there again in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “What about those beds?”
Reviews.Author: APotOfTeaTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights pre-cruise. Spotlessly clean, great breakfast buffet...but the hardest bed I have ever tried to sleep on. Not merely firm, mind you - hard. Really really hard.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a very short walk from metro station Bogatell. From there a mere stop (Ciutadella-Vila Olímpica) or two (Barceloneta) and you are in the heart of one of the most active night life. The beach is not too far off from here either. The hotel seems to be brand new with good sized rooms and spacious bathrooms. Most importantly, all clean, very clean! The staff were very helpful and polite. One of the things I appreciated the most was that it was quiet! Nobody was banging my door in the morning while cleaning the corridor or other rooms, just perfect! Although I couldn't really fault the hotel, I have one thing that I would love to see improved; The Internet. The connection is free however it is very slow. The only reason I needed the Internet was to check my email and plan my next trip, in Barcelona, you don't need to be in your room more than your sleep :) Above all, I like this hotel and will definitely come back to it.

Reviews.Title: “swimming pool 16 €uros!”
Reviews.Author: Rignana007
Reviews.Content: very satisfactory and good breakfast but beware 2 things. Thin walls mean you can hear everyone else's alarm calls in the morning ; and the swimming situation is not ideal in the winter, when the outside pool may be closed. Hotel charges you 16 Euros for a dip in their inside pool, on the flimsy excuse that it is all part of a separate spa experience.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: stavroula21
Reviews.Content: A pleasant stay with a very good staff. The room was not as clean as i expected but we had a very comfy sleep and a HUGE variety of breakfast. Not centrally located but in a safe and interesting neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: reddibear
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel around 4pm great at reception no problems we got to our room within 10 mins only one problem no coffee makeing m/c in the room so we went down to recepion and did get a upgrade to a better room on the 9th floor and all i can say if you can go for a upgrade we had a free mini bar in the room private lounge dowstairs with free drinks free accsess to the health centre and pool great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no marina!”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Rivero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our first visit to Barcelona. It's a nice hotel BUT it's not on a marina, the marina is actually about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The room decor was nice and lively. The beds are a bit hard but i loved it, my husband not so much. There is a mini bar in the room with the smallest bottle of water in the world(think mini liquor bottle) The staff was helpful and accommodating. There is a nice rooftop pool and bar( we never got to enjoy the pool). This hotel is not in the heart of the city its in the middle of a neighborhood and seems more of a business hotel, which worked out great for us because it wasn't packed with tourist. The walk to the marina is a nice one there's a park on the way with a few cool statues.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: kpolovina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 as part of a package. So we thought that it would be less than great. It was a nice surprise. The rooms were clean and modern, the staff helpful and the breakfast great. It is within walking distance to the marina and hop on and off tour buses. The area doesn't have much else to offer though. There is a large and very nice grocery store nearby. Ask at the front desk as it is a little hard to find. We has a yummy picnic in our room, from this sto re, after having a large paella lunch at the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToineLondon Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well decorated, the staff are very helpful, and breakfast is good. However, its location is not ideal: it is miles away from the centre of Barcelona. In addition, I had sleepless nights because of the thin walls and extremely poor insulation. I couldn't even rest for an hour in peace, as every single noise (footsteps, people running a bath, etc.) could be heard so clearly. I was woken several times every night, and felt rather tired and frustrated the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: fgibson Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Absolutely superb hotel. Glass of Cava on arrival. Birthday cake for the missus left in the room shame they missed mine the next day. Great breakfast selection of hot and cold. We had room service first night and it was very good and reasonable. Maid service impeccable. Would definitely come back if only just for a slice of "my birthday" cake!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, very friendly, very clean hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: liatl
Reviews.Content: we arrived with 3 small children. the staff were very helpful and friendly. the location is great ia a quiet and safe neighbourhood. easy access to metro and buses. the rooms were very clean and very well maintained. the buffet breakfast was plentyful and tasty. we had dinner twice at the hotel and the dinner menu was great. we would certainly come back to this hotel whenever we are in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayantchheda
Reviews.Content: My hotel was book by my Hosting agency in Barcelona, I had stayed there for 04 nights from 29th November 2010 to 3rd DEC. I enjoyed the stay. The service was good.I didnot take breakfast as there are 2 super markets near by where you can buy food at cheaper rate.The staff should learn English if they want more international tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great for City Break”
Reviews.Author: AlanfromBatley
Reviews.Content: From the beginning take the Airport Bus to Catalunya Square (5.05Euros one way) and if you can sort out the Metro it's 1.80Euros to Bogatel Station - just 200m from the hotel. We were 'conned' for a 9Eu taxi which took us on a tour of the area before arriving at the Hotel. On arrival a very pleasant young lady welcomed us, took details and offered us a glass of reasonable quality Champagne as a welcome drink. Check in was - like the drink - very easy on the tired traveller! Problem was, after a short walk we found all local eateries closed (except for a take-away Pizza House) so returned to the Hotel for Dinner. Food and wine reasonable priced, but both main courses - which were superbly prepared - arrived COLD. We ate out after that! The room had a huge bed in which you could believe there was only you in it and the room seemed hard to warm up - until we realised the maid had left two windows slightly open. After that the heating was fine as the outside temperature dropped to single figures during the night. Bathroom was good - but a tiny bath so no lie down, but shower and toilet extras were as good as anywhere we have had - not being able in hand luggage to take a razor, a new one was provided daily as part of the service - without having to ask. Breakfast is proudly advertised in the hotel and it is excellent. Great for the Fresh Fruit fans and three kinds of cooked eggs and bacon for the full breakfast folks. Even the standard Cofee.Tea/Choccy machines were working perfectly. A 7 minute walk to the Harbour and the starting point of the Tour Buses was advised by the Reception and they sold us a pack for the coaches which discounted the tickets below the price we paid - good choice as we took a 2 day pass which allowed us to go all round the city on 2 sets of buses and get on/get off where we wished. I can see no other way we could have seen and done as much as we did and the pack was full of discount tickets for the more popular sites. Using the Bogatel Station we went back to Catalunya and Ramblas with ease - for walking and eating and - getting off at Barceloneta - we found a superb eatery (Club Tapas) near the station. Chef cooked all to order and it was impossible to find anything with which to complain - somuchso it prompted an extra tip for 'Chef' which he shared with his colleagues anyway! Hotel Marina was our base, our guide and our support and we will use it again next time we are in town. Nephew and Sister-In-Law are both now booked for there in December and March, but one word of advice to those who find walking a problem! The whole area around the hotel is flat - no problem there - but it is a walk to the nearest good restaurants and back - fine for a balmy summer evening, but nippy at this time of year and perhaps a location nearer the port or Ramblas would be better - one thing is certain - it will have to be special to beat this H10 venue.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!! STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: G_E_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: This place has bed bugs! I stayed there for Business on Sept 28 to Oct 2 and woke up on Tuesday night with several bugs crawling on the pillow beside me! It was a terrible experience and the hotel refused to do anything about it. They said they would "spray the room" and didn't even offer to move me into a different room! This hotel is extremely unhealthy and they have zero customer service. I stayed in room 209 and then was moved to room 509.

Reviews.Title: “...for business sleepers, but not for fun”
Reviews.Author: Zorro7770
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clearly a business hotel. I wouldn't go for a romantic weekend, because the furniture is very practical and the beds are big, but not extremely comfortable (more on the hard side of life). They're offering a large breakfast buffet, but it's generally displaying all the regular breakfast items - and actually, the coffee is the worst in the whole of Barcleona (from a sort of vending machine). Better to step outside and get a coffee from the bakery next door (turn left, next to the pharmacy) if you need a proper caffein fix to wake-up. Been here a few times, but the only person that seems to recognize me is the very friendly. Dutch host in the breakfast room. All others, incl. concierges, never seem to welcome you - though I am returning customer with a loyalty card and history. But apparently they never look at such data. It's always like the first time, even with reservations. The beach is only 10 mins away, the Bogatel L4 metro takes you downtown in 3 stops.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Murdocki
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located near the beach and many good restaurants and nightlife (about 10 min walk). It is about 20 minutes from Las Ramblas. The room was simple but comfortable and there is rooftop pool for those interested. The staff were friendly and helpful with dinner reservations and recommendations. There is also free wireless & computers for your use. Breakfast was good, full continental including standard english breakfast items such as eggs, bacon, beans. The beds could have been a bit more comfortable. Overall, great hotel and we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona - until workers industrial strike - left stranded”
Reviews.Author: StokeOnTrentRuthie
Reviews.Content: We were not aware of industrial strike until day before. Hotel were most unhelpful felt they didnt like the English. Although no planes in or out on 30th Sept we were told the hotel was full and they couldn't accomodate us for 1 more night. We spoke to an American rep who had a party of about 25 and she said that the hotel had found accomodation for them. We had travelled indepentantly and were at a loss what to do. We asked to see the Manager who went onto his computor and straight away he offered us a penthouse suite available at £169 a reduced rate! The room was not as nice as our standard room - if no guests were arriving that day why couldn't we keep our original room? and why hadn't the 'receptionists offered us this room in the beginning it would have saved a lot of upset. very small swimming pool. you had to pay extra to use leisure facilities . we had to wait to use internet we were not told that there was internet access in a privilidge room that went with the penthouse suite - again very unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cyclists - don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin_Shepherd
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here whilst visiting Barcelona to compete in the triathlon. After 4 days of staying in the hotel, we were informed that the hotel policy is that bicycles are not allowed in the hotel and must be kept outside in the car park! Now, this will not affect many guests, but the way we were treated by the hotel reception staff was appalling - the reception manager confronted us in the lobby and became extremely heated and loud during the ensuing debate whilst other hotel guests gathered round and formed an audience; he even threatened to call the police if we attempted to bring the bikes into the hotel and then said that he would evict us and we would have to sleep on the street! It may have been a coincidence, but the hotel room key then did not work in the room and when the hotel booked us a taxi, the meter started at 8 Euros (normally 2 Euros in Barcelona) and finished on 10 Euros for a 1.5 mile journey which took less than 5 minutes. The driver then attempted to add on 8 Euros of extras! It's a real shame, because the hotel is actually very nice and the breakfast food is very good. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well equipped. The outdoor pool is tiny and freezing (which is actually very handy after hard exercise) but some clever PR photos make it look A LOT bigger than it is! We really enjoyed the first 4 days of our stay here - the staff were initially very helpful (even opening the fire exit and helping us to the lifts with our bikes on arrival!) but their customer service became absolutely terrible once the bicycle policy changed.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay on the cheap...”
Reviews.Author: TraviDiot
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at H10 Marina Barcelona for the most part. The service provided was ok, but our luggage hadn't arrive with us on our flight, and it wasn't there the next morning, we had to plead with the front desk person to help us with the phone. The free Wi-Fi wasn't accessible from our room, we had to be in the lobby or breakfast area. We were worried as we had seen reviews saying it was in the middle of nowhere, but we found it very accessible to the waterfront area, beaches, Olympic Village and port, and everywhere else as the Metro station 'Bogatell' was 2 blocks away. The morning breakfast was a large buffet that has a lot of fruits, breads, cold cuts, cheeses, eggs, etc., but did not vary in the slightest from day to day...We slept quite well, despite the less-than-luxurious mattresses and the paper-thin walls... Overall it was a clean, safe, pleasant place to stay. We enjoyed watching the locals walking their dogs along the Avinguda del Bogatell, a green, pedestrian avenue upon which the H10 Marina Barcelona is located.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel, convienient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LinaWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: H10 Marina hotel located in Olympic Village of Barcelona approxiamately ten minutes walk to the beach, Grand casino and a lot of restaurants. Rooms are very modern and beautifully decorated. Great breakfast buffet with all kind of variaty of food. Excelent view from the pool located on the roof (8 floor) and open until 6 o'clock of the evening. Very nice friendly staff. Two metro stations less than five minutes walk from hotel. Hotel has nice spa for additinal cost of 15 euro a day. Free Wireless internet but works pretty low - but cable internet is great (cable provided) I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in Barcelona?”
Reviews.Author: BergenboyBergen
Reviews.Content: Fantastic breakfast. Rooms were good. Nice sunroof with pool:) The only petty about the hotel is that you have a twentyfiveminutes walk from the towncentre. Though not far from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of nightlife and beaches”
Reviews.Author: SfromSyd
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the modern and large rooms offered by this hotel, it was nice to have some space for our suitcases for a change! The bathrooms were also fitted out really well and daily maid service ensured we had fresh towels and a top up on toiletries. The location was perfect to explore the nightlife and restaurants surrounding Port Olimpic. It was approximately 15 mins walk to the marina, and we felt safe returning late at night because it was mostly a walk down the main road. The breakfast buffet also offered a good variety. On a negative note, It was quite annoying that the hotel did not provide irons for each room. Some of the staff were not fluent in english and it took several calls and almost an hour of waiting for someone to get back to us about the iron. This was mostly inconvenient when you need to iron your clothes for dinner or a night out after they have been squashed in a suitcase! Tip for the hotel - put an iron in each room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, the best yet”
Reviews.Author: jane190734
Reviews.Content: As frequent visitors to barcelona I have to say that this is the best hotel we have stayed at to date. We read the reviews regarding room sizes etc and we asked the hotel directly for a large room and upon arrival we were given a room that was certainly large enough for us. The staff were very helpful and when a leak in our bathroom ceiling, from the room above occurred, the problem was fixed the same day with little inconvenience to us. The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choices. The location is more favourable to the port olimpic, beach area but is close to metro station and within a good walking distance of the more popular attractions. Last year we stayed at the 5* Pullman Skipper and for what we need a hotel for this did not feel like a step down in class. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: MattOR
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for the price. Rooms are clean and comfortable with a modern decor, but a bit on the small side. Small gym and rooftop pool are available to guests for free. The breakfast buffet is well worth the extra 10 euros. Hotel is located 15 minutes walking distance from the modern marina area and seafront, and 5 minutes from the the nearest metro station. Immediate vicinty of the hotel is a litte trashy and unappealing although did not feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Very good. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller38
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while ago now but this was a great stay esp when you consider the very good rate we got off the H10 website. Rooms clean. Tidy. Staff good and helpful. Location questionable but hey when on holiday who minds walking. Tubes nearby if you dont fancy it. Very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hen weekend”
Reviews.Author: stinger9012
Reviews.Content: Hotel:- although further out than expected was ideal as a base. The staff were very attentive in all aspects. Queries, cabs into town airport etc.... The rooms were spacious and very clean. Breakfast was certainlyt plentiful. The roof top pool although small was pleasant enough. But hey the beach was only 20mins walk away. It was an ideal position if you favour the beach/stroke marina enviroment. And to be honest it was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Ramblas. The metro and taxis are so easy to use distance really is no issue. The staff were great. Would return with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Staff made it a net positive experience”
Reviews.Author: PHILIPMARSHALL
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with my wife and three children. We chose the H10 as we wanted something just outside the main center and close to the beach. Plus we wanted connecting rooms which they could provide. It was a little further out than I anticipated on the map....with children a 15min walk to the beach and 30mins+ to the restaurants/center...but managable. Initial impressions were not positive. With respect to the rooms, one room was warm/humid due to lack of air conditioning, another had a leak beneath the sink and both had dirty floors. With respect to the checking-in process, while we never used the rooftop pool during our stay (although it is quite small when we looked), we did have included in our package the indoor pool/spa but was told on checking-in that it would cost 15 euro per day (I chose not to argue as it was irrelevant as we spent all day on the beach/sightseeing, but not something I would have expected from such a hotel). However, when we called reception during the stay about anything (such as the room issues or additional matters during the stay such as ordering a taxi that can seat 5 people) they responded very efficiently. I have to say they were consistently positive and responsive. While I think there are better deals in Barcelona due to H10's location, the staff's attitude, along with the excellent breakfast, would make me return and give a net positive recommendation. Positive on the rooms once the issues were addressed....excellent showers (very strong and plenty of hot water) and spacious/clean bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great view, great breakfast, great roof-top pool - GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: bixgurl
Reviews.Content: Good points: 1. Roof top pool with bar, fabulous views 2. Floor to ceiling windows (I was on 9th floor, I think) so great views across the urban marina area 3. Marble bathroom, jacuzzi bath, robe and slippers 4. Great lobby, very grand! Water feature with white pebbles 5. Walking distance to the marina and the sea 6. Fresh coffee maker in the room - one with a choice of ground coffee 'pods' 7. Huge selection of food at breakfast - everything you can imagine from palm hearts, to tuna pastry, and about 5 or 6 different types of croissant. 8. Good selection of toiletries Bad points: 1. Wireless would never work in my room, so I had to get an ethernet cable (the shortest I had ever seen!) for a 20 Euro deposit 2. Need to take a taxi to go to the centre of the city (and most places apart from the marina/beach where you can walk) 3. Roof top pool was supposed to be open til 8pm but they kicked me out early 4. Bed was big, but quite hard Bottomline... Great! Very sleek, I would stay here for a holiday or work trip...

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great service and ammenities just a bit out of the way but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: cfullen
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced at this hotel was helpful and professional. We found the rooms to be very clean and spacious with everything we needed such as minibar and free internet. The breakfast buffet had a very wide choice of fresh produce and the hotel had a modern decor. The only down side was the hard beds and the location. It was a bit of the way but was close to a metro station and some restaurants and supermarkets. This did mean that we were in a nice quiet area at night and were still able to walk home from the harbour and beach at night. Overall, great hotel and we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A modern business hotel in a boring neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: rb63
Reviews.Content: I happened to teach at University Pomeu Fabra which is less than 5 min walk. Also: the beach is not far - BUT: if you are into sightseeing, going out, shopping, nightclubbing etc. then this location in the eastr of the city is not the best. My room on the 10th floor was huge (and the sight over Barcelona quite good) - but size varies (from what I saw from the floor plans) and the view into the backyard is also not a must-see. Internet was free but the connection awful. As usually, the pool looks nicer in the internet. And quite honestrly, I did not understand the opening hours: The firstr day there was no attendant at 7pm, and the next day there was none at 10.30 am. Masybe in between the bar is open and the deck chairs usable. A plus: the good breakfast buffet (the price of which seems to vary, it said € 17.50 at the reception price list but € 10 in the restaurant itself).

Reviews.Title: “Rudest barman ever............3 star really.”
Reviews.Author: lsilver
Reviews.Content: In short: Checking in - poor, unorganised Pool Total of 8 sunbeds (no exhaggeration), no food served!! Breakfast 10euro & lots of choice but regularly ran out with no replacement Room service Stops or either 10pm or 11pm - pointless Concierge Lovely helpful man (if you can find him) Rooms Ok, clean and about 3.5* I think Irons When we needed an iron, they said cupboard was locked and cant find the key. So 8 girls out on the town and no iron..... nightmare (we bullied them & miraculously they found it) Bar Cheap prices at the bar (3euro wine!!), but bar man sooooooo rude. Some of us speak spanish and some not. A girl asked him in English if he thinks spain will win the football - his repl "if you want to speak with me, speak in spanish" and turn his back on her!!! Location is about 30min walk from Port Olymipco, or 10euro in taxi. It was ok, but not friendly at all really

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly service, mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBum14
Reviews.Content: The H10 Marina is a pretty plain-looking hotel, a couple miles outside the city center. The area is safe enough, but is a few blocks at least from anywhere you'd want to be (with the nearest attraction being the beach area. It's also four or five blocks from the nearest subway stop. There are not a whole lot of good restaurants in the surrounding area (or maybe we just didn't find them...). One good thing about being outside of town is that there are convenience stores nearby that are extremely cheap, which is a nice break from the high city-center prices. Though the outside was plain, the inside lobby was very nice. The staff was always friendly and helpful, and the restaurant and bar were both very good. We ate breakfast at the restaurant each day, which had a buffet with a great selection. Highly recommended. The rooms were clean and modern. The beds were pretty hard, which may or may not be your thing (it's not ours). We had to settle for 2 twins, as they were all out of the queen rooms. The bathroom was very small, and the shower leaked so that the bathroom quickly turned into a small lake each time we showered. So would I stay here again? Probably not. But I wouldn't necessarily discourage others from it; it definitely has its pros and cons.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, clean, near beaches”
Reviews.Author: cato17
Reviews.Content: Overall pretty good. Became an H10 member to save 10% but no champagne welcome. Front desk folks rather curt. Breakfast was crazy big. Area is OK but pretty much expect a 10 min. walk to get anywhere... beach, restaurants, etc. Computers slow and only 1/2 worked, but nice it was free. Didn't spend too much time at rooftop pool, but should have. Rooms were big and bathrooms nice, but expect rock hard beds. Bullfighting arena up the street - worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourites in town”
Reviews.Author: Devonair
Reviews.Content: THe reception is a bit slow during checking in and out, so please consider this if you are leaving the Hotel in a rush to the airport. Rooms are fairly large and fully equipped with newish LCD Satelinte TV screens. The minibar has a small selection of softdrinks, water and a couple of beers (could do with a revamp). Breakfast is an experience you should not miss. The variety of fruit, cooked, cold and hot food that this Hotel offers is quite uncommon in this part of the world. Meeting rooms of various sizes at affordable prices are available and fully equiped. Tip for joggers: Go towards the sea (straight outside the Hotel fron door for 1km) Olimpic Port) then turn right and keep going.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but hens and stags not welcome!”
Reviews.Author: Casper323
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, value for money. Locals and hotel staff appeared to not be impressed by our Hen party of 10 girls! Staff at hotel told us to be quiet at 11pm! Some bars along the beach/marina did not let us in as the bride had a veil and a wand! Great for couples. Pool on terrace was lovely, area is a bit small for the amount of guests that stay there. Room service ended at 11pm, would have liked to get a cup of tea somewhere as there is no kettle in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in quite area”
Reviews.Author: hahahippoo
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with our stay here at H10 Marina! Nice clean & bright room that had a very modern feeling to it. Free wi-fi with no strings attached was a bonus! We tried their 10 euro breakfast buffet and it was well worth it. Hotel is about a 10min walk from the nearest metro station and a fairly cheap cab ride away to Las Ramblas. Hotel staff were pleasant and very helpful! We forgot to make photocopies of our passports & the front desk staff made us copies w/o any hassles. Would probably stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It is such a wow hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shpak-lena
Reviews.Content: I was welcomed with a complimentary glass of champagne, this was a good start. My room had a great view and was very spacious. There is a fantastic swimming pool on the 10th floor with a beautiful view. Spa area is awesome, there are several pools with different water, sauna and steamer and much more. They give you towels and swimming caps. Breakfast is so delicious, I actually never eat in the morning but I couldn’t resist this one. There are several bars and restaurants in the hotel, and I really liked the cigar and wine bar on the -1 floor. It looks very stylish and there is a grand piano. The reception is very friendly and helpful, except for the manager, a guy who looks older than the others, short and fat. He is rude and unpleasant, but he usually stays in the back office and comes out only if something happens. So never mind this. The hotel location is great, it’s a 3 minute walk from to the sea and about 5 minutes to the Auditorium Hall where the main concerts are held. It takes only 15 minutes to the Catalunya Square and Sagrada Familla (different directions). All in all, I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious service and extremely rude and unhelpful staff, our holiday ruined!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle240
Reviews.Content: After re-scheduling our trip due to the Volcano eruption we re booked in as 6 girls instead of the original 19!!! We felt that being in our thirties we would choose a recommended hotel that could accustom our needs for a non typical Hen weekend. We were very much looking forward to it and made sure there was everything to make it a fantstic weekend...Champers on Ice and we booked in at all the fantastic restaurants. However, on our arrival the rooms were not ready after the stated booking in time so we were all forced to get changed in the toilets having to head to the beach and amuse ourselves until we could all freshen up. Of course this happens at times and after we made this point we were more than satisfied with a complimentary glass of champagne. Later that evening we were told to quiet down in the bar at 9 p.m - I felt that we were at a normal volume plus were not the only patrons spending lots of money at the bar. Due to the atrium lay out the noise carries on, due to acoustics (but I did note that the very next night a group of 11 men were not told to quiet down when being very raucous in the very same bar). After our night out at a restaurant I arrived home at 1.20 a.m to find that my room was playing music and had been doing so since 1 a.m. I immediately continued my role as 'Mum' and sent all to bed and the music off. We had not been provided with water in the mini bar and I felt that due to my Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Diabetes conditions plus needing to rehydrate my friends I went down to reception to ask to buy some water. I was refused quite rudely and was informed there had been a few complaints about the music being on for 20 minutes. I apologised for this and said it would not happen again the Hen fun had got slightly loud but that we all needed water. After still being refused I advised that not rehydrating could be detrimental to not only my health but my friends. I was given two glasses of water and was told that the two glasses was all I was getting. I took the gentlemans name on reception; Carlos - as I thought this outrageous treatment after mixing the hot climate and alcohol consumption. The next morning our 'Hen' was extremely rudely advised that any more music or noise and we would be kicked out Immediately. Going down to breakfasts we were made to feel absolutely uncomfortable and that we had all done something really, really wrong. We had dirty looks from the staff and were spat answers rather than treated with respect as all people should regardless of muisc being played, which we continually apologised for. It wasn't just at Breakfast we were made to feel like this it was every time we were in the hotel and this one 20 minute incident ruined the whole trip for us due to the extreme reactions from staff. When checking out on the morning of 23rd May I asked the female receptionist if they had a complaints Ombudsman I could contact - after a purposefully quiet night spent treading on egg shells and our concern at being threatened to be kicked out if we even breathed loudly, we still received atrocious treatment from staff at Breakfast and I felt compelled to try and air these views but in a letter rather than with the staff. Who I felt showed their distaste at our 20 mins of noise far too much. I would expect a professional reaction to our apologies and then for it to be dropped so we could enjoy our trip. I was very rudely laughed at by the female receptionist and after asking her name she took off her badge and spat that she would never give me her name and how could we complain after making noise for 20 mins on the first night. I pointed out that this treatment could not continue after our apologies and putting it into perspective we had some fun for TWENTY MINUTES...apologised for it then spent the rest of our trip being punished for it, Which is disgusting and uncalled for. Her colleague; Juiz Ramonez laughed and sarcastically said "what you gonna do? Complain about the noise you made that first night?" and they both laughed at me. In all my life spent holidaying for business and leisure (Barcelona included) I have never experienced such a negative, rude and sub standard service. We did not get to have all our planned treatments or champagne and lovely dinners in the hotel so we did that at The Port where we were welcomed with open arms, had fantastic food and met some beautiful local people and their families. Our 'Hen' and all of us were of course disappointed but we put it down to the staff letting their personal distaste cloud their professional judgement. Owning her own beach bar here at home our 'Hen' knows that great Customer Service is paramount to her bar/Restaurants contiuned success and reputation. We will enjoy the culture and beauty that Barcelona has to offer again, of that I am sure, but we will never step foot in this hotel or recommend it to friends, family, colleagues or customers.

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: celery74
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fab, clean, friendly staff, great breakfast, and close to the marina for wandering and looking at the boats, not on top of everything but walking through the city parks was so much fun and an easy walk to the born area and onto the gothic area. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone going to stay if you want some comfort and not to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Tigra86
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. We spent there 7 days and dind't want to leave. Just some of the advantages are: -very friendly & helpful reception -terrific view (we had a room on the 6th floor, so it could even be better if you stay higher) -absolutely the best breakfast I have ever tried in Spain -a wow pool area on the roof, but it's closed in cold weather -great room -awesome spa center with everything you can think of in it -stylish wine & cigar wine -all necessary toiletries and amenities -free internet, wi-fi and in the business center There are no negative points to mention. The location is great. At first it seems to be away from everything, but it's not true. The hotel is perfectly located between all the points of interest: -7 minutes walking to the sea -5 minutes walking to the concert hall Auditorium -15 minutes walking to Sagrada Familia -15 minutes walking to the Gothic quartal and La Rambla -20 minutes walking to Placa Cataluna Service is great. We wanted to go to Tibidabo, and the girl at reception spent about 20 minutes explaining directions, with all details and very well. They also helped me print my boarding passes, tickets, etc. There are 2 metro stations very close to the hotel - Marina (red line, just 3 stops directly to Placa Cataluna) and Bogatell. I will definately stay in this hotel again when I am Barcelona. I would want to go anywhere esle. Don't forget to join the H10 loyalty program and collect points for each night. Then you get special benefit for your next stays.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid.. Don't let the Brand/Marina fool you, this is in tramp city”
Reviews.Author: marksw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace, firstly, there's no Marina, no water, nothing that compliments the fact that they have called it H10 MARINA. It's in the shoddy end of town, surrounded by mini tramp camp sights, the hotel is tired and old, smells of chemicals through out. Beds are rock solid.. as a comparison knock the nearest table to you as you are reading this.. That's the bed... You have to ask reception to call a taxi, it's so far out it takes 10-15 mins, and then they always add sneaky surcharges on, probably a danger charge for being there. Staff were un interested, cleanliness was ok, not great, it just felt old and out of the way.. It's cheap, it's near the Nord bus station.. but i'd rather cut my legs off and drag myself down las ramblas than stay here again even for £1 a night. They need to change their name to H10 Dirty street in Barcelona, above a main train line and surrounded by tramps.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: beb111
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and had a comfortable stay. The staff is very nice and accommodating. The hotel itself is not in a very ideal location. We were initally concerned at the area but got used to it and it was not bad after all. There are two Metro stations not too far away from the hotel. However, we did not feel safe walking at night from/to the Metro so we just took the cab in the evenings. The cab rates are very reasonable in Barcelona. We did not use a lot of the facilities of the hotel, except for the pool. It is on the rooftop overlooking Bareclona....fantastic view! The rooms do not have coffee makers. We requested for hot water one morning and were being charged about 5 euros for a pot of hot water. No thanks. Overall, it was a nice stay but I would stay at a more central location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - close to the sea and also the lovely El Born district”
Reviews.Author: Jude01
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a 5 day visit to BCN. At first, the hotel seemed a bit far away from things but once we found our way around it turned out to be absolutely fine. The weather was great, so a 10/15 minute walk to get to a nice restaurant/bar in the el Born /Barri Gotic area was a pleasure. But if you are looking for a nice bar/restaurant 'just down the road', this isn't the place for you. There's no denying that the beds are hard but we didn't find them too uncomfortable. But these observations are minor. The hotel was clean, our standard double room very spacious and comfortable, the efficient (if not overly friendly) staff all spoke excellent English, the metro station was very near.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Borderline Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: BittenTravelBugs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a popular travel website not really knowing its location. We had a pretty good idea after cross referencing with other websites and stayed for 1 night because our hotel of choice was unavailable. Not only was the hotel prohibitively far away from enjoying the charm and character of central Barcelona it was a little scary getting to the hotel from the nearest subway stop, Bogatell. After a walk later and a fun time spent eating and touring at the harbour area of Port Olympic we would have opted for the Ciutadella-Vila Olympica metro station and made the longer walk to the hotel from there. It seems everything from the Hotel towards the water was nice and everything away from the hotel dodgy and certainly not worth a walk. We checked in, had the complimentary glass of champagne, headed to the basic room you would expect from a price based website booking and immediately noticed our small interior room obviously smelled like smoke. After a minimal amount of complaining we were moved to a large corner suite with full windows and a king size bed and had our second glass of complimentary champagne. Now we felt good and the night's stay was worth the money and effort to get there. The hotel is nice and appears new, our room was very spacious and comfortable, the staff was friendly, and the pool/spa was amazing. We checked out the next day and thankfully spent the next three nights in a more conveniently located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Diddi87
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend went down to barcelona to celebrate my birthday this march. We looked here at tripadvisor and decided to choose H10 Marina. I used to live in Barcelona for a while and must say, even though the hotel is situated a little bit from the city center, that it's all worth it! When I arrived a few hours before my boyfriend I was meet by friendly smiles and a glass of nice spanish cava. The room was wonderful and bright. I had absolutely nothing bad to say about the room except the stone hard bed. This is very common in the mediterranian though. On my birthday The hotel manager sent up a bottle of cava and some other really cool things to our room to wish me happy birthday from the hotel. I, myself, work in a hotel and this to me was so excellent that I'll start doing it in my hotel. This is absolutely one of the best hotels I've stayed in, nice rooms, excellent service,

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel if you need to stay in this area”
Reviews.Author: texantraveler4
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay in this specific neighborhood of Barcelona near my son's apartment, so I preface my comments based on that. If I didn't need to stay in this neighborhood, I would have stayed downtown close to Las Ramblas or perhaps right on the water. Having said that, this hotel is only about a five block walk to the water and the Port Olympico, and it's only about two blocks to the metro stop that takes you to Las Ramblas, etc., in just a few stops. What I liked about the hotel--great staff, exceptionally clean, very nice place, largish-room. Staff is comfortably multi-lingual. There are tiny coffee shops in the neighborhood and each morning we visited a different one. What I didn't like: bed mattresses too firm for my taste and the poor soundproofing: We were awoken every morning at 7AM by a shrill alarm in the room next to us. The bathrooms are very nice, but you can hear other people taking showers in the morning. This was a rather last minute trip and we felt lucky to find a place to stay. Everything seemed to be full or over 200 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic rooms. Quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: atltravelm0m
Reviews.Content: This hotel was completely adequate and clean. The rooms are basic, not plush. It met our touring needs: a clean room, decent bathroom, wireless internet (which wasn’t very strong in our room, but okay in lobby), in-room safe, and hair dryer. With the room rate we received, it lived up to our expectations. The pool deck has a nice view of Barcelona. The location of the hotel was fine…more of a residential area. There were grocery stores, which we used instead of the minibar and paying for the breakfast buffet. We enjoyed our walks through a nearby park. It is very close to the Zoo as well. It’s an easy 20 minute walk to the Barri Gothic district and there are 2 metro stations close by. We did not use any of the hotel amenities outside of the room. The front desk was very helpful. I requested extra pillows and they immediately delivered them to the room. To sum up, we like the location and cleanliness of the room. The beds could have been a bit more comfortable and the wireless a bit better, but both were still okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineO6
Reviews.Content: had a fab time at this hotel in a great location the New Year celebrations at this hotel were very good the food was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: SyedYaz
Reviews.Content: First impression - the exterior was very good, even though the location was out of the hustle and bustle of the main city. FRONT DESK: The initial front desk personnel were not very forthcoming, and were more cold than friendly. After checking in, there was no assistance provided to assist with our luggage. We did ask for a room with a view, but they said that the rooms facing the front of the building had separate beds, so we chose to go for the rooms facing the back. Little did we know that those rooms faced walls filled with graffiti, and was facing the back of another building, with no view to speak of. ROOM: The layout of the room was completely off. The wardrobes were spacious, but lacked an iron and an ironing board. There were two sofas which faced a wall, and not the TV, as would be the case in most other hotels. The bed was spacious, but comfort was just a little above average. There was a table in front of the bed which also housed a rather small TV with only local channels and no in-house satellite or pay-per-view channels. The TV was again not aligned in the middle of the bed - rather it was pushed towards the corner of the wall. WASHROOM: All essential toiletries were provided. However, a bathrobe and slippers were not part of the package. Funnily enough, the wash basin was actually outside the washroom. The tub was adequate, and was partially covered with a glass panel, but did not have any sections where we could place the shampoo and conditioners etc. making it rather inconvenient to reach out for those things while in the midst of a shower. DINING: Breakfast was the only meal that we had at the restaurant, as it was part of the package. Overall, they had a very good variety to select from. What was disappointing, however, was that they did not offer freshly brewed coffee or tea. That was a self-service vending machine - which was not what you would normally expect. IN CONCLUSION: Overall, a slightly economical and reasonable hotel. I might have been a little picky, but a few small things here and there could have made a huge difference to the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lakerlynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 night prior to boarding a cruise with a large group. I can't comment on the value or the rates as the hotel was included in our package as was the breakfast. Check in was orderly and clerks were friendly and spoke English. While the beds were firm, they didn't interfere with our ability to sleep. The breakfast was amazing and there is more than one coffee machine and there were no lines for coffee at all. We walked everywhere from here - even to the Sagrada Familia, the Barri Gotic and Las Ramblas. We made every attempt to say good morning or good evening in Spanish as well as please and thank you and this makes a huge difference. I think the key is that you will be treated as you treat others. We were treated very well and enjoyed our stay in this hote.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: metalkpretty1
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with this hotel. Although I was a little worried about the fact that it was approx. 15 min. walk from Barri Gotic, it turned out the walk was never a problem and during the day it was nice to cut through the beautiful city park, which we likely wouldn't have sought out otherwise (we were also close to the water and a metro stop). It also meant that our room was always quiet and we could get a full night's sleep. Our room was large, bright and spacious, with large windows and a great view of the city. The furniture all appeared fairly new and unworn, and we found the bed really comfortable. On top of that, we found the service excellent and staff very helpful. The breakfast buffet (a very large selection for the price) and free wireless also meant good value for our money. Our complaints were tiny and not really enough to detract from the stay; The bathroom, although large and clean, had a bizarre shower-door set-up that meant you were guaranteed to get water all over the floor. It also seems like a lot of tour groups use this hotel, so prepare to be confronted with mass crowds periodically overwhelming the place (which panicked us when we were trying to check out and get a taxi to the airport, but the staff were nice enough to see we weren't a part of any group and made sure we got checked-out quickly and got us a car despite the crowds).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: LeinsterIrelandRuby
Reviews.Content: Some former reviewers nearly put me off staying at this hotel but I'm glad now that I went ahead and booked it. We found the hotel to be in a great location as the marina and beach were only about 10 mins walk away and the city centre was just a short hop on the metro ( or a nice walk away ). The room was a good size and nice and clean. The bathroom had everything you might need even a toothbrush. I would really recommend the breakfast as they had a brilliant choice and it set you up for the day. It costs €10 if not included in deal. Dinner in the restaurant cost €48 for two and this included a glass of wine and a bottle of beer. Portions weren't huge but it was very good. We didn't use the pools but this was simply because we were too busy touring the city. We used the Touristic Bus that cost €27 euro for 2 days and found it very handy to hop on and off and to go back to the places we wanted to spend more time in. The 10 trip metro ticket is the best value as it will take you andywhere in the city. We only had one bad experience down near the marina at night when one male became quite intimidating and brushed up against my husband a couple of times, We think he was trying to locate where he had his wallet but when told firmly to go away he left us alone. We kept our passports and most of our cash in the hotel safe and only brought enough for the day with us. I would say to visitors to be sensible and keep very little cash on them and not to attract attention. We did meet an Australian couple who had been pickpocketed on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and fair”
Reviews.Author: teklord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our 10 day holiday in Barcelona. The hotel is very well loacated, 10 minutes away from the Barcelonetta beaches and 2 minutes away from a metro station. The room was clean, although a bit noisy with a opened window. The staff was also very polite and nice, gave us a lot of good tips and helped us find our way through Barcelona. The price was also OK for this month of the year, so all in all it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Was Great”
Reviews.Author: louisepurple
Reviews.Content: Hi On reading the reviews on this hotel, I was a bit dubious about going there, but had already booked so was too late to change hotels. I travelled with my mum who is in her 70's. The hotel is in a very quiet area and yes it does look a bit seedy and run down when you get out of the metro. (4 mins walk from Hotel) I got used to the area and you did not feel unsafe or anything like that. You are only 3 stops on the yellow line to St. Jaume which is right in the Latin Quarter of Barcolona. I was glad we were in a quiet place as I could not have stood staying near Las Ramblas with all the constant noise and traffic. The hotel was great, staff friendly, breakfasts were out of this world, with a choice of 120 dishes, they even had champagne! Swimming pool on the roof was a bit small (and freezing!) and with great views, but we still ventured in. There is an indoor pool with sauna, jacuzzi etc but that cost 14 euros each time to use it which was a rip off, so we didn't bother. You can buy 10 tickets on the metro for about 8 euros which is great value. The Tour buses are brilliant, hop on/off and you get to see loads.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Port Olympic”
Reviews.Author: PharmaGirl09
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend at the beginning of August. We booked through Hotwire.com and got a room rate of £65 per night for a doudle room. This was incredibly competitive given that it was high season. We arrived at the hotel by cab at 10.30pm. Whilst we were not offered a glass of bubbly the check in was quick and efficient. I had emailed the hotel in advance of our stay and requested a room on a high floor with a big window. Looking at the photos of some of the rooms on trip advisor, they looked quite small. Our room was really quite big with several large windows. The bathroom was clean and modern and the aircon worked well. The only real complain I have is the bed was really uncomfortable. The mattress was very hard. Some travellers have said that this hotel is in the middle of nowhere. I think this is a little unfair. The nearest metro is Bogatell which is a 4 minute walk. Alternatively you can walk less than 10 mins to Marina Metro which is very convenient for most places you are going to want to go. The real attraction of the location of this hotel for me was the fact that is was only 10 - 15 mins walk to Port Olympic and the beach! We had some great meals at the marina and we also strollled to Barcelonetta one morning. This is a long stroll but a fabulous route along the sea front all the way. We never had breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on the quality of the food. The bar man made a grreat mojito even if it was a little pricey. We went to the roof top pool on a couple of occasions. There is a bar there too. It did tend to be frequented by hen/stag parties most of the day and there are only a handful of sun loungers so don't get too excited about this facility. Having said that it was nice to go on the roof and admire the view whilst sipping sangria with my feet in the pool. Overall, a nice hotel with great access to the beach and Port Olympic.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, lovely reception but room was a bit of a let down”
Reviews.Author: Elliemiss
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for one night and feel glad that it wasn't any longer. On arrival the reception staff were excellent, very friendly, complimenty glass of champagne on offer. Reception area lovely, with small bar and seating area, didn't eat here but looked lovely surroundings to eat in. On first impressions the room was clean and modern, bathroom was clean but not as good as other four star hotels. Location was good, metro and tram stops close by, and could stoll to port olympic. Hotel wa in the middle of what appeared to be a residential area, not the most attractive but don't be put off by this, was still quiet. Room service was swift but, bed consisted of two singles pushed togther and not comfortable and a alot of noise throughout the night such as doors banging. Also, walls very thin, could hear converstions in other rooms, was a little annoying, didn't have a good nights sleep. Pool area very small but clean and comfortable, towel provided free from pool bar, don't expect to swim in the pool because it's too small! Also, didn't open until bar opened at 11am. Overall, it wasn't terrible but wouldn't go back, didn't think it was worth 80 GBP per night. If you could get a good deal though it would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: LovesLatinAmerica
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the H10 Marina Barcelona began with a walk in the heat from the Estacio de Franca train station (from the airport train). After arriving at the hotel, my husband and I were very hot and tired from our red eye from Philadelphia. We were told that our room wasn't ready. I was surprised at the next comment... "But you signed up for our (free) loyalty card, had a long flight, and are staying here for a week. We will upgrade you to a junior suite. If you come back downstairs after noon, there will be a complimentary glass of cava for each of you." Score! We had booked our flight and hotel on travelocity.com and figured it might be better to stay at a **** outside of the city center for the same cost as a * close to downtown. We weren't disappointed. We did turn down the hotel breakfast (at an additional 10 euros/night) and opted instead to go to a cafeteria/cafe 2 blocks away (on the way to the Bogatell metro station) for a lighter breakfast. The walk to the beach was pleasant, and the walk to the Bogatell metro stop (yellow line) was convenient. It took a bit longer to get to the Marina stop (red line), but that wasn't much of a problem either. The Nit (Night) Bus also runs very close to the hotel and leaves every 20-25 minutes from the Placa de Catalunya. Our room was wonderful and the entire hotel was spotless and clean. The pool on the 8th floor was nice, although it was small. The staff was helpful and able to communicate in many languages. It was also nice to have free internet on the 3 computers in the lobby. My 4 minor complaints: 1) In August, everything is closed and there is basically nothing going on in the neighborhood around the hotel. 2) There is no taxi stand near the hotel. 3) Upon checkout, the employee at the desk tried to reassure me that I could take the airport train from the Estacion de Franca without switching lines. He was wrong. (Luckily for me, I didn't believe him.) 4) There was no alarm clock in the room. I would certainly stay here again- especially for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast Ever”
Reviews.Author: msumengen
Reviews.Content: First thing I must say is, this hotel's fascinating buffet breakfast. The variety was superb. I have never experienced such a selective breakfast when I was abroad. When I was there, they had a promotion which costs 10 euro per person. It was really really cheap for their breakfast. The location of the hotel is a bit far from the centre. However you can easily reach there via metro. In 10 minutes you can reach to beach on foot. I like the location of the hotel since it is quiet and connects me everywhere via metro. Hotel has a modern style. Our standard double room was clean. However, I wasn't so happy with my bed. It was slightly moving on the ground, when I was turning during night. Nevertheless, it is not a big complain. They have free wireless internet but in our room there was no signal so I had to go to lobby or connected from the stairs. There is a swimming pool on the roof of the hotel. It is extremely small, that's why it is not for swimming. However, if you stop by the hotel during day time after a long time walking, it could be extremely relieving. I have been there for sun bath and refreshing myself during day time and I enjoyed a lot. So, the size of the pool was not a big concern for me. I haven't been but this hotel also has a wellness area and it looks attractive from the photos. In conclusion I think when you compare with the price, this hotel could be one of the best in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hate is not a strong enough word”
Reviews.Author: euro13
Reviews.Content: The staff tried so hard to make it a good experience but there were such huge, glaring horrible gaps in the attention to the guests, that I cannot imagine how they continue to do business or how the owners/manager sleep nights, be cause I sure didn't. The walls were so thin that I could literally hear a coin drop in the room next door. Not so bad, really, except the staff knows about this and had no problem putting us in between rooms of loud partying frat boys and did nothing about it despite complaints. When I called to complain, I was told "We did ask them to be quiet". Didn't work. Loud yelling. maybe fighting, frequent use of the F word bellowing through the wall on one side at 4 am, while, on the other side, I am certain, given the noises clearly transmitted through the barely existent wall, that the rest of the party was making a porno film. Horrifying. It was cheap enough, but not worth it. Not worth it at all. I'd rather sleep naked on the beach for a week than ever spend another second in the h10 barcelona marina.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business but not for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: VidiCi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this H10 hotel for 2 nights during the ITCA fair. It is a nice hotel if you are on a business trip. Don't go there if you are planning a city trip. It is not centrally located and the neighborhood isn't really great. The room was very modern with all features, the walls however are very thin, I normally don't have a problem with that, but here it was really remarkable how the noise caught the attention. The breakfast was excellent; a large buffet and a huge choice. The staff was friendly and helpful. The next time that I'm visiting Barcelona as a tourist I certainly will not stay here, but I will look for a smaller, better located and cosier hotel than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service and location!!! Do not saty here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Passion4Travel718
Reviews.Content: This the worst hotel I´ve ever stayed at. The room was extremely small for 2 people. I can´t even explain how small the shower was. It was also far from central Barcelona. We had to take a taxi every time we wanted to go sightseeing or shopping. But the worst was the service. The bartender ¨Paul¨ had the worst attitude. There was a couple of other guests also complaining about him. I had asked for a drink and he said to me ¨Dont you see I am busy at the moment¨. I couldn´t believe it ! I am travel agent and I travel a lot for work and I have never experienced something like that before. There were no irons in the rooms. We had to wait until one becomes available and when you had finished using it you had to return it. I dont understand why this hotel wouldn´t have irons in each room. It was a terrible experience. I wouldn´t recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Chelsm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok. The beds were hard, no clocks in the rooms and the staff was rude. The location is terrible, not close to anything. Only thing good was the breakfast that was included.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel poor air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: tiea
Reviews.Content: we stayed hear for three nights in early july we had a junior suit with a balcony mainly so my wife could have a smoke it cost about 400 quid i think they may have put the breakfast price down as it was only 10 euros each the room was big and nice enough but air conditioning was very poor even in this top range room we had to open the big door onto the balcony at night to get some cool air but then the mosquitos came in and bit us so we could not win but all in all made the most of it , we walked down to the marina most nights only 15 minutes away and ate in the nice marina front restaurants i think i would recommend hotel but warn about poor air conditioning

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location and worse service!”
Reviews.Author: gradle
Reviews.Content: Calling this hotel the Marina Barcelona is a joke. It is a cab ride away from the marina and over a ten euro cab ride to get anywhere of interest. The staff at this hotel is rude and very unhelpful. Finding a hotel for the perfect stay in Barcelona is all about location and this is NOT it. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Happitravels
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that sometimes when I read other reviews for the same location I wonder if we are talking about the same place. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while visiting Barcelona prior to talking a cruise. I was very nervous about the location but it was no big deal. barcelona is such an easy city to get around. There were 4 of us in our group and the first day we bought 10 trip tickets for the Metro which was no more than a 3 minute walk from the hotel. We took the Metro a few times but quickly realized that talking a taxi in Barcelona is very inexpensive and that is what we did most of the time. Our most expensive taxi ride was 10 Euros. All the others were around 6 Euros and split 4 ways it was nothing. We had a Junior Suite on the 9th floor which was very pretty. The bathroom was beautiful even though the shower did through off some water. No biggie. My absolute biggest complaint would be that the beds were very hard but for 3 nights I could live with that. The staff were very helpful with any request that we had and the concierge was wonderful. The hotel had a really nice atmosphere to it and every night we would finish off our day with a couple of drinks in the lobby bar where we had the pleasure of chatting with people visiting from all over the world. We didn't have breakfast or eat at the hotel at any time so I cannot comment on that. All in all, a very enjoyable, smooth visit with no hassles or hiccups at all.
