If I am lucky enough to get back to Barcelona I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel in Barcelona !”
Reviews.Author: N.SURESH
Reviews.Content: We had booked for a 3 night stay through hotwire for a 4 star property in Barcelona supposedly in a great neighbourhood , but ended up getting the H10 Marina Barcelona. Travel sites like Expedia and Orbitz rate it as 4 star but I dont think they do any checking to verify if it is really a 4 star ! Travel sites simply copy other sites without any real review. This is why tripadvisor ratings by actual travellers are increasingly more important before booking these tourist traps ! The hotel is in a place not close to anything ! Minimum of 10 mins walk on a rundown area . You have to walk a minimum of 10 mins to catch a bus or metro ! The place is lonely and bad ! The rooms are good size, but the carpets on the hallways are dirty and worn down. the furniture in the hotel is totally beat up , looks more like the furniture you find in some dorm rooms ! The walls are stained , the wall papers are pealing allover and full of marks and scratches. The worst part of the hotel are the beds ! They are so hard , you feel like sleeping on a box spring and not on the matress ! The springs poke you in several places ! We just could not get sleep. After complaining to hotwire, they talked to the hotel and they put some blankets on top to give some cushioning the next day ! When we complained they tell you that this is good for your back ! You may as well sleep on the floor ! The staff is not very frinedly and unresponsive. There is no coffee maker in the room. The coffee in the bar is about 2 euros ! The breakfast is expensive over 20 Euros ! This is definitely not a 4 star by any means. This is at the most a 2 star by our US Standards ! Please avoid staying in this hotel at this location ! Please be careful booking for 4 star just because they are rated in hotwire or other sites ! Atleast you can change the hotel if you booked through other sites but you have to suffer without proper sleep for getting a so called bargain which was no bargain at all !

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonicaMax
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the location was better than I initially expected after reading the reviews on here. I would've bumped the review up to 4 stars if the air conditioning worked in any of our rooms! We had 4 rooms and the a/c worked in only one of them. The hotel itself is quite nice, the reception area is clean and modern. The chaps working the bar were good fun to talk to and the staff quite friendly and professional. The rooms were clean although the beds were quite hard. The bed covers were light which was a bit of a blessing considering the heat in the rooms!! During the day the area around the hotel was fine, we didn't have any problems walking around at night. The location of the hotel isn't the best to be honest, having said that it's a nice walk past the park through El Born to the Ramblas. A taxi from the Ramblas back to the hotel was only 7 Euros. Well worth it. I have written a long post in the Barcelona forum about myself and 3 other of our party being assaulted in Puerto Olimpico. Please be very careful going out around that part of town at night, I have a broken nose, 2 black eyes and a hairline fracture of my right cheek for a completely unprovoked assault by the bouncers at The Joker Bar. Be very very careful

Reviews.Title: “It might have been a nice boutique hotel...but that was 10 years ago...”
Reviews.Author: tapdancer77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire, but after we found out Hotwire had put us up here, I began to get nervous. I read several negative reviews of the hotel, and they all turned out to be right, unfortunately. The staff was inconsistent at best, at times helpful at times downright rude. They didn't have a room ready for us whenwe arrive to Barcelona, so we had to sit and walk around with no food (no restaurants in the area were open) for several hours, DEAD TIRED, until our room was ready (which was not until after 3 pm!) They weren't even nice about that fact or tried to accomodate us at all! You can tell from the decor that at one time this was a very cute boutique hotel with a very chic design. The problem is, though, that this hotel has not been kept up (lampshades cracked, baseboards highly chipped, and the furniture was all scratched up). Around the time of the 1992 Barcelona Olympics (which is when my partner and I think the hotel was probably built), it was probably a great hotel near Barceloneta port (and it is convenient for that). But now, it's just falling apart. The final straw, however was this: The hotel sent us to a restaurant for what the concierge said was the best paella in town. They told the taxi driver where to take us, but he didn't even take us to the right address! Then, when we got where we were going, there wasn't a restaurant in sight! When we brought this matter to the attention of the front desk staff, they became very rude and began to argue with us. We also distinctly heard them curse us under their breath. Their unprofessional behavior was simply inexcusable. Our hotel was the one black eye on an otherwise wonderful trip to Spain. I would never stay here again nor would I ever encourage anyone else to.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JoeNic
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in the H10 Marina in Barcelona in April 09 and found the Hotel to be magnificant and in this credit crunch times we found it to be really fantastic value for money. The rooms are big and have everything in them that you could possibly ask for and as we stayed with breakfast included i have to say that the breakfast was super and there was something for everybody there. The location is perfect just a short walk from the Marina/Beach and only about a 15minute stroll to the Ramblas. The Staff in the Hotel are excelent and very very helpful and the bar for a 4* hotel is very good value and excelent service is there as it is throughout the hotel. Oh the spa is very good and good value if you have the time to spend in it, we had a late flight home so we went there before we went home and it was brilliant way to relax before the flight home. In short a real gem in a perfect location that wont cost you the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location with good transport links”
Reviews.Author: JayJaySouthend
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated in the Olympic port area & a 10 minute walk from the beach / Arts hotel. Whilst its called Marina, you, can't see the sea from the hotel (apart from roof-top pool). There is not much in the immediate area, but good sea-front restaurants are 10 mins walk away. The metro station is a few minutes walk away & great transport links with the city. Gothic centre / Las Ramblas 20 mins by metro. If yopu prefer to stay outside of the hustle & bustle but still convenient then, this is the hotel for you. Its a lovely hotel, standard rooms, but clean & well presented. Only criticism was that air conditioning doesn't work this time of year & at times the room was a bit stuffy. Would definately return. Breakfast buffet was fab, however we got a deal through last minute that included in offer. I heard someone say it was €18, which I think is fairly pricey for breakfast but just above average in Barcelona. V easy from airport. Bus to Catelona place & then metro (with ine change). Remember, the metro is a pleasure to travel on; air conditioned, trains every 2 1/2 mins & clean!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olygirl
Reviews.Content: I took my group of 16 people to H10 Marina for a 3-night stay. The staff was nice and efficient and the rooms were very clean and modern. Some people said the walls were thin but I didn't hear a thing. The air-conditioning worked but we could also open our windows. It is about a 20 - 30 min. walk to Borne and there aren't a lot of highly recommended restaurants nearby. I would say this hotel is perfect if it were a bit closer to the attractions. However, it is certainly quiet in the evening and can offer a good night's sleep. The breakfast was huge, fresh but expensive. We didn't have one successful pickpocketing experience during our Barcelona stay but there were a few attempts. The taxi to the airport is 30 Euros on a Thursday and between 34 - 39 Euros on a Sunday. We felt the neighbourhood was safe and there weren't many people around. Bogatell is indeed the closest metro but Marina isn't too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a not great location”
Reviews.Author: norfolk23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the this hotel for a business conference and it was fine and have stayed in worse. Facilites clean and despite what others have said, found the staff perfectly pleasant, maybe a bit distant but did a professional job. Loved the security guards outfits! The breakfast choices are enormous and fresh but did not eat in the hotel otherwise. Calling the hotel Marina is a slight stretch of the imagination and the marina is really about a 15/20 walk depending on your pace. It's not a location for a rambling stroll but still close enough by taxi or metro to the central area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - location not that nice”
Reviews.Author: Jacopone
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel three times in the last year, mainly for business reasons. It is a nice 4* hotels with all the amenities you need. Staff is nice and efficient. Not so nice is the fact that you have to pay at the arrival, which I found quite strange. However, rooms are spacious, and very very clean. Some rooms need some more maintainance: in the last one in which I have been the window was not closing properly....luckly outside temperature was perfect. As i said I was there for business reasons, so i did not care about the location with respect to main turistic areas. However if you go there for turistic reasons consider that the area is quite far from the main attractions and that you necessarily need to take the metro to go to the city center (or walk 30-40 minutes to get to the "Born") , also in this area it is quite difficult to find a restaurant (outside the hotel one) to have dinner. So you would need to take the metro also to have a dinner in the city center. On the other hand this make it possible to have a quite good price/quality ratio in comparison to other solutions in Barcelona. In sum if you do not mind taking the metro to visit the city and have a dinner in a good restaurant, this might be a good solution. Otherwise search for something closer to the main attractions area.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, will be happy to stay again”
Reviews.Author: natori
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly renovated and clean. Breakfast is GREAT! All rooms have free WiFi which is not common at all (although signal in my room was weak). Could not find decent restaurants within close walking distance for a dinner but the hotel is close to L1 and L4 on the subway. with L1 it takes 5 minutes to get to Plaza Catalonia. We did stay 1 night at the hotel for dinner which was priced reasonably and elegant but food was not so good. Overall, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “European 4 Star Hotel, as advertised”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKuster
Reviews.Content: This hotel upon arrival, as we walked through the door offered complimentary wine, and snacks. The receptionist offered a suggestion on where we should get great Paella. He was very receptive and helpful. Over all opinion is this: Room was clean, had a typical IKEA modern look, Nice bathroom with marble floor and a very nice shower. Hotel offered travel kit in bathroom, and a scale. Beds were typical for Europe hotels. Flat hard foam ( if this were an American hotel I would deducted on the quality, but since it is an European hotel I can't say its a fair evaluation if I did.) Service and staff was friendly. Location: It was about a 10 minute walk to the nearest subway/Metro stop. The area where the hotel is fine, there were women walking alone in the middle of the night. So I can say the area where the hotel is is safe, but the area at the nearest metro stop is shady at night. My spouse and I had the feeling that this hotel/ marina location was more residential compared to the La Ramba tourist area. We almost felt like we were in a ghost town. There was hardly anyone in the area during siesta and night. It could be because of winter months. It also was about a 15-20 minute walk to the marina area. Opinon on past member posts: I will also say this in regards to past posts. It was unfortunate for who ever had a damaged, uncleaned room. I would assume this was an oversight by housekeeping to report damages or cleaning. I found our room to be very clean, and the lobby was clean. So I can not say this hotel was dirty. For those complaining about pool fee...I am not surprised as most pools in Europe charge, even on military bases to their military members. My last piece of information is, book on a discount website because I paid about $100 for one night verse the average going rate of $200+

Reviews.Title: “Terrible nightmare! And don't expect anything from customer care afterwards”
Reviews.Author: ManuelMauriBrusa
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had the misfortune to experience an horrible stay at the H10 Marina Barcelona from November 25th to November 30th. I went to Barcelona for work and my girlfriend joined me 2 days afterwards to celebrate the first anniversary of our relationship, an anniversary that we will surely remember even though not in the positive way we had hoped for. The Hotel is not up to four-star standard. Although the staff was for the whole period of the stay very kind and professional, the facilities are to say the least very lacking and made our stay a complete nightmare. I work as a junior researcher while my girlfriend is a flight attendant. We are therefore used to constantly travel for work and have been in any kind of hotels all around the world. It was however the first time in our life we had such a terrible experience, having to change the room for four times in just five days! I will hereby shortly describe the problems which occurred during our stay. On the first day, I arrived late in the evening and was given a standard double room. While checking the room, I noticed there was quite a lot of dust under the bed, but did not complain because overall the room seemed ok, though quite cold. I therefore turned the heating on and went to sleep. During the night the room became colder and colder, and to my great displeasure I understood that the heating was in fact not working at all. I spent a night freezing, covered in all the blankets and quilts I could find in the room. The morning after, just before leaving for work, I informed the front desk of the problem and I was informed they would be giving me another room. When I came back in the afternoon, I re-packed the entire luggage I had just un-packed the evening before and moved to the new room. To my great disappointment I noticed that the room I moved into was in the corner of the building and therefore considerably smaller than the previous one and with only a small window while my previous room had a whole wall with windows. I am sure you will understand that, after spending a sleepless night in the cold in a four-star hotel the last thing I was expecting was a room down-grading. I informed the front-desk about the situation but was told that it was the only available room at the moment and that, even if clearly smaller, the room was still in the same room category as the previous room. I was then given the opportunity to move to a junior suite. Of course, the difference in room rates would be charged on my account. But since I was waiting for my girlfriend to celebrate our anniversary I decided to take the junior suite and just pay the difference. During the first night in the junior suite I understood that the hotel had problems with the central heating apparatus and not only with the heating in my previous room, and I spent another night sleeping in the cold. The next morning, while on the elevator, I discussed with other guests of the hotel who confirmed the heating was lacking in other rooms as well. This was confirmed by the front-desk staff –and I wonder why I wasn’t informed of this when I asked to change the room in the first place – but was assured the problem would be solved. Later that evening my girlfriend arrived and to our great pleasure the heating did as well. The junior suite room was, except for the heating system, in order and comfortable. On a side note, it was quite worrisome to notice that the electric panel behind the bathroom door was lacking its plastic cover and was exposed (room 911). The day after, while I was working, my girlfriend informed me there were other problems with the room. In fact our junior suite on the 9th floor was invaded by ants! She called the manager, who at first blamed us saying that it would be normal to have ants in our room since we had brought in food. We had indeed brought some tangerines, but the explanation did not seem very plausible to us; we usually have food in our homes in Switzerland, but this does not mean we all have ants at home. And we were in November. We were then once again moved to another room, this time a junior suite with balcony. Just after moving there, my girlfriend noticed there was water on the floor near the wall dividing the bathtub from the room. There was a water leak and water poured into the room. The manager sent a plumber to fix the leak and we were moved to another junior suite with balcony. The last junior suite with balcony indeed had a balcony. But this was flooded. The drain did not work and the balcony could not be used. The furniture inside the room was in bad shape. For example the mini-fridge’s cupboard door did not close and the wainscots where all damaged and falling out. The water temperature in the shower kept on changing from freezing cold to boiling hot. We informed the front desk of this last point but nothing was done. But these were all minor problems compared to what we had been through to this point – though one would not expect this from a suite in a four-star hotel – and so we decided not to complain anymore and tried to enjoy, however possible, the rest of our short holidays. The last misadventures of our stay were that our room keys stopped working two days in a row (we were in room 804 at the moment the problem arose. We discovered that the guest staying in room 802 on Friday had the same problem with room keys which just quit working all of a sudden). And on the day of our leave, we discovered that we had been debited nearly 60 euro of expenses at the bar – were we had never been – on the 25th. We contested the debit and asked to see the receipt, which was not found and in the end the sum was taken out of our account. In conclusion, our stay at your hotel became a real nightmare. I want to underline once again that the staff was always very kind and professional (although they don’t seem very keen on answering e-mails – I had asked to confirm if there would be any rate changes since I would be using the double room as single occupancy during the first 2 days and never got an answer; nor very flexible – we asked for a salad or sandwich through room service at 23.15 and were informed that would be impossible since room service ended at 23.00). But in general our experience in your hotel was really below that of a four-star standard. During our stay we took pictures to document the various problems described above which we will post on this website NOTE: I wrote to the customer care afterwards. They apologized deeply and said they would offer us a free stay. I contacted them about the free stay three times during the past month. They never answered a single e-mail of mine.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: Pinchy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights about 2 weeks ago. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel (which cost about 28 euros), and I was a bit surprised at the area, as there was quite a bit of graffiti. The hotel reception area is very bright and pleasant, and we were offered cava when we checked in. The underground (Bogatell) is a bit difficult to find, but once we got our bearings, it was only about a 8 minute walk from the hotel. I would be dubious walking around the area if I was on my own or with female friends, as it was quite deserted. Our room was fine, I did read other reviews regarding the air con, and this was not switched on when we were there, which meant we had to leave the window open to get some air into the place. It was a bit noisy with the traffic. As per previous reviews, the bed was hard, but I prefer that to a soft one. We had no problems with the bathroom. The hotel didn't seem particularly full so we didn;t hear any noise from the rooms around us. The breakfast buffet was very extensive and good quality, a bit steep at 17 euros per person I thought (luckily ours was included in our room rate) My only complaint is that the tables were very close to one another and you had to literally squeeze past the other table. The dropping rate of the euro has make a big difference, we went to Taller Tapas (food is really nice) where we had a bottle of wine, 5 lots of tapas and it cost 40 euros. We went for a pizza the following night and with wine, that was about 32 euros. We walked out of the hotel and hailed a taxi back to the airport, and it cost us 38 euros!!! We were charged 12 euros for 2 small bags! Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: johnsapple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years back just after it opened and was absolutely stunned - best hotel i'd ever been in, we were upgraded to a junior suite and as it was summer (it's a business hotel so it was off peak) the rate was extremely low. The room was huge, bathroom bigger than my bedroom at home, then we saw the breakfast room.... It defies description. so many different foods to pck from, great coffee, really fresh looking restaurant. I revisited in early 2007, had to hunt for 2-3 hours to find the best discount on various hotel websites. this time it was a regular room, still ok though, and no breakfast unless we paid about 10 euros. so we went without. it's still a great hotel, has become a bit more eastern european in terms of clientele, barman was quite friendly, gives out free japanese crackers which was quite novel for some guests. I like the hotel and would go back. Reception staff typically spanish, quite a long time to check in and out. room keys switched off to early - quite anoying to have to traipse back down to reception after breakfast. The area isn't too great but it's better than many. served by 2 tube stations, one is 400m or so and easy to find and on a good line, the other (bogatell) a bit hidden. it's about a fifteen minute walk from Borne a really cool place to hang out. def recommend it if you can afford it

Reviews.Title: “Lame Pool Fee”
Reviews.Author: mathers555
Reviews.Content: The main reason i booked this hotel was because of the indoor pool. Nowhere on the site does it say there is a 15 euro fee to take dip. Very disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “If we had been paying, it would have been a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Wojamo
Reviews.Content: It's a long story, but this hotel stay was paid by someone else. We were at the H10 Marina for a total of 2 weeks, so we got a thorough idea for the place and all it had to offer. Overall cleanliness of the hotel was excellent. I agree with most other posters that the breakfast selection was beyond what we could have expected- it's definitely worth the additional amount to get the breakfast added as there is a great variety and it's great energy food to get you started on a day of sight-seeing. However, if you get to breakfast after 9, expect to be diappointed as the staff stops refreshing things after that point and everything gets pretty picked over. The food at the hotel (in the restaurant and wine bar) is overpriced, and not very good. But, the marina is just a 15-20 minute walk away with several good restaurants and pubs. Other than that, the hotel is not what I would consider to be "centrally located". The staff wasn't really helpful as the bulk of them were non-natives (from Cuba, Uruguay, etc.) who couldn't give any directions on where to go and what to see. For the prices they charge for this hotel, I would have certainly expected more, but then again, this was my first visit to Barcelona- so it's quite possible my expectations were too high for this very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie71
Reviews.Content: I walked to the Hotel from the Marina metro station, but it was a bit too far. The Hotels.com site said it was 200 metres, but was more like 400 metres. It's better to use taxis as they are cheap or try another closer metro station (Bogatell), even though it may mean changing trains. On arrival the staff were nice and the hotel was clean and had a nice feel about it. I didn't use the wellness area with the indoor pool. It looked small and was 14 Euros entry fee. The room was a bit small and the TV didn't work so I needed to get that fixed. Like the other reviews, the bed was hard and the bathroom got very wet on the floor when having a shower. The best thing about the Hotel was the location. It's a fairly new area and it was a 5 minute walk to the Marina and the tourist bus stop which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the H10 Marina”
Reviews.Author: shahug
Reviews.Content: We were staying in the hotel for a family wedding and there were 200 of us the hotel is very well located only 10 min walk to the marina, the rooms are spacious and the mini bar is not too expensive compared to other ones we stayed in. The breakfast buffet is the best I have ever seen you name it its there from hot food to cereals, pasteries to cold meats, breads to salads very impressive!! the bar in the lobby was great and they have the nicest white wine I have ever tasted the only downside they close at 1am even for residents. The marina has great restaurants and bars and las ramblas is great for nite life and food also. We spent a week here and I definitely would return again staff were very helpful in the hotel also would defintely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy as well”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo11
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with most of what has been written in previous reviews.Location close enough to the Metro,and the beach,yet away from the crowd.Breakfast was very good.All staff were very helpful, with all requests.From the time you walk out the hotel door ,until you emerge from the Metro in Placa Catalunya is 20 minutes,and I was fine with that,less time to walk to the beach.If you read the previous reviews,you will find truth in all of them,but for the price,I found this hotel fair value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark165
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. Stayed there for 2 weeks. Good location to explore all of Barcelona on foot. A few minutes walking from the beaches, Port Olimpic, Metro, buses etc. A huge breakfast every morning. Very clean. Room somewhat small. Small TV with local programming and CNN, EuroNews, German and French channels. Staff friendly and helpful. Overall would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - but above average”
Reviews.Author: maggs01
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in what I consider to be a good location - 5-10 mins leisurely walk to Port Olympic. Friendly and helpful staff, in particular the guys who run the pool area bar. Rooms are a good size, nice decor and spotlessly clean. However the beds are possibly the most uncomfortable I ever slept in, and the walls are paper thin! Great breakfast, bar food is pretty poor and expensive – we did not try the restaurant - not when there are so may others great ones in Barcelona. All in all pretty happy with our stay, we had a great time – not convinced I would stay at H10 Marina again though

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: HappyHollsNorthWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 marina Barcelona for 5 nights for our honeymoon. I can only say that the hotel and staff exceeded our expectations as did Barcelona itself. The hotel was in easy reach to most attractions at most the maximum walk was 35 min. Metro service was very cheap by purchasing a T10 ticket for 7 euros it allows 10 single trips, these can be used on the metro, railway and busses. I recommend that you purchase one on exit from the airport this will save you 40 euro in a taxi fare and will get you to your hotel within 30 min. The zoo is well worth a visit, costing 15 euro entry it is one of the best I have visited ever. The hotel itself was extremely clean with a daily maid service. As other guests have mentioned the breakfast was fantastic, the restaurant was a bit pricey for what you got but very well served and tasty. We will definitely book again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for a Barcelona Break”
Reviews.Author: Miffers
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the service! All staff courteous and helpful . Superb breakfast buffet including bucks fizz if you want it! Had balcony room at the front with panoramic views of city attractions, spectacular when lit up at night. Rooms were clean, comfortable and functional. Loved the quieter location near Blue Bus Route pick-up points, beach, restaurants, Casino and the Zoo at Ciutadella Park. Felt safe walking back at night. Taxis nearby, easy to hail, reasonable fares to city sights. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others. So much to see and do in Barcelona - would never tire of returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the beach and a 20 min walk into the centre.”
Reviews.Author: kitey75
Reviews.Content: OK well the hotel was clean and tidy, smart and classy in fact. The staff were friendly and helpfull. The location was great for us, we didn't want to be in the centre of Las Ramblas but not a million miles away either. The hotel is a 5 min walk to the casino and all the wonderfull seafood restaurands around it.. The hotel swimming pool is not big by any stretch of the imagination however it does have a good feel to it and the barmen are great, this said you have to get in early to grab a sunbed as there is only room for 10-15 ! I thought that the charge to use the well being centre was a bit steep but I only used it once so wasn't to bothered. The breakfast is great with plenty of varienty including fresh fruits, cereals and cooked foods available.

Reviews.Title: “Clean tidy and adequate”
Reviews.Author: Littlesean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago (sorry for the delay!) on what was my second visit to beautiful Barcelona. This hotel is a good clean hotel with nice tidy modern rooms, everything works and the staff are efficient if not over friendly. I am amazed at some of the reviews in here that have been quite negative and i believe that if you are nice to people they will respond in the same way! A great location for the beach and marina, taxis are easy to get, just flag one down for yourself instead of asking for help all the time, and so what if it costs ten euros to get into town!! Its no big deal, try catching a cab in london......! This is an ideal base for those seeking mid range accomodation, would i go back? Yes i would.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - will go back again”
Reviews.Author: Lyndallama
Reviews.Content: The only reason I have written this review is because some of the reviews on this site nearly put us off booking - and I cannot believe the extent of the problems these people have experienced. We arrived hot and sweaty with 3 teenage girls in tow, to a very warm and friendly reception (including a glass of champagne each for the adults!) There were no problems with our booking and even though we were early, could get into our rooms straight away. We also asked for 2 rooms next to each other which presented no problems whatsoever. The rooms were clean and cool (complimentary air con). The breakfast was superb (more like a brunch) with everything you could possibly want on offer. In fact we had no real requirement for food until our evening meal. Bar service was very friendly - beer was a little expensive, but for a hotel of this standard, not unexpected. The terrace pool area was a little small, but we always managed to get space to catch the rays (5 of us!) and dip into the pool to cool off. Our girls were very impressed with the hotel and the facilities on offer too. In terms of location, although not central, it was a convenient 10 minute stroll to the Marina and beaches, and a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro station. When we required a taxi on our departure, this posed no problem and check out was smooth. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as a great base for seeing the sights and experiencing the beach, and my partner and I fully intend to go back again as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Beach”
Reviews.Author: SteveandKimUk
Reviews.Content: 6 months previously we stayed at the H10 Montecada Hotel in the gothic district, which was perfect for a city break, so we didnt hesitate at booking H10 again. We chose this hotel for its location to the beach/marina area. We arrived late Friday night, and reception was very busy, after an initiall mix up over our room (we emailed and paid in advance and notifed the hotel of our late arrival), they insisted thehotel was full, and no double rooms available! However when we showed them the email and the receipt - they backed down). Other than that great hotel, clean modern, nice room/bathrom, fabulous choice at breakfast. This location would suit anyone wanting to be near Barceloneta Beach/Marina/Paseo de Maritim. No good if you want to be in the city centre (although there is metro station very near). Taxi's 10 Euros into Las Ramblas, Reception were not helpful in ringing taxis on both occasions we asked them. But Taxis can be flagged down off the main road nearby (may take some time). Overall, a good hotel was everything we expected. LOL! the roof terrace pool was very small. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Did what it said on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Bexster
Reviews.Content: Not a perfect location if you want to be in Las Ramblas (who wants to go shopping anyway?) as a 10 minute taxi ride into town (about 10 euros) but great for the small Port Olympic with its 7-10 restaurants, casino and small bars. I was with a party of 12 and had a great time. Breakfast was superb and the rooms were clean with working air con - it was very hot. Pool area small but well kept. Bar staff in poor supply all round - more that 2 drinks and the world caved in :-) Concierge helpful. Middle of the road price wise. No real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LucyS79
Reviews.Content: We (a group of 10) stayed at the H10 Marina in June 2008 on a hen weekend, and I would highly reccomend this hotel. It is clean, well kept with minimalist modern decor and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The location is also great, about 10 minutes walk from the bars at Port Olympic. The pool area is quite small, so if that is a priority for you it may not be ideal, but as we didn't have time for sunbathing that was no issue.

Reviews.Title: “An average experience”
Reviews.Author: SMGKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 for 3 nights. The hotel is well located for the port area, which hosts some good restaurants and bars. The staff were friendly and we had contacted them in advance to ask about a childs bed and car parking. We were advised that there was parking but weren't told that it would cost us 20Euros per day. I also wanted to take our 2 yr old son for a swim in the inside pool as it was raining outside, but was asked to pay 20 euros for the privilege which I thought was poor. The breakfast was superb and overall it is a decent hotel without the wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne on arrival & Champagne for breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: DubSunWorshiper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a bunch of girls for a hen party, what can I say other than Champagne on arrival and champagne for breakfast, what more could a girl want. The hotel staff were extremely helpful bar the Spa staff (very rude). The rooms were clean and air conditioned. Service was slow at the bar but there was only one waitress and eighteen ladies ordering cosmos. I thought the pool bar was a tad pricey for toasted sambos but like most of Barcelona it is expensive. We had a meal in the Ala Carte restaurant one night and it was really really nice, extremely tasty and the waiting staff were very helpful and prompt. Overall we had a fabulous stay and would definitely recommend it and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiemGr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at H10 Marina for 4 nights in January. It took me a while to find this hotel, but it is not that difficult afterall. All you have to do is check the horizon for two scyscrapers and walk towards them, at some point you will pass by it. All in all it was a very nice hotel, perhaps not 4 stars. The room was very nice, like the web images show, nice space and great city view. The staff is wonderful, speaking fluent English (rare in Barcelona), and provided us with area maps, circling the "hot spots" and metro stations. They checked us in earlier, and stored our luggages for a few hours on check out. Rooms were kept clean daily. Bed was comfy, no noise, absolutely great heating, WI-FI from the room. I believe I would book there again if I ever return to this beautiful, but really expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Hear Here”
Reviews.Author: David_mc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the H10 Marina Barcelona for 3 nights after a week in Tamariu on the Costa Brava. The location of the hotel is slightly deceptive, not quite as close to the marina as expected but still reachable with a 10 minute walk. There is also a Metro station 1 block away. First impressions of the hotel building itself were reasonable - modern and clean but slightly soulless. Unfortunately the reception staff at check in were fast to the point of abruptness - no Spanish warmth or flair. Rooms themselves are a decent size and clean but have very solid beds. Bathroom was well appointed but badly designed - was impossible to avoid pools of water on the floor while showering due to an inadequate screen, and the (suspended) ceiling tiles all "lifted" when the bathroom door was opened. Buffet breakfast was more than ample and service was friendlier here, as it was in the lobby bar. Worst thing about the hotel (and it was very annoying) is the very poor soundproofing - it was possible to hear virtually everything in the adjoining rooms - including every toilet flush!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: carolienTurnhout
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in September, 2 years ago. I stayed there with my boyfriend, it was our first time in Barcelona and in such a terrific hotel! the staff was very professional and treated as like guests should be treated. We only had breakfast in the hotel, but that was wonderful! It was a very large buffet with everything you could think of. Name it and you could get it there. It was also very clean and you never had to starve. Our room was very clean and big, we were very suprised. but the rooms weren't cleaned every day, that was something I missed. A plus and at the same time a negative aspect was the pool on top of the roof. you had a great view, but it was a little pool and the you could only swim there until 18.00. That was a pity, because after walking through the city all day, you were in need of a swim, but at that time, the pool was already closed. But this won't prevent me from going again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with cava”
Reviews.Author: thomasabcd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2008 with my girl-friend. The hotel is situated near the olympic port, which is nice for a walk on the beach. The area itself isn't anything special and doesn't have the same atmosphere as other areas of Barcelona. A good thing about the area is, that it is very quiet, which is nice after a long day of walking round Barcelona. The rooms are clean and nice. The hotel has one of the largest breakfast buffet I have ever seen. Lots of Spanish ham, sausage and cheese as well as fruit, pancakes, cakes, bread etc. and even a nice Cava.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mulholland_Drive
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during Ester 5 nights. Junior suite on 10 floor with beautiful view (sea view from north to south). Rooms pretty small but nice and clean. Restaurant very good with nice choice of wines and good food. Pretty nice breakfast buffet. Well situated close to beach and park, almost everything in walking distance range. Nice view from outside pool on 8th floor (was to cold to try some swimming...) Inside pool in spa (14 EUR per day; children below 16 years not allowed there - don't understand that but ... ).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in No-Mans Land.”
Reviews.Author: Twofootplus
Reviews.Content: Very much a business hotel, rather than a romantic getaway! Quite a few groups, as well as individual travellers. The restaurant where we had dinner on the first evening was better than most hotel restaurants and not too expensive. By Spanish standards it shuts early (10.30pm)! Both the room and the reception areas screamed 'bland standard upmarket business hotel'; but there WAS wi-fi and this was free even in the room (if slightly erratic). Large comfortable bed, armchairs and table, TV, mini-bar, safe: the usual. Bathroom (shower, loo, bidet) was fine and the washbasin area separate, which was good for couples, but the trendy glass washbasin surround let surplus water drip onto the floor. Staff service a little erratic; I had to ask for a free shower cap and even toilet paper. One towelling bathrobe and one pair slippers: maybe they thought we could share? Staff not over-keen on dispensing tourist advice, but then the Tourist Information Office is only 3 metro stops away. The view from our room on the 6th floor was the textile factory mentioned by another TA traveller and a pile of rubbish dumped next to it. The area - residential - was not attractive but seemed boring rather than dangerous. It was 3-5 mins walk to Bogatell metro station, a little further to Marina. I'd give the Marina Barcelona a gold star however for its breakfast buffet which takes up 3 sides of the room: cooked breakfasts; home-made jams and cakes; croissants, Danish pastries and churros; rolls and bread; yogurts, cheeses and cold meats; cereals; fresh and cooked fruit; juices; lots of other things I can't remember.... and staff brought us jugs of coffee (which however we always sent back to be replaced by the hot version).

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with no sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: sandrine_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and I have to reach the conclusion that our next stay in Barcelona wont be in that hotel. The room looked nice but with no sound proofing. You can hear every conversation and know when next door occupants were using the bathroom. One good thing : the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “It is not worth the money you pay”
Reviews.Author: aott02
Reviews.Content: The problem with using hotwire to book a hotel is that you never know what you are getting. When I arrived at H10 Barcelona Marina Hotel I realized that the stars are not a good indicator of how good this hotel will be. This hotel has four stars, so I expected a really nice hotel with lots of amenities in a really nice place (I think the nicer the area the more you pay for it, and this was certainly not cheap by any means). Well, the area is disgusting. Hotwire said that it was in Ramblas, it is not, it is nowhere near Ramblas. There is also no description of the area in the hotel's website or on hotwire. The view from my window is a dumpster, literaly. It is a yard full of trash where there are homeless people living in plastic homes attached to the hotel (no kidding, it is a plastic cover that is held on to the side of the hotel). There are kids that live there (they look like homeless immigrants). These kids somehow can afford spray cans and so they spend most of the day painting graffitti on the walls all around the hotel. As you exit the hotel there is a big sign that was painted on by the lovely homeless neighbors and it says "[--]". If you have a translator you'll understand. When I complained to the manager about the graffitti and the terrible view she said that they could do nothing about the surroundings of the hotel. I find it hard to believe that as much as they charged for my two rooms the hotel cannot afford a brush and some paint and do something about the trash all around it. The room is nothing special by any means, the hotel seems remodeled but it is still old so our sink did not work and the furniture and lamps are overused and ugly. The beds are tiny twin beds and very hard. The breakfast is 17 euros per person, which turns out to be more than the room is worth. The indoors pool is 14 euros per person and for a one time use. Overall, you have to pay for anything they offer, except their crappy internet that only works every so often. In conclusion, were we come from (Florida), I would not stay in a hotel in an area like this, or even walk in an area like this one. When I explained this to the manager she said that the whole of Barcelona looks like this, and she was not kidding. Everywhere we went it smelled like sewers, piss, and dog crap. The houses look dirty and delapitated and it seems like the whole town ran out of paint because everything looks old and dirty. Everything is expensive and the only pretty parts are under constructions (including the cathedrals) so the pictures you take are of cranes in front of the buildings. From my experience at this hotel, I plan on booking my hotel rooms from other websites like orbitz where they show you what you'll get before you pay for it, and best of all, they do allow you to cancel and even refund you (unlike Orbitz). Definitely read all reviews you can find before getting there, and please post reviews about all hotels you stay in so that others know what they are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Money grabbing”
Reviews.Author: annakatrine
Reviews.Content: They charge your credit card on checkin, rather than checkout. They will not allow anyone under 16 years into any area within the spa (including the small pool) even if accompanied by parents. They charge an extra €14 per person EACH TIME you use the spa pool. The roof pool is only 1 metre deep and unheated. The garage is difficult to get into with a 4x4 and the spaces tiny and they charge extra. They also charge extra for breakfast. I will not be using this place again - I live in Spain and have never come across a minimum age to use the spa and pool facilties and the staff were even more unhelpful than the usual Spanish lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_adonis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in late January. Got a good deal through hotwire. As someone eluded to its not in Las Ramblas area but is close to Bogatell metro station. Is closer to the marina area and beach. Room was solid 4 star. Good size. TV had heaps of channels, mainly Spanish and German but also French, Italian, English and i think arab. Bathroom had a bidet, lots of hot water and lots of water pressure. The other negative is that if you are expecting the concierge to be useful then think again. We wanted to see flamenco show that was sold out and asked if he could help us secure tickets but he had no idea. The restaurant and pool area of the hotel looked good although we didnt use them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kshalla
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the H10 Marina since we were not able to book the center of town and it was really great. We had to take the subway 3 stops to the center of town put we were right next to the Puerto Olimpico. The room was nothing special but the rest of the hotel was really nice and the staff was very helpful. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, horrific staff”
Reviews.Author: rll31
Reviews.Content: Location - We booked this trip on Hotwire, and it was listed as a hotel in the Las Ramblas neighborhood. In reality it's, about a 10 minute subway ride, or 20 minute walk. The real location is in Port Olimpico. The location as actually a blessing in disguise, since we were a reasonable distance from all the sights (10-20 minute commute), but got to come home to a quiet neighborhood. Facilities - Recently redone, w/ marble finishes. Small by US standards, but nice. The Staff - They were a rude, incompetent bunch. Maybe it's because I am used to a more hospitable, accommodating level of service, but these guys time and time again were rude, and unable to deliver. From check-in to arranging for a taxi, the staff claimed they were on it, but in reality nothing was accomplished. When we questioned the status of our request(s), the staff claimed they were "working on it", or that the ball had been dropped by one of their colleagues. In the end, these staff interactions are enough to say, DON'T STAY HERE if you're looking for any sort of service.

Reviews.Title: “Walls made of paperboard”
Reviews.Author: osimon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five nights around New Year's Eve 2007/2008. Pros: - We booked it for a rather attractive price during the holiday season (~ EUR 130 per night, incl. breakfast) - Clean - Well sized rooms and beds for the price - Good location (I cannot understand why other reviewers are complaining about 'safety' ... I think it's a very nice area, close to the city center as well as the yacht port & beach) - Amazing breakfast, well organized even when the hotel is fully booked Cons: - We first got a room with two small beds instead of one big bed. After the first night we were given another room with a nice king size bed. - We were sometimes wondering if someone else was in our bathroom, but it was just our neighbor going to his own loo. I cannot imagine how a newly built house can have so thin walls. - Our room was located at the end of a corridor, close to a service room. So starting at 7 am we could hear the maids running in and out of this room all the time. I am glad I had my earplugs with me. - The heating (Barcelona is not in the Caribbean!) stops as soon as you take out your key card to leave the room. So when you come back, the room will be freezing cold. And if you leave a second card in the slot, the maid will remove it. - When we wanted to spend a nice afternoon in the spa (EUR 14 per person and day) we were warned at the spa entrance that both sauna and whirlpool were not well heated. So of course we abstained. We will probably not book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and value for the price”
Reviews.Author: SnEEkEy
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona on business and this was one of the hotels provided. For the price, the room is pretty basic but still nicer than your standard motel 6. Here's the rundown: Pros: - low rates - Clean and functional rooms - Good service from english speaking staff - 2 blocks from metro stations - Relatively close to the beach Cons: - Location so-so - mainly residential, industrial but still felt safe. Good thing is it's away from the crowds - Expensive breakfast - So-so room service food - small room but this is common in European cities This hotel is generally good if you're going for business though you may want to consider it for a vacation due to the low rates. There's a supermarket on Carrer de la Marina where you can get your supplies. To avoid the pricey breakfast, you can go to the cafe Vint i Dos on Carrer de Joan Miro where you can get an excellent capuccino and croissant for only 1.70 Euro. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “H10 Marina Barcelona Hotel is a great value!”
Reviews.Author: co_rich_car
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in this hotel for four days prior to a twelve day cruise leaving from Barcelona. It was part of a package deal booked through Air France and we were very pleased. For a moderate price hotel, this was an excellent value. Even though it's location is not in the heart of the city, it is an easy walk to bus and Metro stops or the staff can order a taxi for you. Our room was spacious, comfortable and quiet. The mattress was a little firmer than you customarily find in the States, but it was not an issue. The service was excellent throughtout the entire stay beginning with a glass of champagne when we arrived to obtaining taxi service to the pier at departure time. The staff at the front desk all speak enough English to communicate easily. They were very helpful in assisting with our sightseeing efforts. Prior to leaving on our trip, I had read reviews about this hotel and the amazing breakfast that is part of the stay. I could not fully appreciate it until I had the experience the first day. What an incredible display of the most delicious food! I have never seen anything to compare in this country. The variety is unbelievable such as champagne, Spanish ham, multiple types of eggs, nuts, local cheeses, breads, yogurt, pastries, juices, and fresh and dried fruits with exotic varieties. You can make healthy choices, including specific foods for diabetics, or be totally decadent and at the same time experience the culture.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: GAUDIYork
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 night stay and ready to book again. Can't fault the hotel - spotless, modern with attentive and professional staff. First class breakfast with fresh fruit, loads of pastries, meats and hot food - accompanied by as much tea/coffee as you can drink. Resturant food great too - we had tapas in the informal one - and had the best we had all stay (highly recommend the fish kebab and deep fried veg). Last but not least is probably the best bit of all a fabulous roof top terrace and pool. Reasonable bar prices - we managed to have several beers, a meal for next to nothing Not in a central location but only a few minutes walk to the Bogattele metro - which is a great line to start from. Only a short walk to port olympic - where you can walk down the beach promanade, have a meal, have a beer and go to the casino (money permitting). All in the all a fab place to stay

Reviews.Title: “H 10 Marina”
Reviews.Author: WFRANK33
Reviews.Content: a 3 .5 star hotel. Rooms are small.clean snd basic....except for excellent bathrooms. Also,a good (free) computer access. The location is just OK,NOT AN AREA TO JUST WALK AROUND. Beds are very firm,pillows cheap foam. An inexpensive business hotel that is a mixture of no frills and nice...???

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scot222
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel. Our room was large bright and airy. Could see Sagiada Familia from the window. Nice touch to give you a glass of Cava on arrival. Cava was also free in the buffet breakfast which has to be the biggest in the world! Prices in bar not bad for a city 4 star hotel. Very convenient for Port Olympic, 10 mins walk, with loads of eating places and Barceloneta Beach. City Bus Tour stop is 5 minutes walk. Great hotel thoroughly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a citybreak”
Reviews.Author: emma19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 4 nights in this hotel. I had emailed the hotel in front to ask for a room on one of the higest floors and they did their best to take this request into account. We had a room on the 9th floor and could enjoy from a lovely view on Barcelona. The Hotel is located in a quiet area and the tube is nearby. On arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by staff at reception with a glass of champagne. Check in was nice & quick. Breakfast was included in our room price and what a breakfast. So much choice, including cava We used the Wellness centre once- really relaxing! Would definately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: Alby69
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in this hotel because I was in Barcelona for businesstrip. The Hotel is located in a quiet area (few people around during all day) but it is just a quick ride by taxi to the downtown or attractions. The tube station is also near. The room was excellent in terms of standards, amenities and very clean. The buffet breakfast is amazing. Everything was very good. During the night it is not noisy because the main roads are not close to the hotel (it is located inside a big square). Reccomanded if you want to escape confusion.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient if a little soulless”
Reviews.Author: weejim
Reviews.Content: Good localtion for Port Olympic, just 10 minutes walk from the cafés, bars and beach. Hotel was nice - very clean, modern room, some satellite TV in English, CNN, SKY, BBC. Breakfast buffet was good. Bar a little underdeveloped but nice for a pre-dinner drink or a nightcap. Staff excellent - with very good enlish skills. Room was spacious with lots of bathroom freebies - if your that kind of person. Bed was hard - I like that but maybe some might find it too hard. Air conditioning was noisy too - but that's usual in hotels! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant find in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Epernay
Reviews.Content: Left things a bit late to book but stumbled across this hotel. Hotel is fresh and modern, check in was easy, staff very pleasant and rooms very clean and in good order. Price included an excellent buffet breakfast, drinks very reasonable (Inc mini bar), evening restaurant a bit pricey but good food. Hotel has a nice spa open to adults only and a roof top pool and bar area but you need a head for heights and the glass barrier could do with being a little higher. Good location, a few minutes walk to Olympic Quay and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Kitten
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at H10 Marina for 8 days in August - we had managed to get a fantastic deal on the hotel so for us the hotel was fantastic. We found the staff to be extremely helpful, (even with their first aid kit when I hurt my foot!) and friendly. The room itself was lovely, kept extremely clean and air conditioned. The only thing which was missing was the movies, which seemed to be out of action the week we were there - our only reason for wanting to watch one, was that both my boyfriend and myself hurt our feet!! The room was large and comfortable, quiet as requested and extremely clean. The beds are slightly hard, but you get used to it! The rooftop swimming pool and bar is small, considering the size of the hotel. If you want to spend the day sunbathing, your better off heading to one of the beaches which are only a 5-10 minute walk away from the hotel. We loved the hotel, as it was quiet, clean, the staff were friendly and we got a really good deal on the room. We wanted a mix of a relaxing holiday near the beach and the ability to explore the city - the hotel was perfect for this! Takes about 35-40 minutes to walk to Las Rambla from hotel. Didn't eat in the hotel, but heard the food was amazing. We would definately recommend the hotel for those who want a break, if you want to be in the heart of the action, this may not be the hotel for you though.

Reviews.Title: “think twice before booking.........”
Reviews.Author: loser26
Reviews.Content: I researched this hotel thoroughly and so was disappointed by my experience For starters I had booked a standard double hotel room for 6 nights at a cost of 700 euros only to be given a poky room with a small window and not much else also the bed was very hard. I asked at reception was there any chance of a balcony and they said no - only if u get a suite..... After conferring with my partner we decided to pay the 300 extra for the suite as this was our only hol this year and we wanted to enjoy it. The suite was also substandard considering the cost with no special extras not even bathrobes but at least the room was large and there was a balcony. the roof pool is tiny and u need to be up there at at least 10am to get a place so therefore no lie in.... Also had several encounters with staff where I found them to be rude and generally cranky The best thing about this hotel was the breakfast which was amazing the best ive had yet however the other factors far outweighed the benefits of the breakfast. Would not recommend this hotel have stayed in far better for less money

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: HollandKevinsky
Reviews.Content: Just came back 18/7 from Barca and stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. We booked this hotel based on the reviews from previous readers, so below are our experiences. Pros: - area is very quite especially in the evening (for people who like to sleep) - nice breakfast (but no much variety within 5 days), still compliments to the restaurant staff; - the roomcleaners did their best, every day we got a tidy room. - very close to the harbour (ca. 10 min. walk, you should walk through the shopping mall at Av. Icaria) where you can go out for diner; Cons; - hard bed (but this is subjective) - no internet access for checking mail and online check-in - not so close to all the metro stations(at our last day we found out that the Marina Metro was closer than the Metro Citudella Vila Olympica); At station Marina you can also take the tram to the shopping mall av. Diagonall (Forum) - at the time we were staying, they were renovating the ground floor (in the middle of the tourist season!?) - the reception staff were fine, but we had one incident where we made an payment agreement with a female reception staff, but on that day she was not working, so we asked to the 2 male reception staff. And we ended in a discussion with 2 male reception workers (one was bold and the other had too much sun.) regarding some agreements we make at the beginning of our stay. I definitely advise you, when you make agreements (especially where money is involved), you should speak to the one who helped you and not someone different. Ofcouse at the end we get our money back. But its a bad aftertaste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjbrazil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a week and the beginning of June. The hotel is in a great location being only 5mins walk to the beach and only 2 metro stops away from the Plaza Catalunya. We were lucky enough to get a room with a balcony along from the rooftop swimmimg pool which we used everyday, usually after sightseeing. The hotel is in a residential area with a few local bars and restuarants nearby and a short stroll to the marina you find a a great number of bars and restaurants and a casino! The hotel is modern and very clean, rooms a good size and the breakfast was superb. Would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: RobKing
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of June, and was pleasantly surprised to receive a glass of cava on arrival The hotel is modern, the rooms are well equipped and comfortable, and the staff were very friendly. The choice at breakfast was enormous. The only downside is that there was no balcony, but then this is more of a business hotel than a tourist hotel. In terms of location - the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Olympic Port, and about 20-25 minutes from Las Ramblas. It is not the prettiest walk to the center, although we did not feel particularly threatened at any point. The area around the hotel is residential, and I would not in any way compare it to "the scariest council estate in London" as other contributors have. However, the location is the only drawback with this hotel, and the reason it did not receive top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: Welshlady147
Reviews.Content: The hot el is quite close to the Estacion Franca and so quite convenient to come from the airport on the C10 train. We took a taxi which cost us about 7 Euros from the station to the hotel. The hotel entrance is very welcoming, clean and bright, as is the whole hotel. Our room was one of the black glass fronted rooms on the corner of the hotel and was huge! The door opened into a light wooden floored entrance with the bathroom to the right. At first i thought the room was tiny but when I turned the corner to where I thought the bed would be then there was a sitting area, Tv and then another corner where the bed was - a sort of horseshoue shape around the bathroom. The bed was very comfy, large, queen size bed. All very modern and might and bright. The only drawback was the heat from the large glass windows. We had to leave the curtains shut during the day to keep the sun out but there are really thick blackout curtain linings which made the room very dark and quiet. The Ac would only work when the room key was in the socket so the ac was off while we were out. Swimming pool was freezing! We stayed during May (17th-19th) and it was not heated so couldn't even go in even though it was about 28 degrees outside. Nice deck although veyr small. Hotel location -OK, about 10 minutes walk to the marina and beach - very nice. Surrounded by mainly flats and residential areas. Convenient bar/restaurant just across road from hotel on Carrera Marina - good beer and selection of food on menu, including curries! Hotel food - not wonderful. Disappointed with the breakfast after ther eviews on here. Not much hot food -loads of fruit and not much else. Helpful, firendly staff. Rooms very clean and well equipped. Dressing gowns, slippers, toiletries in little case - all nice touches. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Our Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: MrsFizz
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel last year - I would say primarily a business hotel but were pleasantly surprised, particularly as we were upgraded to a room with a balcony (there are very few). The hotel is still fairly new but this year we felt that the standards had started to slip slightly. We still had a great break and we again had a room with a balcony which was ideal as the weather was fab. The hotel restaurant is not great in the evening, my husband was served fish verging on raw. The breakfasts are good. Bar and reception service was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: westlife07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as it was close to a concert that we were attending. Was originally looking to stay in the city centre but was put off by the threat of pickpockets, etc, so we decided to look elsewhere to stay. Found this hotel based on visitor comments on this and other websites. On arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by staff at reception with a glass of champagne, never been greeted that way before, a lovely experience. Check in was nice & quick. Room was great, clean as was the rest of the hotel, nice view, air con could have been a little better, thankfully the windows opened. Breakfast was included in our room price and what a breakfast. So much choice, including champagne & fresh strawberries. (Have to say probably one of the best breakfasts we have ever had at a hotel). The hotel is a little out of the city centre, but a 10 min stroll brings you to Marina metro station and 3 stops into the centre. Some reviews have mentioned the run down look of the area which is true. I note one review from 2003 mentioned the area being this way and that it would perhaps be better in years to come! Fraid not! It's a case of manyana! It's a bit of a building site but that's the spanish way! Having been put off by the threat of pickpockets, have to say we did feel quite safe in the centre, obviously take care with your belongings. Would recommend a taxi to the hotel from the airport, cost the two of us €27, which when compared to our return journey on the train/metro was well worth it. Unfortunately we went home on the day of the Barcelona marathon and all major routes were closed, so the train was recommended! Not a good idea, we were sent to one station to be told we were going the wrong way, turned around to be told we needed to be on a lower platform. That journey was frustrating! Especially with a large suitcase in hot weather. Would definately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosieU
Reviews.Content: Just back from Barcelona and stayed at the H10 Marina. We were a bit worried after reading some of the reviews, but had absolutely nothing to worry about. Excellent hotel. Short distance to metro which takes you anywhere you want to go. 10 min walk to Port Olympic and beach area and approx 30/40min walk to Las Ramblas. Would definately stay at this hotel again (can't wait to go back). Excellent breakfast. Only one complaint - we booked a double room and were given a twin room. When we queried this, they advised they do not have double rooms?? and that if anyone wanted a double room the maid would put the two single beds together! Apart from this slight inconvenience, we had a brilliant 3 days here, and would definately stay here again, as it is lovely and quiet - no street noise.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: empee3
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4-star hotel, close to metro station and the olympic park. Super clean premises and room. Staff is very friendly. Rooms are spacious. But the highlight is the open buffet breakfast; zillion of choices and something for every taste and cultur. We stayed there for 100 Euro per room, this is 50 Euro per person. Drawbacks: facilities like the gym cost extra. Not in walking distance to downtown and major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma_Tommy
Reviews.Content: Good Points: Hotel was lovely. Very polite staff, checked in straight away even tho we were early. Room we had i think was for the disabled as we had a bigger room and bathroom with walk in shower. Wicked breakfast they had everything!!! Watch what you eat tho dont want to be putting on weight. The hotel is very up to date with modern things like the design, roof top pool and the water feature by the restaurant looked great. The walk to the beach was easy just one road thankgod! beach was beautiful. Bad Points:Are bathroom sink was cracked, when you had ashower the water went every where, they didnt have cereal for kids. But i would definatley stay again whether its a long or short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A 'warm' welcone for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: I_like_good_holidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Marina during the October school holidays a short city break. Prior to departure I decided to check a few review, and a came across a review that implied the hotel was not family friendly, but I found the opposite to be true. I travelled with my two children on my own and was anxious about our visit, having read the review. From the moment of our arrival until our departure to the airport we received the very best service from all the staff; the staff were very child friendly and made us feel at ease. We stayed for four days and we made requests for warm milk and hot coco, both requests were swiftly met and in the evenings the staff were apologetic at having to apply the room service charge for such an inexpensive item. At the reception desk and in the internet/office support facilities I found the staff always helpful, knowledgeable and attentive. The Hotel is located close to the Marina, zoo, beach, shops and places of interest. We found most were within a 'child's' walking distance, which was great. The location is slightly quiet; so if you need to be in the throng of Barcelona then perhaps this is not the hotel for you. With it's spa in the basement the hotel gives you the best of a city break and a weekend retreat combined. It is my intention to return in April, hence the posting of this review. Our family had a good experience and I am looking forward to our visit minus the children. It is as important to share both good and bad experiences. Ultimately you will make up your own mind, I did.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gordiegor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in agust of 2006 for a week on our honeymoon. On arrival we were presented with a glass of sparkly cava very nice and our room was upgraded free of charge to a suite seeing as we were honeymooners, excellent touch! the breakfasts are brilliant and cater for all tastes. didn't eat in the hotel in the evening instead ventured down to the seafront and there is an excellent italian restaurant and chinese down there all reasonably priced infact dirt cheap! the hotel bar prices are excellent and as for the staff coule not have rated them highly enough they were really friendly and couldnot do enough for you. the outdoor pool was great and ideal if you are on a short break and we used the indoor facilites at the spa once but agree it is a little pricey they could offer better deals for long term stay etc. this is the only fault we could fine, the rooms are spotlessly clean and all in all it is a brilliant hotel. Location excellent nice and quiet at night but not too far from the city centre, we took the metro about a 5mins walk to the station. We are going back to the hotel in 2 weeks 6th march for my husbands 40th for a couple of days and looking forward to it. All in all can't rate this hotel highly enough. if you are looking for a friendly place to stay that's cheap and spotlessly clean hers's your place! some would say it's not that cheap but come on for what you're getting it is a steal. the h10 barcelona is the place to stay, we love it so much we have joined there h10 hotel club and intend to go back at least twice every year if not more and later in the year we are taking our kids too. book it you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel but not in the best location”
Reviews.Author: JaneHT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and very nicely designed and decorated. The overall feeling was more of a business hotel rather than a tourist hotel though. Very generous buffet breakfast with absolutely loads of good choices, busy and large breakfast area. Hotel location was quite far out from the tourist centre, in a commercial area which did feel safe though (15 minutes by undrground from hotel to La Rambla area). 10 minutes walk to the beach marina area which was fine but I wasn't overly impressed with the restaurants in that area. The hotel tapas and wine bar was fantastic, great selection and impeccable service in lovely surroundings...must try it! The Hotel room was good after some initial confusion, we booked a double bed and had this in writing. On arrival the hotel claimed they would never accept a booking for a double bed and could only offer us singles. They were unwilling to budge - I had to contact our travel agent who eventually had to pay for an upgrade for us. Bathroom v. good with loads of little goodies. Cava on arrival was a nice touch but slightly spoiled by the booking problem we had with the hotel. Overall very good, quite impersonal though, great tapas bar, very clean and pleasnt interiors although not the best location.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCarrington
Reviews.Content: Where to start. Check-in fast and efficient, offered an upgrade at a reduced rate (which we refused) but still ended up with a king size bed that was comfortable and spacious. Rooms spotlessly clean, towels changed when wanted, and room full of all the amenities you require. Location was good, 10 min to beach/promenade and 2 min to nearest metro. If you didn't mind the walk 20-25 min into the centre. Food in hotel was excelllent, breakfast was superb, and evening meals were good and provided excellent value for money. Staff were friendly and really helpfull in getting around to see the sights. Would recommend this hotel to anybody. Brilliant, it helped make the 3 night stay in barcelona memorable.

Reviews.Title: “H 10 Barcelona Excellent”
Reviews.Author: IanMurray
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel approx 10 min walk from Marina Metro Station 20 Min walk from Bari Gotic in a kind of business area of the city. The Metro is within Zone 1 of The Barcelona travel system and a 10 Journey ticket is 6.50 euros you can then use the Bus Tram or Metro to reach your destination. Spread over 10 floors the rooms were spotlessly clean, as were all the public areas, staff were friendly and all spoke English. Glass of Cava on arrival and reasonably priced mini bar in the room set the tone for this relaxed hotel. The hotel has a Tapas Bar as well as a restaurant and public bar all reasonably priced although the A La Cart restaurant was a bit pricy compared to restaurants at the Bari Gotic. We stayed bed and American buffet breakfast. The food choice in the morning was excellent with something for all tastes. Only dissapointment was a charge of 15 euros each to use the health Spa on a daily basis which could mount up if you were to use it every day. That said we only used it once during our trip Would recomend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Barcelona for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Traveller”
Reviews.Author: moneymoneymoney
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very pleaseant and helpful staff. You could not want for anything more at breakfast from stawberries and champagne to diet foods. The rooms were of a good size and clean offering all the little extras you could think of. Location was ideal for the tour bus pick up, within 10 minutes walk and the metro station only 5 mintes away with only few stops to the centre. Would certainly book again if going to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Poor Bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: ParyShah
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Barcelona for Microsoft's TechEd for Developer. Ideally located (promiximity to train stattion - Bagota - Just 3 mins walking distance). Pros : Neat Hotel and Proimity to Train Station Cons : No Restuarants or Bus Station in the vicinity. Bathrooms are clean but the shower area is not well designed due to which water tends to spill in the entire bathroom and due to nature of the flooring it tends to get slippery. Free wired and wireless internet access. Unfortunately the quality was poor and the Wired Internet Access was not functional. Although the weather was slightly warm, the air conditions were switched OFF. To feel comfortable, we had to keep windows open. Bed was neat and clean but the quality could have been a lot more better for a 4 star hotel (Bed would move because of wheels) and there was no cosy comforter.

Reviews.Title: “A Dissapointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: lljk
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here, my husband and I booked this hotel for a week. Our first impressions of the hotel were that it was lovely, but in a rather remote area of town. We were fine with that, and were excited to be near the harbor and beach. Our impressions of the hotel were immediately lowered when we spoke with the reception staff. Very rude, no "hello" or welcoming glass of cava, just ¨do you have a reservation?. They certainly were not child-friendly. They honestly looked horrified that my two year old son was with us.
