They scowled at him every time we walked through the lobby. ¨ The first night we were there we asked if there was a quick restaurant in the area that served simple, child-friendly food. Our son was tired and hungry and we just wanted to crash. Reception suggested that we eat in the hotel restaurant, but we wanted something a bit faster and less fancy. Reception was able to name two 4 star restaurants within a 15 minute walk, but the only simple restaurant that they could name was a 20 minute cab ride. We chose a direction, and began to walk, and within 5 miutes were able to find a perfecty fine place that served pizza. My son was happy. The room was fine, nothing special, although after a week in Paris it seemed especially spacious. There were some small things wrong, like loose bathroom fixtures and a slightly leaking sink, but we never called maintenance. The rooftop pool was nice (no kids, which I understand) and would have been nice to use at night, swimming in view of the Barcelona lights, but it closes at 6. Overall, this hotel seems uneven. Sitting in the lobby, I saw other couples check in that recieved very warm welcomes from the manager and several glasses of complimentary cava. Maybe they were as cold as they were because of the child? They really should take a cue from many other 4 and 5 star hotels, who will at least pretend to be welcoming to children. Overall, definately not worth the $180 a night we paid. There are seveal otther hotels in Barcelona, that are similar in quality that run no more than 100 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Maggie&Gp
Reviews.Content: Stayed end of July 2006.I booked this hotel directly and paid extra for a superior room with a sea/marina view...Please note you cannot have a sea/marina view from most of the rooms. Reception staff were not helpfull at all. Yet must say our room was very clean and super modern perhaps a little too modern as I felt the hotel lacked character. Bathroom facilities were excellent. We ordered a taxi from reception when we were leaving and even though there was a few taxi's at the rank outside we were lead to a hotel limo and had to pay over the odd's ----very cheeky I think!!! beware.All in all choose another hotel not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “The H10 Marina Hotel was Good....”
Reviews.Author: smagical
Reviews.Content: My arrival experience was Good. The location of the hotel was Okay, I was a bit dodgy, when I saw all of the graffiti, but apparently it's all over Barcelona. The H 10 Marina Hotel, is a very modern hotel, it was built 3 yrs ago. The hotel was very nice and the staff was very knowledgeable. The hotel amenities were also very nice(IE. the pool, bar & restaurant). The Hotel wasn't prepared to encounter a storm. It rained for a few days and 1 particular night, the hotel flooded, which caused mayhem, because the hotel staff wasn't prepared for a storm and couldn't follow any protocol! Which was quite unpleasant! Keep in mind, that Hotel restaurant closes @ 11pm and all the other restaurants in Barcelona closes @ 12pm. So, if you want a late snack better get it early and take it back to your room for later. Nevertheless, I did enjoy my stay @ H 10 Marina Hotel and La Ramblas is very cool for shopping and site seeing (Tourists) beware, there is a lot of people looking to steel your bags..... The only thing that I did find to be a bit of an annoyance, was if you complained about something which could have been minor, the hotel response was, THIS ISN"T A 5 STAR HOTEL. I thought it was neglectful and unethical of the Hotel Staff, because it has all of the qualities to be a 5 STAR Hotel, If they didn't say things that were stupid and solve the problems. Which could have been solved!!

Reviews.Title: “hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: GkCLondon
Reviews.Content: well - our stay at this hotel started well - we arrived to be greeted with a glass of cava and the room was spacious and airy. the 'double' room consisted of two double beds being pushed together which meant you had a bump in the middle of the beds where they joined. i was disappointed with the shower - i have long hair and it ended up taking a very long time to wash! other than that the room was pleasent! unfortunetly - on the first night there i managed to get food poisoning after eating at the overpriced hotel restaurant - my impression of the hotel after that didnt really recover! the hotel is in a great location - plenty of restaurants and bars only a short walk away (even though i never managed to recover fully to sample the food) and i would DEFINATELY reccomend the bus tour as a way to get around! all in all i left this hotel with no feelings for it at all - i stayed in a little hotel in Italy not so long ago which made more of an impression in the one night i stayed there than the four nights i stayed here - although i think my opinion of this hotel would not have been so bad had i not got ill!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was original slightly wary about staying here as it appears on the map to be a bit off the beaten track. In reality the location was actually ok and is a sensible compromise if you are looking to combine the cities culture with some relaxing on the beach. It was about 10 minutes walk to the Olympic Port and the beach. The walk was pleasant and there is plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from once you get there. At the Olympic Port you will also find a bus stop for the open top tour buses where you can hop on and off. The infamous Las Ramblas was quite a bit further but certainly walkable. We walked it a few times and our best time was about 30 minutes but if you take the scenic route round the ports etc you will be nearer an hour. We made the most of our tour bus tickets and just used and abused its service to get back and forth to Las Ramblas though. There is also a metro station a few minutes walk from the hotel but we never used it. The hotel was pleasant, very clean, and friendly. The room was spotless, comfortable, air conditioned, and had all the creature comforts you would expect in a 4 star hotel. The breakfast was undoubtedly the best buffet breakfast I ever had the pleasure of indulging in. There was fantastic choice and very efficient service. I really am being ridiculously fussy here but if I had to find a fault with the hotel I would say they needed more computers in the business centre. Every time I went to use the Internet they were always in use. Also the area where the outdoor pool is located is very nice but it’s a tad small so don’t expect to be able to bag a seat by default. All in all we were very happy customers and considered our stay a bargain. We paid about £35 per person per night including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Hot Hot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice hotel. Clean rooms Good food. Cons: Air conditioning wasn't working on our visit and room was very hot. For this reason I wouldn't go again. Location a metro ride from the maintown.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vistacola
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this hotel. The staff are very friendly and the hotel is very clean. Breakfast is excellent with a great selection. It is a short walk to the metro, about 3 stops to the centre (La Ramla). It is also about a 10 minute walk to the marina where you can get a tour bus. There are many restaurants at the marina. The area around the hotel is very quiet which is why we chose it. We didn't want the noise of the city centre. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Get it booked!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend in Barcelona with 12 girlfriends who all had a fantastic time at the H10 Marina. We found the staff (especially the reception and bar staff) extremely friendly. Our weekend got off to a bad start when one girl had her purse pinched on the metro (be very careful) but the reception staff were very helpful and told us exactly what we needed to do and where the police station was. They also gave her some vouchers for a couple of free drinks! I read some negative reviews on here before our visit regarding the rooms - all our rooms were clean, spacious (they accommodated an extra bed in double rooms to make things cheaper), the air conditioning worked and the windows opened. The roof top pool, ok is on the small side but the beach is only 5 minutes walk away if you need more water! I really could not fault this hotel - the lobby and bar area is spacious and the breakfast had a wide range to suit all tastes. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel. If I was to give one tip then take a taxi from the airport - we got the train and then the metro but had to make few changes along the way. Our minibus which the hotel booked for us returning to the airport only cost 55 euro's between 6 of us.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: absolutely loved this hotel,very friendly and helpful staff.bedroom and bathroom were a good size and absolutely spotless.the breakfast (included with hotel connect)was fantastic, have never seen such a selection of food and drinks for breakfast,even a glass of cava if you wanted it.the hotel spa was lovely and very good value at 13 euros for the day. it meant that we could have a couple of hours in the spa really enjoying ourselves,go out sightseeing and shopping then come back to the hotel in the evening and use the spa again before it closed at 10pm.very relaxing and i would recommend the spa to anyone. it had a good size swimming pool, jacuzzi,steam room, sauna, plunge pool and dynamic pool with very comfortable padded loungers.did not use the restaurant but had a delicious meal from room service.it is only a five minute walk to the nearest beach, about 20 minutes walk to the port. taxis are very inexpensive,even at night.would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “checkout was horrendous”
Reviews.Author: sja1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my boyfriend although I was on business. The room was large with big windows and a huge (but very hard) bed. We wanted peace and quiet but even though the do not disturb sign was on the door we must have had 3 calls and three notes asking us if we wanted service to be honest if I had I'd have asked. We wernt allowed to use the hotel pool without paying around £10 should really be included in room price. Checkout was horrendous it must have taken 45 minutes she put my boyfriends name on the bill and charged me x6 of total late checkout fee instead of the fee for an hour x6. When I queried this it took another person and another 20 minutes to sort out and instaed of producing a new bill just printed me one with a huge minus to go with the wrong one. By this time we were losing the will to live and needed to catch a plane. She put my platinum card through and didnt understand in the uk we have to use pin numbers and I tried to explain for security this card wouldnt work without a pin but it wasnt going in at all. Used another card but was annoyed. the taxi service they had provided was very late coming not really his fault as the traffic was bad and luckily a new team had come on by this time and were alot more helpful. I wrote two e-mails and a letter to let the hotel know about it but didnt recieve a reply. All in all the hotel was fine but staff needed some training on the proceedures and customer service, if work hadnt paid I would be really mad!!

Reviews.Title: “No airconditioning or windows that open. Avoid in Spring and Autumn”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFromOz
Reviews.Content: We visited during March and stayed in a Junior Suite. As Barcelona gets sunny days the rooms become very warm from the sun streaming in during the day. Unfortunately the air conditioning for this hotel is not turned on until summer and you are unable to open the windows in the rooms so the rooms are awfully stuffy and hot. We had 2 restless nights sleep and avoided spending any time in the room. The staff at the front desk told us a different story each time we mentioned the temperature of the room. They promised to call a maintenance staff member to fix it and then told us it was hot because we had left the air conditioner off.Then were told it was hot as we had left it on and then because the temperature was set incorrectly. Finally they admitted the air conditioing for the hotel was not turned on at this time of year! Rooms are clean and nice. Great breakfast - definitely worth the extra 15 euro or so. Staff slightly untrustworthy with excuses rather than action to fix problems. As long as you don't visit in Spring and Autumn then this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice in both a junior suite and standard room. Both are very clean and furnished very nicely, quite modern. If you can, definately go for a junior suite the room is very large and the bathroom great. You get two sinks a toilet area, a wet room shower area and a jacuzzi bath, all in one long room with glass dividers between each section. Only complaint from the other half was the lack of a door to the toilet so I had to sit on the balcony while she did her business. The balcny on the junior suite was very large and was looking in the direction of the sea. You could see the olympic marina area and the distintive two tall buildings (one being The Arts Hotel). You could easily walk to the Marina area and along the beach front. This also takes you onto the Barcolenta (big marina area where all the yachts are moored) If feeling energetic you could walk to Las Ramblas, but taxis were also quite reasonable to get to and from both areas. Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell are definately a taxi ride as they are on the North of the city. Never ate in the restaurant at night but the breakfast was fantastic. All the usual english and continental options. There is a pool on the roof but the time of year we want we didn't brave the cold. If you like seafood the Olympic Marina area was the best we found. Check out the prices though as they can vary quite wildley. El Cangrejo Loco is a great place, fantastic service and food however be prepared for a £100+ bill for two if you're having a full meal and drinks. The bars around this area are worth just walking past, they are all small unit type things and there must be 10 or so packed closley together and they seem to have a passion for male and female bar dancers. Another favourite restaurant was as on the Passigo Gracia (probably spelt wrong), but it's the road with all the designer shops on. About 200m on the right (if coming from the main square end) there's a fantastic Tapas place. Looks like a grand deli from the front however there is a seating area at the back down some stairs. Considering its location the prices are very reasonable and the food great.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel, on a return trip to England from Javea Spain. We met with friendly staff, immediately offered an upgrade to a Junior Suite which was sheer luxury. Large spacious rooms very comfortable. Our only complaint was that the parking at the hotel was expensive at 18 euros a night. We would not hesitate at staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but too far out of town”
Reviews.Author: Cubbies
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a group of friends. The hotel its self is good, nice rooms, friendly staff, lovely place but it is too far out of town and the surrounding area is a little dodgy. You need to take taxi's everywhere which can become costly unless you are with a group as we were. The breakfast buffet was good but very pricey and the pool was extremely expensive at nearly £9 for a swim even for residents!!!! All in all it's an ok hotel for small groups but not for couples as you will add lots of money onto your bill by taking taxi's. Also you will wait ages for a taxi to come even when booked, we waited in general over 1/2 an hour and one night we waited well over an hour and it didn't turn up, making us late for dinner reservations we ended up walking and the area is not the best one to be wandering around in at night.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star at best and don't take your children”
Reviews.Author: SarahOmaha
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short break at H10 Marina, and although Barcelona was lovely, the hotel was a big disappointment. The breakfast was awful for 15 euros, all of the food was cold, and only a few "hot" item selections to choose from. The walls are very thin and I always heard the TV from the neighboring room. The decor in the rooms is nice but they are way too small. We booked two rooms for two adults and two children and called ahead to request adjoining rooms. Upon arrival we were given two rooms next to each other, and they said the only room available next to each other were twin-bedded rooms. The outdoor pool is super-small, and as the lounge chairs are right next to the pool, children cannot hardly swim and play. There is a nice indoor pool which we would have paid the 15 euros for, but children under 16 are not permitted. It is not central to anything, but a ten-minute walk will get you to olympic village or towards town. Morever the staff seemed very snobby to people with children, and I think they should try to cater to all of their paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BasilEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in february. When we arrived their computer was down so we were escorted to the lounge and given some wine (free). We were given free upgrades to their Junior Suites - 10th Floor with a huge window and spectacular view over the sea. Some rooms face inwards and the view would be very restriced so best to get a sea facing room. The room was large with a king size comfortable bed, plenty of wardrobe space etc. superb marble bathroom with 2 showers, 2 wash hand basis and all the extras you normally get in a hotel but many more (only downside is there is no door so no real privacy). The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was the best selection we have had in a hotel. We did not use the Spa but it looked very nice. The hotel is slightly out of the main town but easy access from Metro or taxi's but it is in a quiet location whihc we liked. All in all we thought it an excellent hotel and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “H10 Hotel is a very nice hotel ”
Reviews.Author: nsaul
Reviews.Content: The most important thing to us,was the standard of the room.The room was way above average,and we felt as if we had won the lottery,it was very,very smart and well equiped.The bathroom was in complete marble - with the largest bed we have ever had. The location was ok ,about 5 mins walk to the nearest tube,but it was not a problem.The staff were freindly and efficient.we did not eat there so we have no views.City center was only a couple of stops,on the underground. All in all it was excellent value for the weekend. It was quiet at night,if there was something we were not keen on ,it was the bar in reception,its ok for a couple of drinks,but no atmostphere. All in all a fantastic quality hotel.We would not hesitate in going back

Reviews.Title: “Lovely valentines break”
Reviews.Author: blissett
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11.30pm on fri 10th greated very warmly by reception although no cava!! We used the metro system a great deal very good value and only 3 min walk from hotel,we used at night also but watched our backs at all times.I cannot fault the hotel one bit for what a deal we managed to get so shop around and enjoy.We will definately return again and will recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lozloz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the H10 Marina. We arrived at the bus station and the cab only cost 6 euro to get to the hotel. On arrival we were greeted with a glass of cava and an upgrade to a junior suite! Fantastic! Huge room and the staff were very friendly whilst checking in. We were also given tips by the staff of the best bars to visit to avoid tourist traps! Unfortunately i was mugged on my first night (near la Ramblas) even though i had been to the city before and was fully aware of the street crime - it still happened - so be careful! When i got back to the hotel the reception staff were excellent - they telephoned the police and then booked me a cab to get to the police station, and they checked on me the next day - i couldn't have asked for anything more! The hotel would have got 5 stars but the location is slightly too far away from the city centre for my liking. Its a good 10 - 15 minute walk to Port Olympic and about 25 - 30 mins to la ramblas. Fantastic hotel, lovely rooms, fantastic breakfasts and the prices of the drinks in the bar and the mini bar are fairly cheap by hotel standards. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister was getting married and wanted a nice hen night abroad so we chose Girona, we stumbled across the H10 Marina and we were glad.13 girls on a hen night in barcelona, the hotel was magnificent. The rooms were just had it had been described, the beds were changed each day with new towels it was so nice. The breakfast was AMAZING, beyond your imagination, we woke up each day in our sunshades( well as a result of the previous night) but we had to attend breakfast. I was very impressed with the hotel as you tend to get lots of hotels promoting things that do not appear on arrival at the hotel. My bars, restaurants were amazing and affordable, my sister had a fantastic time and i will defintely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, great food”
Reviews.Author: tsaunders
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marina for 3 nights in December 2005. We managed to get a very special rate - £180 for 3 nights on a B&B basis, so shop around before you book! The hotel is only 3-5 minutes walk from Bogatell metro, which then takes you into the heart of Barcelona in around 10 mins. The fare is very reasonable (around 80p for a single journey) and the service frequent until late at night. The hotel greets guests with a glass of cava when they check in (although we missed out on this because they were busy), and we even got a chocolate on our pillow on the first night be stayed with them. The room was clean, well decorated, and well stocked with everything from combs, toothbrushes to the usual shower gel etc. The minibar was also well stocked at the usual prices. The hotel bar on the ground floor was manned with friendly bar staff, but little touches such as bowls of nuts, often seen at other hotels of this standard, were missing. The tapas bar was never open in the 3 days we were at the hotel, despite adverts to the contrary. The restaurant evening meals were good quality, reasonably priced, and there was free cava and 'nibbles' buffet to start. The buffet breakfast was fantastic, really good range of everything from fruits, cakes, cheese, meats and bread - even cava again! We never got to try the spa facilities, as there was so much to see in the town. We walked 5 minutes down to Port Olimpic and joined the Bus Turistic on 2 days - hop on hop off for 2 days 21 Euros each - 2 separate routes covering all the well- and lesser-known sights in the town. We highly recommend this! Port Olimpic also has loads of bars and restaurants, mainly featuring seafood, but we found some veggie stuff too! All in all, a fantastic hotel in a handy location.

Reviews.Title: “Not too close, not too far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The H10 Marina Barcelona hotel is quite new with modern furnishings, decor and artwork. We had champagne on arrival and our luggage was brought to our room. The room, also modern in style was long and narrow, with a great bathroom and showed a few signs of wear and tear. Breakfast in the morning is buffet style, with a lot of choice. The restaurant meal was nice, but it lacked atmosphere. Overall the hotel was good, but the walls are paper thin and we could hear everything in the rooms eitherside of us, not nice. The location of the hotel is great. Its near the Parc de la Ciutadella, the largest park in Barcelona which has the zoo, with 400 species of animal and also the site of the Catalan Parliament. Great for romantic walks on route to any excursion. We found ourselves to be walking distance to the beach, La Rambla, Barri Gotic and Placa de Catalunya, the centre point of the city to get the airport bus, the metro (underground), tourist information and the central pick up point for the Barcelona Bus Turistic's three routes around the city (the green route runs in the summer only). The bus Turistic is the best way to see the city and isn't expensive, you can hop on and off as often as you like. The red route was our favourite, anything Gaudi, and in particular Park Guell and La Pedrera. On the blue route the favourite was Barri Gotic (The Gothic Quarter), the city's 2000 year old historical origins, built on the old Roman town. Its absolutely beautiful and has the Musea d'Historia, the Cathedral, the Picasso museaum and also great shops, boutiques etc. Its a fantastic city, which has something to offer everyone.

Reviews.Title: “I would go again”
Reviews.Author: tararose
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for a shopping trip and we booked Hotel Marina over the internet and said we would spend one night but end up staying three nights there. The staff were very firendly and best of all the spoke english which is alot of help, the room was very clean and the location was perfect 8 min walk to the beech and two stops away by metro into the city centre.the only problem was the taxi's at night from the hotel into the town centre they charged what they like but the hotel was great i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: darkjedi23
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I looked forward to our break in Barcelona and we weren't to be disappointed. The hotel itself is a 20-30 minute drive from the airport, along the way you can see some of the amazing buildings in the town centre. If you have time please go on a bus tour! Upon arrival we were dealt with superbly at reception and checked in (and out) with ease. The room was very modern and roomy. The kingsize bed was a dream to sleep in and we had no trouble dozing off for our own siesta! The only drawbacks was a faulty/leaking sink but this was repaired rapidly and the fact that a telephone number for reception wasn't readily available/visible. Very minor gripes in an otherwise super stay. The breakfast buffet was great. So much to chose from - the only other problem we found was that the seating plan was very cramped, it was almost as if the other table could see what you were putting on your fork as they were so close. H10 Marina is a good 10 minute walk from the beach. Once there you will find numerous seafood restaurants and the Grand Casino - which gives you free entry if you stay at H10. Personally, we absolutely fell in love with the city and the H10 Marina is a very nice modern hotel and we can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “A very mixed stay”
Reviews.Author: jocov
Reviews.Content: Hotel H10 Marina was ok but the standard of our room and the service once we complained were definitly not up to the standard that you would expect from a four star hotel. When we arrived, the outside window did not close, the main light did not work, the shower head was broken and the sink was nearly hanging off the wall. We reported these on our first full day there and waited for something to be done. After four full days of living in a dark room, with an unlocked window, getting the whole of the bathroom soaked every time we had a shower and being afraid when we brushed our teeth that the sink would fall on our toes, we left! We had complained several times, reported the facts to reception and the cleaning staff. In the end we got ten euros off our mini bar bill. It is a shame because the hotel itself was quite nice looking. The roof swimming pool is fine but not good for children or people wanting to swim...maybe it should be described as more of a water hole for cooling off while sunbathing! It is very small and people sunbathe all round the edge so no splashing allowed!! The indoor swimming pool was 12 euros 50 for the day. Massages etc were good. Location is very good 5 euro taxi ride to placa catalunya and it is walkable. Again, not far to the port olympico with lots of things to do there including the beach. Overall, I think that we had a bad experience of this hotel and is perhaps best for business people rather than holiday makers.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend there with my wife... Nice hotel, we'd definitely go again. The rooftop pool is very small (think postage stamp) and we couldnt get near it. The location is good for the beach/Olympic Port (5 minute walk). The area is a bit eerie after dark. But a few drinks down at the port and youll soon forget that ;-) Alternatively get a cab! Its about 6/7 Euros to the ramblas/Placa Catalunya in a cab. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: angels232
Reviews.Content: this hotel was brilliant altho on some reviews it says about the surrounding streets being run down we were not put off at all the hotel is in a superb spot for all areas 5 mins walk from all the resturants and night clubs in the olympic port the rooms are gorgeous and as we got a late deal it was such a good deal the staff there are so helpful and friendly. we had a day in the spa and indoor pool and it was heaven altho was 12.50 euros a day it was well worth it. the outdoor pool was lovely altho only 3 ft deep and if the sun is out there is a bit of a scramble for the sunbeds!! its very relaxing up there tho with all the views to look at, also the outdoor pool bar was only open at funny times and not at all one day we were gasping for an ice cream!! the breakfast was the most amazing one ive ever had they had everything you can imagine and as much as you want even champagne and strawberries! cooked english, continental with cheeses and meats crossiants boiled eggs and much much more! well worth the 15 euros in general the hotel staff spoke very good english but when you step foot out of the hotel you will need youre phrase book! the taxi drivers are hard to talk to so take the hotel card to get back to it again! there is a tour bus that we were very impressed with you can hop on and off all day as much as you want to and they speak good english too better than getting taxis!! mind you if there is a paticular spot you want to see eg the cathedral then you will need to get off the bus and get on the next one at that stop because on the bus you only have a few seconds to see it as they drive past the blue tour is the best route round the old port etc for drinks in the evening the hotel is very reasonable and the port resturants are good prices too however the night clubs/disco tecs are very expencive it was 18 euros for 2 vodka and cokes they do have male and female pole dancers in one place though hehe

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: from airport its a 25-30 Euro juorney by taxi or if you like you can experience the metro. take the shuttle train from airport to plaza catalunya. WATCH for PICKPOCKETS(2.50 Euros each) then join the red line metro to marina station..(2 euros each) walk down Mariina St to Bogatell + turn left. Hotel a short distance. Dont be put off by the graffitti. some of it is very artistic. Fantastic hotel, good staff, great rooms, although we only slept in it lol. Brekky is 16 Euros each if not included in holiday(fantastic buffet),beer at Hotel cheap, Spirits ooer dont!! dont buy spirits in Barca as beer is v.cheap(Estrella Damm) great restaurants nearby.(6 euros for 2 course + a beer!!!). Local shops + pharmacies close by. Beach is 10 mins walk. number 14 bus to Las Ramblas,(red bus route) although we bought the passes for Bus Turistic tours(on Bus). 1 day pass(17Euro).2 days (21 Euro)etc You get 3 routes Green.Blue + Red Hop on + hop off system. Map provided . Fantastic way to view whole city.its a must try experience. Marina area has bars,pole dancers lol etc.. hard rock cafe in Pl Catalunya is a must. Taxi from same to Marina Hotel was 5 Euros fantastico!! lol. Last thing!!! Watch pickpockets. when eating out or drinking.Do NOT leave your phone,cash or camera ETC on the table. 4 Women tried to steal My new Phone from inder nose by holding a sheet of paper over it + begging for money..Lucky i caught on quik + seen it. Be warned

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fontana79
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel although we had few problems/issues. In total we booked three rooms (2 twins/1 single) for 5 people. In two of the rooms, only got few TV stations, whilst in other, got plenty of stations. Air condition didn't work properly in one of the rooms, complained three times, nothing got done so we left it as it is. During our stay, one of the lifts was broken down and there was a long wait for lifts during peak hours. The nearest Metro Station to the hotel is Bogatell. On the way to and from the station, it just smelled of sewage. Very hard to avoid. We really enjoyed the breakfast hall and the drinks lounge on ground floor. Overall, the facilities provided in lower ground floor (Swimming Pool, Sauna, Jacuzzi, Steam Room) were great and I recommend them highly if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Swim into this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: R-LIL'S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and what a fantastic hotel...nice, clean, friendly and very near the beach. The staff were very helpful and very friendly and they all spoke English. The rooms were a bit small but were very bright and clean, and everything was provided even a shaving kit and toothbrush (I forgot mine). The breakfast buffet was fit for a king there was so much to chose from (hot and cold) what a great start to the day. The beach was only 5 minutes walk away and the famous Port Vell (la Ramblas) was an enjoyable 30 minutes walk. The restaurants and clubs in Port Olympic are well worth a visit, something to suit all. The hotel bar was a friendly place to sit and chill in the evenings, with nice comfortable sofas and chairs. The outdoor pool on floor 8 was very nice and clean and what a great view of Barcelona from this high up. Barcelona is a fantastic City, I will be returning to this hotel within the next few weeks...I love it. I would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “great location great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very close to the olympic port, excellent stuff, impressive breakfast, large rooms, nice poo . The airconditioning needs to be checked, not bad but it can be better! Avoid hotels at las ramblas! The real night life and good restaurants are near the olympic port. Very good location to all the major sites especially Sagrada Familia. Please note that I am a travel agent from Greece and its my 5th group this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SBCMarlborough
Reviews.Content: I had read a few reviews about this hotel after i had made the booking !! i was slightly worried about location i must admit taxi driver didn't know were it was so we had to help with map etc but once we had arrived we found staff very helpful hotel very clean amazing breakfast only 10 minutes walk to beach i admit a long walk to city but we took in all the ambiance of barcelona on way to sum up great hotel fantastic city will certainly return don't be put of by the graffiti.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reception very friendly, service in the restaurant very efficient. Accommodation was really comfortable. Breakfast was superb. Location ideal for evening walks to the harbour and wandering around the many restaurants. We didn't want to stay in the middle of Barcelona but access to the city centre was easy via the metro. We did hire a car from Girona Airport but only used it for transfer and excursion to Montserrat. If we return to Barcelona I'd love to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Take some ear plugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DancingqueenSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and chose this hotel because of its location close to the sandy beach. It was an easy 10 minute pleasant stroll to the beach where Port Olympic has some fantastic restaurants. If you are a beach lover as we are, this is a perfect location because you are close to the beach and can walk (25mins) to La Ramblas or get the Toursit Bus or metro. On arrival we were upgraded to a suite due to usual guest rooms being full due to a conference. The room was superb. However there were no tea / coffee making facilities. We had heard reviews about the noise but no one could have prepared us for how thin the walls were. The couple next door kept us awake for two nights due to their lovemaking which at first was a laugh but in the early hours of the morning after a busy day sightseeing, sleep is welcomed. It was impossible to sleep and EVERY noise could be heard as if there were no walls. We have never been in a hotel where you can here everything!!!!!!! I would recommend this hotel but take ear plugs or plan to stay awake lovemaking yourselves!!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for phone charges”
Reviews.Author: gclat
Reviews.Content: Great rooms. Be careful, their "wellness center" not open on any holidays (which happen continually in Spain). Got hit with high phone charges on local calls. Their Internet line didn't work and I used a modem. I now own part of the hotel ($30 for less than an hour of local calls). WATCH THAT. Otherwise a great hotel for the price. Room and others were great for price.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, Clean & Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sugarbabe61
Reviews.Content: Feb 2005. Just returned from 3 nights at H10 Marina. The room was excellent, on the first floor and very well equipped. A HUGE bed as well!! As others have said the breakfasts are amazing. I have never seen such a wide choice of different foods. Nice to see the very healthy options too. I was a little apprehensive after reading other reviews re the area. However we did not find the area to be run down, admitted it was in a residential area and there was grafitti about. However, look around Barcelona and you will see quite a bit of "grafitti". It is not illegal over there and is encouraged, also it was more like art than grafitti. The only things we didn't like about the hotel were the over inflated bar prices. 19 Euros for 2 Gin and tonics and a small beer. Also we were half board and 2 nights of the 3, we got no choice in our starter or main course and were told what we would be having!! Also as others have said, the walls are thin and the hotel can be noisy at night. We did a full day Barcelona tour but would not recommend this. We were dropped off at the Spanish Village at 11.40, lunch was included and was scheduled for 13.00 and we were being picked up at 15.00 for the remainder of the afternoon tour. You can see all of the Spanish Village in half an hour so we were thoroughly bored, freezing cold and totally fed up being stuck there for all that time. We travelled about on the Metro, we had done lots of research on Barcelona and the scum people who pickpocket. We carried very little. However on the 2nd day, on the crowded metro, these scum attempted without success, to pickpocket hubby. Fortunately he had cottoned on very early that they were suspicious. They tried to move in behind him as though they were getting off the Metro, they hid their hands by carrying their jacket over them. When I say they, this was one guy who attempted this but there was 3 of them. They got off the metro, ran down the platform, and got back on the Metro further up. This sadly put a great dampner on the whole break and made me feel very uneasy for the rest of the time. Overall we would definitely recommend the H10 Marina but take your own drink and eat out at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In March 2003 we stayed there for four nights, the hotel was amazing the breakfast was the biggest and best ever and the rooms were spotless. The only downfall was the location although within a 10 minute walk you were at the metro and the taxi services were very handy. Overall a great hotel in an amazing city, we have now got the h10 bug and are next visiting a h10 in tenerife.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few days in Barcelona from 8 -12 November 2004. We had booked via the internet to stay at the H10 Marina. We were collected at the airport and on our arrival at the hotel were informed by reception staff (Allessandra - sorry if this is spelt wrong) who informed us that they were having technical difficulties with our room!! and we were to be transferred to another H10 hotel in the city centre. We returned to the Marina the following morning to be met by Allessandrsa again who welcomed us with a beaming smile and stated that she had a very good room for us. Indeed they did, we were put into one of the Junior suits on the tenth floor. What a room and what a view. Our stay in the hotel was very enjoyable. The staff were very friendly and although I attempted a little Spanish all staff cloud speak English very well. I had read a few reviews of the hotel on the web before going to Barcelona, some favourable, some critical. In brief - the hotel was excellent as were the staff. Breakfast was very good and the choice plentiful. The distance from the city centre I did not find too great, I enjoy walking and taking in the sights wherever I go. The nearest metro station was only five minutes walk away and although in a quiet area I never once felt threatened although my wife did say she felt uneasy. The graffitti never bothered me. Lets face it whatever city you visit I am sure most folk have come across graffitti of some form or another. Barcelona is a wonderful city well worth visiting and I most certainly would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mjo4tyz
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend styed here last year on 17th dec 2003! well what can i say! it was in a developing area, but i just overlook that! we walked in the hotel it was beautifull! the staff were friendly and very good at there job. our room was lovely very modern and stylish. The location well reading the reviews from other people the are critsing it saying it is a 40 min walk! well you dont have to walk any where just catch the underground it takes about 5 mins to walk to and you are at your destination in no time! las ramblas can be rough at night so i recommend you stay out of it h10 marina is a 5* in every thing. The food is brilliant try everything!!!! anyone can feel free to email me!! thanx joanne

Reviews.Title: “Location is a major downfall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights Sept 2004. A very modern, big hotel with friendly enough staff. Don't expect the personal touch that you get in smaller hotels but it's run efficiently. Breakfast was fantastic. Roof top pool was nice, but small. The big problem with this hotel is it's location. Close to the beach (which isn't very clean by the way), the casino and the olympic port, but not close to anywhere else worth noting. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the nearest Metro station, and it's not a very pleasant 10 minute walk after dark. It's based in the Olympic area of Barcelona which must have been impressive enough back in 1992, but unfortunately the area has been let go and looks a bit shabby by now. We didn't feel very safe in the hotel's neighbourhood after dark and used taxi's to get around. The hotel is a two minute walk away from a very daunting and grim looking prison. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for tourists who want to see the sights of Barcelona. You'd be better off spending your money on a decent enough hotel closer to the centre and in a more pleasant area. So, an expensive hotel with good facilities and service, but location lets it down bigtime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theresa2828
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 11 nights in August 2004. Found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable we upgraded to a room with a balcony and they kindly supplied us with sunbeds. The breakfast was excellent and the choice was best I have seen. Thought the wellness centre was rather expensive but if you booked treatments which were very reasonably priced and excellent you got free entry to pool etc. We sat and watched people working on the grafitte walls outside and if you take a closer look you will find them very well done by people who can actually draw. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - but stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at it in mid-august. The location is not good. It's three blocks from a metro stop but the area around the stop and the hotel looked abandoned no matter what hour we walked through it. It looked like the hotel was built for the Olympics but didn't have the economic infrastructure to support a longterm and sustainable economy around it. Inside the hotel is nice though. The bar is small with an unfriendly but attentive staff. Lots of other tourists were there (I think the 80 euros a night price was right for this four star hotel). The room was large, mattress was WAY too firm and the bathroom was sparse - but everything was well designed. Nice artwork. The staff was not good though - the told the wrong pick-up time for a cab we hired to take us to the airport and we had to pay for that time, they entered our room when the do not disturb sign was on, and they were overall rude at the bar. The check-in person was friendly and attentive though. I'd say go somewhere else because this place was so mediocre. It worked as a hotel, but didn't have any flare to it. Spend the extra couple of dollars and stay more central, closer to a metro stop. If you like the nightlife though, stay here. It's about two blocks away from the casino and Port Olympica. And the beach is nearby too. Oh, the pool is really small and if there are more than two or three people on the roof, it looks crowded. Don't stay in the place expecting the pool to be available or look appealing - even in the august heat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A Great Hotel, Great Location , 5 minutes walk to the marina where you can catch the tourist bus, eat or hit the beach, 2 minute walk to the metro. Fantasatic Breakfast. We were dubious about staying at the marina because of previous reviews but we loved it. Staff were friendly and the rooms were Brilliant. A really Great Hotel. Don't worry about the graffiti, it's not as bad as it sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in the WORLD!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and 7 friends stayed at the hotel in July for my 30th Birthday. Barcelona was full that week as the city was hosting a major conference so we did not have much choice of hotel. However the H10 Marina turned out to be the PERFECT hotel. The staff were fantastic, rooms very clean, great swimming pool and they serve the biggest breakfast I have ever seen!! Despite other comments on the location the hotel is withn walking distance of the beach, old town and next to a very nice park. Our stay at the H10 Marina was 2nd to none!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel - location good, metro superb!”
Reviews.Author: GordonWorcester
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night stay. OK, the immediate area is not perfect, but it certainly isn't a problem. The nearest Metro is a 2 minute walk, there are a number of back street bars and shops if you don't want to pay hotel prices (which are not expensive - 2.5 Euro for a beer from the mini bar in your room). The city centre is a 5 minute Metro ride, the beach a 10 minute walk and once the local building work is complete all will be fine. The breakfasts are superb, the staff very helpful and the hotel spotlessly clean. The Wellness Centre costs 12.5 Euro a day, but is a VIP experience. Oh, and to round off your stay, take the luxury hotel transfer to the airport fir 28 Euro. Go for it - you won't regret it!! Also the metro is super efficient with a train at worst every 5 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: ALG027
Reviews.Content: Having heard nightmare stories of noise, nuisance and trouble from people who had stayed in and around the Ramblas we chose this hotel for a three night break and were not disappointed. Yes it is a little way from the heart of things but was easily accessible by metro and we never felt the need to use a taxi. The ten minute walk to the beach is not unpleasant and is worth the effort. The general level of service is good but be careful if you eat in the restaurant as the translation of the menu into English is literal and can be misleading, however the food is excellent even if it is a surprise! The bedrooms are scandinavian in style but be warned the mattress was extremely firm even compared to our orthopaedic one at home. We felt the hotel was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “If only the taxi drivers knew the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was pleasant enough - rooms were clean, pool clean although small, Spa area very relaxing, and the food that we had there was more than adequate. Its great that you are in walking distance of the Village in order for nightlife ( we were on a Hen weekend, and certainly made the most of it) and the bus stop for the city trips wasnt far. However, the surrounding are is a little bit run down, and extemly quiet! We had a problem getting a taxi home at night - many of the drivers had absolutely no idea where we were staying - and carrying the address & hotel telephone number didnt help! All in all we had a great weekend, and we certainly got value for money.
